About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of our 15,000 employees across the world. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us? About the team This is a fantastic new opportunity within the Reinsurance in the L&H In-force Solutions EMEA Team, whose remit is to execute on different technical aspects on the in-force book to improve its value! The team is part of the Portfolio Management unit, and we collaborate with our direct insurance clients to deploy a professional suite of solutions for lapse reduction and improvement of policyholder engagement and customer experience. As a Customer Experience Manager, you will be asked discovering insights on the customer journey and experience, identify and prioritize opportunities for improvement and collaborate with clients to seize them by using techniques in engagement and retention. You will closely work with other Functions in L&H EMEA and exchange with central teams to develop further the suite of proprietary, customer related solutions. About the role Conduct analysis on engagement of customers and their experience, specifically on the retail parts of the L&H portfolio and across different markets in EMEA, products and distribution channels. This encompasses the assessment of client retention capabilities, economic sensitivity and propensity studies (e.g. propensity to lapse, to buy etc.), Translate such insights into meaningful and impactful interventions: present such interventions to clients, support and follow up on execution, measure and monitor results through the definition of key performance indicators Understand, and be able to discuss, the expected and actual outcomes on retention experience across key treaties, reasons for A/E lapse variance and propose appropriate mitigation strategies to control lapse risk Work together with Technical Accounting, Experience Analysis, Data Scientists and other teams to understand available data sets and gaps for timely monitoring. Client reviews Perform reviews to assess the retention capabilities of our clients and the engagement of their customers through a blend of analysis and interviews with management and operators. Synthesize results and pitch solutions Conduct constructive and fact-based conversations with clients on improvement areas and planning for customer experience and retention activities moving forward Develop standards and coherently synthesize lessons and experiences and apply them to L&H EMEA and its clients. Effectively communicate relevant outcomes About you Demonstrated ability and experience in Customer Engagement and Experience management, ideally at a primary insurance or in insurance consulting Thorough understanding of L&H primary insurance along the whole value chain (ie Sales, Claims, Retention Management, Marketing) Ability to carry out analysis on large data set from several sources and generate valuable, impactful insights Good understanding of lapse drivers (ie arising from process, behavior or incentives) and of the EMEA insurance industry, of main products and services You possess good communication and presentation skills and are able to engage with all hierarchies across different business functions. You bring a can- do attitude and creative approach and feel comfortable working in an area that is fluid and dynamic Proficient in English (oral and written) is a requirement proficiency in German would be advantageous. The role will be preferably based either in Zurich or London. Though other locations may be considered. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Swiss Re

Customer and Service Success Manager (gn) Location : Name Linked SoftwareONE, Leipzig, Germany Posted Date 12 hours ago(5/21/2021 6:41 PM) ID 2021-10470 Why SoftwareONE?   SoftwareONE is a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions, headquartered in Switzerland. With around 7,800 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 90 countries, SoftwareONE provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers. Strong together: In a strategic partnership with RIB Software, we will significantly influence the digital transformation of the architecture, construction and engineering industry with the help of a world-leading cloud solution. Help us as to drive the digitalisation of the world's largest industry as Customer and Service Success Manager (gn) location: Leipzig/Zwenkau (and surrounding area), available immediately, permanent contract, full-time. The role As a Service Success Manager, you will provide support to customer stakeholders across, CxO, Operations and Business Units. You will have excellent skills at developing relationships which will allow you to understand the objectives and particular challenges of the customer organization to ensure they realize the full benefits of the MTWO solution and experience the highest levels of service and engagement with SoftwareONE. You will conduct business reviews with your customer stakeholders providing insight on all relevant aspects of customer implementations and usage and optimization. You will provide escalation management for Critical and Major customer Incidents and Service Requests keeping your customer up-to-date on resolution progress You will complete Root Cause Analysis of Critical and Major Incidents raised by the customer to optimize the experience for the customer and SoftwareONE. You will provide technical and systems management advisory services. Providing skills transfer and customer readiness through the remote delivery of workshops, training events, and so forth. You will relay market needs and requirements back to internal SoftwareONE teams for future service and solution development You will mentor team members and assist them with their professional development You will provide input to account business plans to position SoftwareONE and MTWO appropriately You will provide thought leadership in highly complex projects/programs throughout the pre-sales and initial planning process You will possess a detailed understanding of the end-to-end onboarding process Through our internal training, you will be considered an expert on MTWO. What we need to see from you Ideally a technical degree in an AEC or IT related field of study Relevant experience in a service delivery/ customer management role Experience in managed cloud or ERP solutions delivery and implementation Ability to converse with senior customer stakeholders Desire to work in fast-paced, challenging environment Excellent communications skills with the ability to manage challenging conversations in a professional manner Listening to customers, probing for business process pains and opportunities, in an effort to meet or exceed their expectations Proven ability to influence others and lead customer engagements Strong ownership, bias for action and willingness to role-up your sleeves Detailed understanding of organizational structure, delivery requirements and services provided within practice domain of expertise What we have to offer A career within an innovative company with a unique corporate culture Top rating on glassdoor/kununu A company car of your choice The option to work from home A variety of training and development opportunities We trust you our working hours are flexible and not recorded! A work-life balance with 30 vacation days and the option of a sabbatical An employee appreciation program called 'Motivosity' With our employee share and recommendation program, you benefit from our success. Top technical equipment for your new job! No dress code wear what you feel comfortable in! Have we piqued your interest? If yes, we are looking forward to receiving your compelling application documents, including information on your availability (starting date) and salary expectations. Please use our online form to apply. Please be advised. Due to this new venture being a close partnership between SoftwareONE and RIB Software, your details may be shared between the two companies. You can read the data privacy statement of SoftwareONE here and RIB Software here. What you should really know about us. “Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful. Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success” – Patrick Winter, Founder. What we expect from our employees Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics. Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy. Switzerland - Zrich Compliance Group Functions Job Reference # 215592BR City Zrich Job Type Full Time Your role Your role will focus on system and process responsibilities of our Name and Media Screening Solution Tools. They are part of the Banks strategic platform as key tools to identify Anti-Money Laundering Risks. This involves user support, executing application controls, designing metrics solutions for reporting purposes, support in model governance processes, requirements engineering support as well as process design and implementation. As part of the overall global implementation project you'll have exchanges globally with Financial Crime Prevention colleagues, but also IT and external vendors. This requires good communication and planning skills. Your team Your future team, the Name & Media Screening Team, is within Financial Crime Prevention unit, part of UBS Group Compliance, Regulatory & Governance function. We are owners of the Banks primary AML / KYC system. They are used globally to support initial and ongoing vetting of customers and partners against AML relevant list and media content, for example sanctioned parties, PEPs (Politically Exposed Persons) and content sourced by national and international regulatory authorities. We ensure day to day operations but also drive the future development agenda of the systems involved. We are diverse, motivated, focused and driven by the importance the systems and processes we provide to the bank. We understand ourselves as team working together and supporting each other to achieve our demanding targets. Your expertise Ideally you will have a university or equivalent diploma including experience in Banking (front or back office role) including possibly other areas of Compliance, Regulatory and Governance functions Project management experience would be beneficial You have technical skill to understand application and database set ups and you are able to write database queries (e.g. SQL) Preferably you will be fluent in German or English You are a highly motivated team-player with the ability to work independently, methodically and precisely even on repetitive tasks You are able to prioritize, to assess information, to make decisions and to communicate and support those decisions with rational argument You are innovative and proactive in order to achieve your goals About us Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world. We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. Contact Details UBS Business Solutions AG UBS Recruiting Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

See job description for details Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Your field of responsibility We offer a challenging senior position within the First Line of Defense Support (FLDS) team, the inhouse center of competence in risk matters for the Private Banking markets of Russia, Israel, East-ern Europe and Central Asia. An outstanding opportunity to work in a meaningful role on risk related projects and act as a sparring partner for the senior management and all Business Area functions in dealing with operational and conduct risks of BA Emerging Europe. In collaboration with central risk functions you contribute to the evolution of the Risk and Control (R&C) Framework of the Emerging Europe business, develop and implement best practice standards for the Business Area, as well as support identifying, analyzing and mitigating overarching risk pat-terns. Coordinate, prepare and document risk related Committees, sound with stakeholders and drive follow-up actions. A chance to cover the business risk management needs of Emerging Europe units and act as a committed SME for specific risk related topics. An important platform for your personal and professional development in a highly dynamic and inter-national environment, with exposure to many different areas within the Bank. Your future colleagues We are a dynamic team of highly professional experts which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm's D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. You are results oriented, dedicated and hardworking with a high level of integrity and attention to detail. We are looking for a motivated colleague with the fol-lowing skills set: • University degree or equivalent (preferably in the areas of business administration, econom-ics or law) • Track record of at least 5 years in Business Risk Management, Legal, Compliance, Consult-ing, Audit or in a front position within Private Banking • Sound experience in leading impactful projects, tackling complex issues and executing initia-tives in the context of a large organization • Ability to perform excellent stakeholder management and build and maintain trusted relation-ships at senior management level • Team player with strong analytical and conceptual skills combined a structured, solution ori-ented approach • Highly engaged and able to prioritize your own workload even while working under pressure • Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and to simplify complex issues to facilitate and expedite the decision making process • Fluency in written and spoken German and English • Finally, you understand the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work. The theoretical and computational methods group at the Swiss ABB research center develops and improves theoretical models and numerical tools relevant to ABB products and technologies. We support and drive the development of ABBs next-generation products and solutions. We are looking for an outstanding physicist or mathematician to join our group, to strengthen our modelling capabilities especially in the fields of monitoring, diagnostics and prognostics. This is a unique opportunity for someone with a desire to combine mathematical methods and physical understanding in order to drive new digital solutions in the field of electrical devices and systems. If you are passionate about science and technology and want to work in an inspiring environment where your skills are used to address important questions, then apply now.Your responsibilitiesYour backgroundMore about usBring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Lets write the future, together. Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your full application (motivation letter, CV, references) only via our online careers tool. Furthermore, you facilitate and steer continuous assessment and further development of culture governance at Credit Suisse. Your future colleagues Become part of our small team with a passion for culture topics and managing change. In this role you will work with a variety of internal partners such as teams across Human Resources and Communications as well as with stakeholders across the Divisions and Corporate Functions to embed sustainable behavioral change. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Qualifications Interested in being part of this exciting journey? You’ll be a good match, if you have/are: Ability to shape the culture agenda and develop convincing presentations of facts and proposals Deep understanding of behavioral change and experience in successfully managing change projects Excellent command of English language Comfortable with data analysis Proactivity and communication and influencing abilities Ability to navigate a large corporation and effectively deal with many different constituencies Ambitious, convincing nature – flexible and with can-do-attitude Strong team player Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives *LI-CSJOB* Ms. Hiestand would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal. Credit Suisse

The position We are looking for a passionate Principal UX Designer in User Research and Design to join our Global Diagnostics User Experience Team (DIA UX). In this exciting role you will be working on the transformation of user and customer experience in healthcare together with a multicultural highly motivated team. Key responsibilities Architect the user research and usability testing for strategic, complex projects. Coach and mentor designers through the completion of user research and usability testing. Translate user research into powerful insights that impact design and business decisions. Communicate powerful insights to business stakeholders. Concept, design and plan user research studies in collaboration with a product team, e.g. choose the right methodology or formulating hypotheses. Prepare in detail user research activities, e.g. creation of screeners, questionnaires, interview guides. Document and consolidate research results from different sources into brief, concise, actionable insights and stories for design and product teams. Translate collected insights into UX deliverables such as user journeys, service blueprints, personas. Coordinate user research activities with external agencies. Who you are You are someone who likes a combination of hands-on project work and leadership, looking to work for a company where your career can grow as your interests do, across functions and geographies. Where you are valued for all of your passions and interests. Bachelors degree in Applied Psychology or equivalent (preferred) Strong abilities in Research & Insight Analysis Medical device domain experience (preferred) Experienced and trained in Graphic or Visual Design as well as design research Great presentation and communication skills as well as experience in moderating workshops Hands-on pragmatic experience in translating research learnings into design and product decisions Fluent in English Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Postdoctoral Researcher / Research Scientist of Nanofabrication 100%, Zurich, fixed-term The Nanomaterials Engineering Research Group at the Institute for Chemical and Bioengineering (?url=www.shihlab.ethz.ch&module=jobs&id=52929" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">www.shihlab.ethz.ch) is an interdisciplinary team composed of chemical engineers, physicists, chemists, materials scientists, and electrical engineers focusing on physics and chemistry of nanomaterials for advancing nanomaterials-based electronics and optoelectronics. Job description This position involves multiple projects carried out within the research group, aimed at understanding and engineering nanomaterials assembly and processing under nanoscale confinement for scalable optoelectronics. A successful candidate should demonstrate a solid academic background and experience in focused-ion-beam milling and/or e-beam photolithography. Your profile The candidate should have a Ph.D. degree in natural sciences or engineering, with a strong interest in nanostructural and nanomaterial engineering. ETH Zurich ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow. Line of Service Assurance Industry/Sector Not Applicable Specialism Assurance Management Level Associate Job Description & Summary Deine Aufgaben - Du fhrst eigenverantwortlich Datenanalysen durch. - Du konzipierst und setzt relationalen und dimensionalen Datenmodellen nach gngigen Best Practices und mit modernen Tools (DWH Automatisierung) um (Verantwortung Solution- und Daten-Architektur). - Du bereitest Daten fr statistische Modellierung auf und untersttzt interne Kunden mit spezifischen Auswertungen. - Du arbeitest eng mit Kollegen aus der ASR Academy zusammen, entwickelst gemeinsam massgeschneiderte Lsungen. - Du untersttzt das Team bei der internen Weiterentwicklung von Prozessen und technischen Werkzeugen und kannst aktiv an Gestaltung und Ausbau im Bereich des Reporting und Monitorings mitwirken. - Du entwickelst dein technisches Know-how und deine Soft Skills durch On-and-off-the-job-Trainings weiter. - Du arbeitest in einem diversifizierten Team in einem internationalen Netzwerk und erhltst regelmssig Feedback von Kollegen und Vorgesetzten. Dein Profil - Du hast einen Universitts-, ETH- oder Fachhochschulabschluss mit Fokus auf Analytics (z.B. in Statistik, Data Science oder Informatik) oder bringst alternativ eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit passender Praxiserfahrung mit. - Du mchtest gerne dein Wissen vertiefen und bist motiviert, dir neue Technologien anzueignen und sie einzusetzen. - Du verfgst du ber praktische Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen und Datenbanken. - Du hast Erfahrung in der Konzeption und Durchfhrung von Modellierungen und kannst die zentralen Stellhebel identifizieren. - Du hast ein Gespr fr Zusammenhnge sowie fr Datenstrukturen und deren technische Abbildung. - Du bist teamorientiert und arbeitest kundenfokussiert, hast eine analytische Auffassungsgabe und denkst ganzheitlich. - Du sprichst fliessend Deutsch und Englisch und schreibst stilsicher in beiden Sprachen. Drawing on the expertise of our Center of Excellence for Traction Engineering, we have established a leading position in the development, production, and sale of drive systems for locomotives, high-speed trains, trams, subways, and regional trains as well as rail vehicles and buses. Committed to further strengthening our highly motivated Base SW Services team in the area of Control SW Engineering, we are looking to appoint an experienced and dedicated Software Engineer with a keen interest in rail technology, software development, control systems, and power electronics. Does this job profile match your credentials? We look forward to receiving your application! Let's write the future. Together.Your responsibilitiesYour backgroundMore about usBring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Lets write the future, together. Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your full application (motivation letter, CV, references) only via our online careers tool. About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 13,000 employees across the world. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us? About the Role Are you passionate about the intersection of emerging technologies such as cloud computing, remote sensing, IoT with geospatial and risk data? Do you have the ability to put together unique cutting-edge solutions with geospatial data at its foundation? Do you have a unique combination of deep technical knowledge, modern software architecture concepts, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills? We are seeking a Geospatial Architect & Product Owner to work with our Geospatial Risk Insights expert team and clients to craft cloud-based risk intelligence and geospatial solutions. The role has the following key responsibilities: Take overall responsibility for the successful and timely delivery of Geospatial core capabilities with respective delivery DevOps teams reporting to you. Work in innovative projects that require geospatial intelligence and capabilities and provide subject matter expertise. Engage in client meetings to support with technical expertise. Review progress of all projects against the agreed strategy and project brief and when necessary identify and take steps to ensure that all agreed objectives are achieved Ensure that the teams implement Q&A and methodologies in Software Engineering and Operations. Identify, evaluate and buy or build new capabilities that will meet the current and future needs of our clients Co-develop winning value propositions and solutions together with client management, underwriting, Swiss Re Institute and P&C Solutions functions Help the team and Swiss Re's clients to develop and deliver their digital strategy Act as a technical liaison between customers, business experts, engineering teams and foster strong collaboration beyond organizational boundaries towards a coherent, consistent and world class set of geo capabilities. Work with UX, product, architecture and engineering teams in delivering solutions. Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Geo community at Swiss Re. Identify new and develop existing relationships with vendors and partners. About You You are results-oriented, you embody partnership and actively seek creative solutions to improve things. To succeed in this role, you should be an entrepreneurial self-starter with a lot of drive and positive energy. You like to run multiple projects at the same time, lead and coach delivery teams, be at the tech sales forefront and have a comprehensive, end-to-end delivery role. You are experienced in leading and developing high quality, enterprise scale software products using a structured system development lifecycle. You have in-depth knowledge of geospatial technologies and industry to drive technical service/solution direction for the product area. As a native problem-solver, you can navigate ambiguity and are not scared to try new things. You like to present concepts and solutions with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences. You can convince clients with your expertise and your ability to market our solutions. You have graduated with a Bachelors or a Master's degree in business, computer science, geoinformatics, insurance or equivalent. You have a passion to learn about how the business are using our solutions as well as the technical aspects of the solutions themselves. You would a great fit if you question and challenge the status quo and you are comfortable in an agile and fluid landscape. Finally, you should possess a range of skills and the commitment to expand them. The most important skills and experience we are looking for include (but are not limited to): Minimum of 5 years working experience in the technology industry or any other industry with a distinct focus on cloud-native technologies and geospatial technologies. Hands-on experience with geospatial technologies like geocoding, vector and raster data transformation / storage, map visualization, large geo data processing and entity extraction. Up to date on ongoing advancements in large scale geospatial processing in a cloud environment. Passionate to deliver and operate tech solutions for our clients in a cost-efficient, professional and customer-focused way. You have profound experience in converting business needs and opportunities into efficient and effective solutions. Experience in risk consulting, risk management or re-/insurance industry is a big plus. Strong commercial mentality and business acuity Excellent leadership and management skills, with experience in an international context and working across different locations. Great negotiation skills and ability to make convincing pitches to clients including C-Suite or vendor discussions. You like to work in a team and are an excellent networker and connector. You are at ease to effectively communicate across all levels of hierarchy. You do not give up easily when facing resistance. In contrary, you are motivated by challenges and find ways to convince and influence people to get to the best outcome. About the Team Swiss Re is a risk knowledge company. Our work is about predicting, preparing and protecting against the world's biggest risks so society becomes stronger. Property & Casualty IT is globally responsible for delivering solutions building and running Swiss Re's P&C Reinsurance business. We are diverse team of specialists who are passionate in providing state-of-the-art solutions for our P&C reinsurance business. Our primary objectives are to help Swiss Re's P&C business strengthen its sales dimension, enhance productivity, reduce the cost basis and be a key driver for achieving top and bottom line growth targets. We create a world-class platform for the P&C business to support the value chain end-to-end. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Are you looking for a dynamic international working environment as a Relationship Manager, Team Leader Relationship Managers, Investment Consultant or Team Leader Investment Consultants within our team in Private Banking? Then this is your chance! A front role as a senior partner in acquiring and leading client relationships, providing advice on a broad range of investment products and services tailored to the sophisticated needs of HNW/UHNW clients Market leading products, tailored solutions and services supported by a holistic advisory approach for HNW/UHNW clients Working toward specific individual, team, assets under management (AUM) as well as revenue targets Specialist knowledge and product expertise in developing solutions for clients in the creation, management and transfer of their wealth Reputation as an agile and results-oriented world-class Swiss Private Bank and the opportunity to serve as a brand ambassador Integrated OneBank business model which fosters collaboration between internal divisions, teams and specialists to deliver cross selling opportunities, especially between Investment Banking and Private Banking Exciting working environment and growth opportunities in a world leading bank You Offer Outstanding personal and professional network within the HNW/UHNW segment In a Relationship Manager role - proven track record in client acquisition and management of wealth for clients is essential Excellent client- and service-orientation as well as outstanding communication skills when interacting with sophisticated entrepreneurs and leaders Depending on the seniority of the role to be filled, the years of experience required in the financial market may vary (junior role 3-5 years, senior role up to 7 years) Strong financial product knowledge and technical competence in the understanding, development and delivery of holistic wealth planning solutions Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills, you are able to listen, guide and advise external and also internal partners Drive and motivation to work in a target oriented and high performance culture Entrepreneurial and innovative approach in the identification of business opportunities, paired with a result driven work approach and high level of flexibility and ownership Committed and dedicated to maintaining the highest standards with respect to our risk and control culture and in order to meet bank's policies and obligations MBA or degree from a university or an institute of higher education, completion of CFA or equivalent is an advantage Proficiency in English as well as in the native language spoken by the clients to be covered for the relevant market For the team leader role: ability to hire and build a high performing team, to lead the team dynamics, mentor, coach and motivate Relationship Managers/Investment Consultants Join us! Please apply via our career portal. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Gestalten Sie die Zukunft. Ihre und unsere. Bei Swiss Life bringen Sie Ihre individuellen Talente und Expertise in einem motivierten und flexiblen Arbeitsumfeld ein. Sie bernehmen ein hohes Mass an Verantwortung, meistern anspruchsvolle Herausforderungen selbststndig mit Gestaltungsspielraum und in Zusammenarbeit mit professionellen Teams. Flexible Arbeitsmodelle ermglichen Ihnen berufliche und persnliche Ambitionen in Einklang zu bringen. Ihr Verantwortungsbereich - Parametrisierung und Konfiguration unserer Pensionsfonds-Verwaltungssoftware Xplan - Detaillierte Analyse der Regelungen und Bedrfnisse von Pensionsfonds und von Rentenplnen - Anpassung von Standardberichten und Untersttzung bei der Erstellung zustzlicher Dokumente - Daten-Migration - Konfiguration der Schnittstelle - Organisation und Verwaltung der Kundenbetreuung - Verantwortung fr Projekte zur Implementierung von Managementlsungen - Implementierung und Anwendung von Testverfahren - Zusammenarbeit an Projekten mit unseren Bros in Zrich / Bern / Lausanne / Genf - Gewhrleistung eines gleichbleibend hohen Qualittskundendienstes Ihre Strken - Universittsabschluss, Fachhochschule, eidgenssisches Diplom oder gleichwertige Ausbildung - Mehrjhrige Berufserfahrung auf dem Gebiet der IT-Lsungen fr die Verwaltung von Pensionsfonds - Gute Arbeitsmethodik sowie gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fhigkeiten - Sozialkompetenz und Kommunikationsfhigkeiten - Hohes Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Kundenserviceorientierung - Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift in Franzsisch oder Deutsch, Englisch von Vorteil Ihre Benefits Wir untersttzen unsere Mitarbeitenden, ihre berufliche Entwicklung und Lebensgestaltung ber alle Lebensphasen hinweg optimal zu gestalten. Unsere attraktiven Vorteile tragen einen Teil dazu bei. Ihr Kontakt Sophie Brunner Tel: +41 43 284 46 97

Operations Risk Management & Manufacturing Footprint Support - Your future role? As an Operations Risk Management (ORM) & Manufacturing Footprint Support for our Fragrance & Beauty division, you will participate to the Operations Strategic Planning in terms of maintaining a robust risk identification/mitigation structure and an efficient business continuity process together with coordinating & enabling footprint masterplans and production transfers. In this position, reporting to the Head of Strategic Planning, you will: Support the Manufacturing Footprint Manager and the Operations Risk & Business Continuity Planning Manager Coordinate risk reporting and analysis. Ensure business continuity preparedness across operations through trainings and simulation exercises. Help coordinate the Operations Business Continuity Process whenever deemed necessary, e.g. crisis. Participate to site/region master plans to ensure correct decision that fits global strategy. Be part of the coordination of larger transfer studies and execution Support business cases linked to larger capacity investments, integrations and acquisitions. You? University degree in Finance, Engineering, Supply Chain or related area experience in Industry Minimum 2 years of experience in Supply Chain or at least Operations Interest in strategic and forward-looking work Strong achievement orientation Good project management skills (collaboration, conflict management, etc) Fluent in English other languages being a valuable contribution Our Benefits (for Vernier, Switzerland) Healthcare support Paid Time Off and family leave Retirement plan Sport and leisure clubs Company shop Staff restaurant Free car park

Switzerland - Zürich Marketing and Communications Personal & Corporate Banking Job Reference # 213279BR City Zürich Job Type Full Time Your role Schlägt Ihr Herz für Social Media? Publishing, Response & Dialogue und Community Management sind für Sie keine Fremdwörter? In Ihrer täglichen Arbeit sind Sie in Zusammenarbeit mit dem interdisziplinären Team verantwortlich fürs Planen, Aufsetzen und Reporting aller Social Media-Aktivitäten von UBS Schweiz. Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche und spannende Position in der Sie täglich gefordert werden. Sie bekommen die Möglichkeit, die Digitalisierung der Bank mitzugestalten und den Dialog mit unserer Community auf Social Media voranzutreiben. Wir suchen eine(-n) Social Media Spezialist(-in) für folgende Aufgaben: • Strategische Planung, Kreation und Umsetzung von Inhalten für die Social Media-Kanäle von UBS Schweiz • Community Management auf den Plattformen Facebook, Twitter und LinkedIn • Erstellung und Interpretation von Reportings mit Hilfe verschiedener Analytics-Tools • Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams und externen Agenturen sowie Beratung interner Stakeholder • Strategischer Ausbau und Betreuung des Corporate Influencer-Programms • Führung und Betreuung von Agenturen sowie externen Partner • Entwicklung und Implementierung von neuen und innovativen Inhalten zur Unterstützung strategischer Geschäftsziele • Strategischer Ausbau und Weiterentwicklung der Social Media-Kanäle bei der UBS Schweiz Your team Sie arbeiten im Digital Marketing-Team der UBS Schweiz in Zürich an der Europaallee. Wir verantworten alle digitalen und Social Media-Aktivitäten von Microsites über preisgekrönte Kampagnen, E-Mails bis zu organic und paid Social Media. Unser Ziel ist, die Rolle von UBS als führende Multikanalbank der Schweiz zu festigen und weiter auszubauen. Your expertise • 5+ Berufserfahrung im Bereich Social Media Marketing und Community Management, vorzugsweise in der Finanzbranche (Berufserfahrung auf Agenturseite) und/oder in einem agilen Arbeitsumfeld von Vorteil • Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Fachhochschul- oder Universitätsstudium mit Schwerpunkt Marketing, PR, Journalismus oder einem verwandten Themengebiet • Fundiertes Know How im Digital Marketing (und lieben diese Tätigkeit) • Sehr gute Projekt- und Stakeholder-Management-Skills (interne und externe Partner) • Erfahrung im Umgang mit den gängigsten Social Networks (v.a. LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, Facebook) sowie fortgeschrittener Umgang mit gängigen Social Media Tools (z.B. Adobe Analytics, Sprinklr, Talkwalker, Grapevine6) • Hohe Schreibkompetenz für digitale Kanäle und Kreativität • Sehr gute Deutsch-, Französisch- und Englischkenntnisse. Italienisch ist von Vorteil Zudem sind Sie: • prozessorientiert und haben Spass daran, neue Prozesse innerhalb der Organisation aufzubauen, mitzugestalten und zu optimieren • analytisch und innovationsfreudig • teamorientiert, kollaborativ und arbeiten gerne in interdisziplinären und agilen Teams mit verschiedenen Kommunikations- und Digitalprofis • Als leidenschaftlicher Storyteller wandeln Sie Inhalte zu spannenden Geschichten um und bereiten diese kanal- und zielgruppengerecht auf • Belastbare, kreative und motivierte Persönlichkeit mit „Can-Do“-Mentalität About us Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world. We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. Contact Details UBS Business Solutions AG UBS Recruiting Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Your field of responsibility As an important function within the Bank’s AML risk management framework, you will be responsible for the performance of various controls at a holistic client level, ensuring accuracy, consistency and plausibility of client information and associated risk assessments across business areas and jurisdic-tions. You will work at the cross-section of business and control functions, collaborating directly with the Front Office, First Line of Defense Support as well Second Line of Defense SMEs. You will have a focus on high risk client relationships and will make an important contribution to mitigate these risks effectively. Your future colleagues You will be embedded in the Centre of Competence for AML, where you will have an ideal platform for your personal and professional development in a highly dynamic and fast-paced environment. The team members have diverse international backgrounds, are passionate about their work and are solution-oriented. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Your skills and experience We are looking for professionals with at least 2-3 years of relevant experience in a large bank, pref-erably in a Private Banking Front Office function, in a Compliance function or in a Business Risk Management / First Line of Defense function. Further skills and experience we are looking for in-clude: An university degree in business administration, banking & finance, law, international relations or an equivalent higher education Experience in the management of Financial Crime related risks / prior knowledge in this area (KYC reviews, transaction monitoring, etc.) Ideally, familiarity with front office processes and risk management related requirements (such as periodic or event-triggered reviews of Politically Exposed Persons) Ability to prioritize and plan efficiently in an environment with a high degree of change and com-plexity Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate complex messages or content in a simple and understandable manner Strong analytical skills combined with a can do attitude and the willingness to take ownership Proficiency in English is required, other languages such as Portuguese or Spanish are an ad-vantage Understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work Ms. V. Job Function: Cloud & Software Services Why SoftwareONE?: SoftwareONE is a public, Swiss headquartered, 11 Billion Dollar revenue Company. SoftwareONE is present in 88 markets worldwide and now employs over 6000 people. We could spend more time telling you about how SoftwareONE is a market leader Software Portfolio Management & Software Advisory Services along with Platform and technology service provider. We could even tell you that we are growing at 35%+ year on year – however, by the time you have finished reading this document, we would have to increase all the figures. What You Should Really Know About Us. “Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful. Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success” – Patrick Winter, CEO. What We Expect From Our Employees Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, super agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics. Our leaders operate with a high level of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy. The role: The SAP Solution Specialist is responsible for driving and co-owning SAP solution sales, business development, and marketing activities within his/her assigned region. The role functions as a partnership with the primary account manager and as a result is not limited to traditional “overlay role” restrictions, the SAP Solution Specialist is expected to take a consistently proactive approach to developing the technical solutions business in the region. The SAP Solution Specialist is the technical lead in the region for pre-sales customer engagements and sales enablement for the respective region. The role also serves as the liaison between the assigned sales team and customers and professional services delivery resources which include both in-house and partner delivered services. The SAP Solution Specialist will scope professional services opportunities and assist in the creation and delivery of Statements of Work (SoW) to customers. The SAP Solution Specialist will be required to maintain an advanced level of technical knowledge across a deep set of foundational technologies as well as at least one specific technology set to serve as the subject matter expert for that specific subject on a national and/or global scale. Practice Summary: The SAP Technology Services (SAP TS) practice focuses on modernizing customer SAP solutions. Its solutions and service offerings enable customer to migrate, deploy and run SAP solutions effectively and efficiently on public cloud platforms. The key platform partners are Microsoft with its Azure offering as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS). The SAP TS practice delivers the services to customers through a network of experts both in-country, near-shore and offshore who are highly skilled and experienced experts following the principles of continues learning. The group of practitioners in delivery services is supported by a Centre of Excellent for SAP which sets standards, defines best practices and enables research and innovation. Roles & Responsibilities: Sales & Services Partners and co-owns sales activities at a customer level with the field-based account manager (Business Development Manager [BDM]). Performance and success measured by GP performance of region and individual accounts. Performance based quarterly incentives will be structured in commission format. Analyse & gather business requirement from large & complex client environment and perform required research and investigation to identify and create thorough, accurate technical solution proposals based on client requirements. Responsible for partnering with BDMs and local sales leadership to drive new business opportunities within the existing regional account base as well as supporting customer acquisition activities as assigned. Prepares cost estimates for SAP as well as professional services (deployment, migration, implementation, workshops, etc.) by studying blueprints, plans, and related customer documents; consulting with other engineers, architects, practice leads and other professional and technical personnel (both internal and external). Develop overall solutions including high-level design (e.g.-Whiteboarding), statements of work (SOW), service design and bills of materials (BOM). Contributes to service delivery and engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed; providing information and commentary pertinent to deliberations; recommending options and courses of action; implementing directives. General Business Development, Marketing, & Partnerships Assist and own partnership/alliance functions to assigned partner relationships. This may include being primary contact for Partner/Channel Account Managers and assisting in GTM and business planning as well as driving forward programmatic initiatives. Develop relationships and act as liaison to local partners (mainly Microsoft and AWS) to ensure available resources are being utilized where appropriate. Act as a technical evangelist for marketing activities including speaking/presenter engagements at conferences, conventions, user groups, webinars, etc. Partner with stakeholders and drive solution marketing activities by preparing and delivering content and messaging. What we need to see from you: Soft Skill Requirements Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Problem-solving aptitude. Maintain and acquire advanced level technical certification in assigned area and maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Maintain and report on regional service delivery, sales pipeline, and project status. Flexible travel required. Knowledge & Education Requirements: University degree preferred (in the field of Information Technology and/or or equivalent combination of experience and education; Master’s degree preferred). 5+ years or equivalent in the areas: SAP technical architecture design. SAP Basis/NetWeaver. SAP OS/DB Migrations. SAP HANA. Cloud architecture & infrastructure design for public cloud. SAP cloud deployments and migrations on public cloud. Technical pre-sales. Team leadership. Ability to sell, scope price with limited support. Significant hands on experience in on premise cloud and public cloud solutions architecture. Significant technical experience in Microsoft or AWS IAAS Solutions. Documented successful sales of enterprise-wide advanced technology public cloud solutions. Advanced-level Partner Sales and Technical Certifications required. Ability to independently conduct meetings with engineering-level, management-level or executive level customer personnel regarding positioning sales and solutions.

Senior Legal Counsel, M&A & Corporate - Full Time - Winterthur, Switzerland At Sulzer, you are empowered to deliver superior results. As a pioneer in industry we have a proud heritage of innovation and continue to evolve for the future. Join our story and create your own impact by developing your expertise and building solutions that help make our lives safer, smarter and more sustainable. Join our GF_Legal, Compliance and Risk Management team within Group Functions division in Switzerland as Senior Legal Counsel, M&A & Corporate to help us take Group Legal to the next level. In this role you will be accountable for: M&A specific tasks- Representation of Group Legal in M&A projects, including the coordination of internal teams and external partners, and with the involvement of the Executive Committee and Board. Supervision of M&A projects throughout the entire process (Letter of Intent / Due Diligence / Drafting / Negotiation / Signing of Agreements / Closing of Transaction incl. PMI). Other tasks - Analysis and control of legal risks, and implementation of legal requirements from a corporate and stock exchange viewpoint. Participation in contract negotiations together with both sales and procurement. Editing contracts, as well as checking and commenting of contractual conditions. Support in the defense against liability claims, processing of justified claims from both customers and suppliers. Development and implementation of company guidelines and regulations. Observation and analysis of relevant legal developments. To succeed in this role, you will need: MLaw as well as Swiss (or foreign) bar exam as well as at least 4-6 years of international professional experience in a renowned law firm or in the legal department of a listed company. Experience in international M&A transactions and in-depth knowledge of contract law and Swiss company and stock exchange law; knowledge of foreign legal systems / legislations desired. Willingness and interest to work closely with business functions and contribute directly to the group's commercial success. Flair for technical products and services, experience in working with (senior) business leaders on an international basis. Communicative personality with quick comprehension and interest in new issues. Proactive with a “hands-on” attitude and a sense of practical solutions. Ability to deliver results under time pressure, to take responsibility for decisions and to set priorities correctly. Business fluent in German and English (written and oral), additional foreign languages are desirable. Your benefits: Attractive compensation Excellent social benefits Global development opportunities An innovative, vibrant and agile culture Central workplace, only 5 minutes from Winterthur central station The chance to make an impact at a global scale Location: We are based in Winterthur. This is a great place with a high quality of life. In the historic old town you find many shops, cafés, bars and restaurants. Recreation areas can be reached in a short time from any point of the city International applicants are welcome to apply. No visa or work permit support can be provided for non-CH or non-EU applicants for this role. Have a question about the role? Reach out to Christian Oser. We are looking forward to hearing from you! Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce. 82% of our employees recommend Sulzer as a good place to work – so come and join our story, starting today! Switzerland - Zrich Business management, administration and support Group Functions Job Reference # 207812BR City Zrich Your role Are you creative and highly organized? Are you a great writer and can you turn complicated topics into interesting stories? We have two open internship positions in our team and are looking for strong team players to support our internal communications. We are responsible for communicating to employees globally for people-related topics. Our role covers a broad range of activities, from high level planning through to the creation and delivery of content and communications materials in a variety of formats in up to four languages. Internship Our 6-12 month internship is an ideal way to gain the work experience youll need to launch your career. Its also an opportunity to work with and learn from some of our sharp people in finance. From the start of the program, youll be right at the heart of the business, taking part in the day-to-day operations. Youll not only learn about the business of finance from top to bottom, youll also experience our unique workplace culture. Your responsibilities include: developing content for news articles, intranet pages, newsletters, videos, blog posts and other communication materials for employees across the firm, including editing and writing (in English and German) identifying story ideas and key messages on a wide range of topics handling a small portfolio of projects such as webpage redesigns, communication campaigns, the development of guidelines and the review of intranet-related statistics supporting the organization and logistics of e.g. townhalls, campaigns, etc. Collaborating across the Group Internal Communications team and other partners in the firm Providing guidance to our stakeholders about UBS's corporate design and tone of voice guidelines To learn more about our Internship Programs, click here . Your team You'll be working in the Group Internal Communications team (part of Group Research, Analytics & Communications) in Zurich. We are a diverse team of communications experts who love what we do and who take pride in producing high quality, high impact communications. We advise various teams across the bank on a wide range of tactical and strategic communications with the aim that employees are informed and engaged and proud to work for UBS. Your expertise You need have completed at least four semesters of your bachelors degree or have obtained your master's degree within the last 6 months. In particular, you are: working towards or have recently completed your Bachelor's degree in e.g. journalism, communications or public relations, or working towards your Master's degree a fluent English or German speaker with advanced knowledge in the other language an expert writer with an eye for detail (spotting typos is your second nature) a self-starter, innovative person experienced in social media excellent at organizing and coordinating events a team player who's able to work independently happy to work to tight and changing deadlines proficient in Microsoft Office suite of products It would be great if you have: an interest in financial services graphic design and video editing skills Perhaps youve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 20,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment. CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL's therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally. We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team! Responsibilities Qualifications For our site in Bern (Or Marburg/Broad meadows), and within the Engineering Standards department, we are looking for a: Director, Engineering & Design Lead EU/APAC Reporting into the Global Head of Engineering Standards, the Director, Engineering and Design you will be responsible for oversight of engineering capital investments across the CSL US network and for planning and execution of capital project design phases, compliance with engineering standards, and governance to established engineering processes. You should be able to demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of End to End (E2E) capital program planning and delivery, engineering processes and platforms, core technical elements related to facilities, utilities and manufacturing equipment, contract management, supporting Quality Systems, and cGMP compliance. You will be responsible for regional and facility type specific engineering standards related to their Engineering function. As part of a global organization, the position requires approximately 40% travel. Peers will be located across CSL Behring US/EU/APAC sites. The position requires the ability to build and maintain strong relationships and collaborate effectively with all levels and cross functionally within the organization. Main Responsibilities and Accountabilities: Provide Global Engineering Leadership for engineering capital investments across the EU/APAC network Partner with internal stakeholders to align on strategies and requirements and develop plans advancing in accordance with established governance processes Collaborate with Portfolio Management for the planning and execution of capital investments to deliver on strategic commitments Identify resource requirements and engage internal resources in support of capital investment planning and execution Responsible for translating stakeholder requirements into tangible strategic and execution plans Lead E2E capital investment planning; collaborate with Project Delivery to establish integrated plans which meet business objectives Represent Global Engineering throughout the matrix environment in the communication of capital investment strategies and delivery Responsible for compliance of capital investments with design standards and standard design platform governance process Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Engineering Standards Responsible for Facility Design Standards related to MAB/Cell Therapy and Aseptic Fill and Finish manufacturing Collaborate with Global Engineering Process Engineering and Process and Product Owners to establish requirements Translate process requirements into design attributes which form the basis for Design Standards Responsible for ensuring harmonization of Facility Design Standards across the global network Partner with Peers to align on Quality, Safety, IT, Reliability and Sustainability requirements for design standards. Facilitate collaborative sessions to align on design standards attributes to meet requirements Responsible for ensuring alignment of design standards with Operations Value Streams Maintain Facility Design Standards throughout Life Cycle Evaluate innovation and emerging technologies for opportunities to realize efficiency and compliance improvements Provide training and ensure institutionalization across engineering community Provide Global Engineering Oversight of external partners for capital investments Identify resource requirements and develop plans for external resource engagements Partner with Global Sourcing to develop engagement strategies, inquiry packages, conditioning and Services Agreements Provide oversight of external partners and ensure compliance with Engineering Standards Establish metrics and provide oversight of activities in support of progress measurement and performance Partner with Project Managers to deliver on tactical execution commitments Lead Design Reviews to ensure compliance with E2E Portfolio Management and Engineering Standards governance; project management systems, technical, delivery methods, contracting strategies, safety, operational readiness, and Compliance to reduce risk and deliver on business objectives Utilize design reviews to identify risks and gaps, and to develop mitigation and endorsements prior to advancing through the capital investment process Leverage internal resources to perform design reviews, partner with Global Sourcing for external augmentation where needed Lead Peer Reviews to ensure deliverable comply with requirements, standards and stakeholder expectations Partner with Global Sourcing and provide oversight of process for engaging equipment vendors, and execution of Agreements Responsible for feedback to Global Sourcing for management of strategic Agreements Your Profile: Bachelor's degree in engineering, biology or related field required, advanced education preferred and/or an MBA. Minimum of 15 years' experience in a biotech/pharmaceutical environment in roles with increasing responsibility within the engineering space Minimum 8 years of managerial experience Direct experience with oversight of highly complex large engineering capital investments Excellent management skills and an ability to prioritize effectively to deliver results within aggressive timelines with the ability to work independently and as part of a team Substantial prior experience in the development and implementation of engineering standards and life cycle management of tools, processes and methodologies Demonstrated ability to deliver solutions in a dynamic environment Direct experience with organizational transformation and related supporting engineering processes Excellent collaboration skills and ability to align people and resources towards organizational success Must demonstrate strategic thinking and innovative approach to responsibilities Nimble and comfortable in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities Must demonstrate maturity and seasoned judgment in reaching critical decisions Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication are essential in this collaborative work environment We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV. CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all. Capabilities Worker Type: Employee Worker Sub Type: Regular

About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the world's leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world. Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. Join our team as Head of Learning & Development The Head of Learning & Development is a senior position in our Organisation & People Development (OPD) function. We are one of three Centres of Excellence within Human Resources. As our new colleague you will lead a team of talented professionals and will be a member of the OPD Leadership team. Since we are a knowledge company, employee development is a fundamental part of our philosophy and strategy as it contributes significantly to the success of the firm. You will be responsible for learning and development globally ensuring this is aligned to Swiss Re's strategy and business priorities. You will take care of L&D strategy, shaping learning culture, relevant governance and the eco-system required to make learning as effortless as possible and personalised for employees. Your content scope is wide including leadership skills, soft skills, sales, finance, young talent programs and more. You and your team will also work closely with the business on technical capabilities where these relate to major initiatives or transformations. The business units will take the lead, but you will be a valuable partner using your expertise to steer the approach for learning and the architecture for solutions. At Swiss Re we like to celebrate our achievements, and we have won many awards for our progressive learning approaches and you will have the opportunity to share and apply your passion to push the boundaries further. You will need to develop a strong peer network and are likely to be a thought leader bringing deep understanding of emerging best practices and technology. To be successful in the role you will collaborate with other expert functions, for example Talent, Inclusion & Diversity, Strategic People Planning, Executive Leadership Development and more. You will partner with a wide stakeholder group including colleagues, for example in HR, the Business Units and IT. You'll demonstrate great leadership and will drive a culture of performance. About the Team The team is diverse, loves to have fun and be creative. We attach a lot of importance to collaboration, sharing, diversity and agility. The team is located across several major Swiss Re offices globally and is often embedded into broader working groups in OPD, regularly working as part of agile teams on major deliverables. Are you up for the challenge? We are looking for a true team player who enjoys and is successful collaborating in our well networked company. You will have deep expertise in L&D but it is important you can show how you can integrate this into broader HR solutions resulting in simple and seamless experiences for our employee colleagues. You are likely to demonstrate many of the following characteristics: Excellent understanding of and experience in 'new ways of learning' outside of traditional learning methodologies and approaches Sound understanding of progressive learning trends, digital solutions and technology supporting and driving learning Very open minded towards new approaches and ways of working Analytical mind who is digital savvy and understands how to achieve results through applying best in class digital solutions and technology Commercially focused and able to translate business strategy into relevant learning and development interventions well connected to wider HR solutions Ability to influence at a senior level in the organisation supported by excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills Great leadership and interpersonal skills in order to develop talent and to motivate colleagues across the globe to deliver at their best Learning agility is necessary to quickly understand the business which means specific insurance industry experience is not required Likely to have Master's degree level or higher professional qualifications in any subject connected to People and Development disciplines Swiss Re is an equal opportunity employer. It is our practice to recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, pregnancy, sexual orientations, marital status, military status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Decisions on employment are solely based on an individual's qualifications for the position being filled. During the recruitment process, reasonable accommodations for disabilities are available upon request. If contacted for an interview, please inform the Recruiter/HR Professional of the accommodation needed. Keywords: Reference Code: 108869 Swiss Re

Treasury topics Monitor internal and external financing structures, counterparty risk and credit rating Ensure compliance to policies worldwide, including providing best practice guidelines Set up hedge accounting and provide documentation FX and Pension Fund Controlling Monitor interest rate and foreign currency risk You will provide controlling and reporting for the Swiss Pension Fund as well as the International Pension Plans and taking on a further support function Prepae situational analysis of our pension funds supporting financial decisions Conduct monitoring & controlling of asset allocation, rules, investment policies and strategies Cash Management Act as contact person for all cash management related requests for the Swiss pension fund Take responsibility for liquidity management including cash pool coordination and short-, mid- and long term cash forecasting for the group in addition to related requests, netting and the SWIFT/banking interface Consult with finance and consolidation Banking background welcome Interpersonal abilities and intercultural touch are highly welcome Strong readiness to invest and willing to go the extra-mile Team player with strong analytical skills, drive to be a constant challenger to the team Proficient use of SAP apllications including TRM, MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint and a sound knowledge of Power BI focused, sustainable and innovative specialty chemical company based near Basel in Switzerland.
