Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Product management experience, with experience setting strategic direction and roadmaps in multi-stakeholder, and/or B2B or B2B2C spaces. Experience with driving product vision, go-to-market strategy, and design discussions. Experience building developer facing products, API's, and tools. Preferred qualifications: Experience in an infrastructure-focused, developer-facing, or tools-oriented area and an interest in software developers as users. Collaboration skills, comfort working across sites and geographies, and an ability to understand diverse perspectives and bridge them into a common direction. About the job At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day. In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users. As the Product Manager (PM) for Server Platform Coverage and Production, you’ll guide the platform into new areas that expand its reach and relevance, including support for new workloads (like pipelines) and development domains (like database management, cloud deployments, ML development). You’ll work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. You’ll be embedded with a local server platform development team in Zurich, working across the Zurich team and peer development teams in the Bay Area. You’ll also work closely with customers and partner teams across Google, so strong collaboration skills are essential. Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Responsibilities Guide the platform into new areas that expand its reach and relevance, including support for new workloads and development domains. Work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. Work closely with customers and partner teams across Google. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

In Motion’s strategy 2025 “eCommerce” was identified as one of the key strategic initiatives that the business needs to get right in order to be ready for the future. The eCommerce PMO organization is responsible for the creation of a granular blueprint strategy and its implementation in MO MO eCommerce is focusing on three critical areas for delivery around (1) value proposition derived from the customer needs; (2) lead generation, driving traffic, and order fulfilment for eCommerce; and (3) technology platform to deliver our eCommerce value proposition and customer experience. The eCDMS will work alongside MO marketing and communications team to identify eCommerce target markets, create relevant brand image, and create and maintain online marketing campaigns for the purpose of supporting the project pilots and prof of concepts. This position will act as a coordinator and change agent to support the development of the eCommerce blueprint, support eCommerce lead generation for piloting, and will eventually transition the organization once the job is completed. The eCDMS is responsible for understanding customer requirements and planning the implementation of appropriate electronic commerce solutions by interacting with other Web and offline professionals, with embedded systems management, merchants, payment gateways, and third parties. The eCDMS will work closely with other talented and dedicated digital marketing professionals across the businesses and countries. The eCDMS, in the context of eCommerce project, will work closely with MO communications, MO digital communications, MO marketing, BL marketing, marketing automation, country marketing, product managers, channel managers to help organize and coordinate lead generation and order fulfilment to support the eCommerce project blueprint and pilots.Your responsibilitiesYour backgroundMore about usBring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.

Medizinische / Therapeutische Berufe Zwischen 1848 und 1900 ist das Grand Hotel Kronenhof in Pontresina entstanden. Ein Haus der Luxusklasse, innen und aussen denkmalgeschtzt, gehrt es zu den architektonisch bedeutendsten Hotels der Alpen aus dem 19. Jahrhundert. Pontresina ist unweit vom mondnen St. Moritz, 1800 m .M. mitten in einer atemberaubenden Landschaft gelegen. Der Kronenhof gehrt zu den fhrenden 5 Sterne Superior Husern im Oberengadin und war GaultMillau-Hotel des Jahres. Unser Hotel erhielt etliche der begehrten Travellers Choice Awards des Onlineportals TripAdvisor und wurde zum besten Hotel der Welt ausgezeichnet. Ausserdem wurde uns von Schweiz Tourismus der Prix Bienvenu verliehen, der Award als gastfreundlichstes Luxushotel der Schweiz. Unser Hotel verfgt ber 112 luxurise Suiten und Zimmer verschiedener Kategorien. Neben der grosszgigen Wellnessanlage laden das "Grand Restaurant" in klassischem neobarocken Stil (300 Sitzpltze, 2. bestes HP-Restaurant der Schweiz), das -la-carte Gourmet-Restaurant "Kronenstbli" (16 Punkte GaultMillau), die Bar und das Sonnenrestaurant "Le Pavillon" unsere internationalen Gste zum Erholen und Verweilen ein. Wir suchen ab der nchsten Wintersaison 2020/2021, d.h. ab ca. anfangs Dezember 2020 bis ca. 7. April 2021, und hoffentlich auch fr die weitere Zukunft, einen erfahrenen, motivierten und dienstleistungsorientierten Mitarbeiter fr unsere Wellnessabteilung. Durchfhrung von klassischen & Sport-Massagen und Kronenhof Signature Massagen Durchfhrung von Krperbehandlungen, wie z.B. Peelings und Packungen auf der Softpack Liege und Bder in der Hydrojet Wanne Durchfhrung von Personal Trainings und Fitnesskursen Produkte- und Behandlungsberatung sowie Verkauf Reinigungsarbeiten im gesamten Spa-, Pool-, Sauna- und Fitness-Bereich Person: Belastbare, teamfhige und motivierte Persnlichkeit ausgeprgte Kommunikationsfhigkeit, Organisations- und Verkaufstalent Gepflegtes Auftreten und gute Umgangsformen Flexibilitt und Begeisterung, in einem Luxushotel zu arbeiten Profil: Abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Physiotherapeut oder med. Masseur (allenfalls Schweizerische Berufsausbungsbewilligung SRK-Anerkennung) Berufserfahrung in hnlicher Position in 4*-/5*-Hotels Fliessende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (jede weitere Sprache von Vorteil) Weitere Erfahrungen im Bereich Wellness- und Medizinmassagen, wie z.B. Thaimassage, Lymphdrainage, Fussreflexzonen Massagen etc. erforderlich Erfahrung in Fitnesskursen, wie z.B. Yoga, Pilates etc. und Personal Trainings
industry: accommodation, hotel, restaurants and food service

job_description: St. Gallen | Teilzeit 50% | unbefristet | 01.09.2020 | Merchandiser/in Sporttextil und Kinderkonfektion (50%) Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams im Bereich Sport und Kinderkonfektion suchen wir per 01. September 2020 am Standort St. Gallen eine/n Merchandiser/in (50%). Die Arbeitseinsätze sind vorwiegend am Montag-, Mittwoch- und Freitagmorgen sowie teilweise am Samstag. Ihre Aufgaben Sie sorgen für eine optimale Zusammenarbeit mit dem Visual Merchandising im Hause Sie setzen die Warenpräsentationen um und sind verantworlich für die Gestaltung der Warenaufzüge Sie stellen die Warenbestände und Verfügbarkeiten mit dem Sales Support sicher Sie bearbeiten die Parameter und Module, analysieren die Kennzahlen und leiten gewinnbringende Massnahmen ein Sie pflegen einen regen Austausch mit den POS-Managern, Brand und Sales Manager am Hauptsitz sowie mit den Lieferanten Sie bringen mit Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Detailhandelsfachfrau/-mann im Bereich Fashion Sie konnten Berufserfahrung im Fashionbereich sowie im Merchandising und in der Warenbewirtschaftung sammeln Sie arbeiten lösungsorientiert und selbständig, sind zuverlässig und teamfähig Sie verfügen über eine hohe Leistungsbereitschaft, sind engagiert und motiviert Sie haben ein Flair für Zahlen und Prozessabläufe Sie haben eine genaue, strukturierte und effiziente Arbeitsweise Sie treten selbstsicher auf und haben ein modisches und gepflegtes Erscheinungsbild Unser Angebot Eine Vielfalt an Möglichkeiten, Aufgaben, Positionen und Herausforderungen – welche ist Ihre? Raum für Ambitionen und kreative Ideen. Die Chance aktiv mitzugestalten. Beruflich und persönlich täglich zu wachsen. Vorankommen. Weiterkommen. Ein attraktives Gesamtpaket aus Personalrabatten, Mitarbeiterkonditionen und Sozialleistungen. Als Teil des Manor Teams mit Stolz und Engagement gemeinsam Erfolge realisieren. PASSIONATE PEOPLE – Für alle, die bewegen wollen! Interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Online-Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestem Eintrittstermin. Papierbewerbungen werden nicht bearbeitet. Diese Stelle möchten wir ohne Headhunter-Profile besetzen. Ihr Kontakt Sylvina Rauber HR Recruiter Region Deutschschweiz JETZT BEWERBEN Die Manor AG mit Hauptsitz in Basel ist Schweizer Marktführerin im Sektor Warenhäuser mit einem Marktanteil von rund 60 Prozent. Insgesamt beschäftigt das Unternehmen 9'000 Mitarbeitende und bildet aktuell 345 Lernende aus. Die Manor AG betreibt 60 Warenhäuser, 31 Manor Food Märkte sowie 27 Manora Restaurants.

Java Software Engineer (f/m/d) 80-100% Java Software Engineer (f/m/d) 80-100% Wallisellen 80-100% Open-end Stadler has been building trains for over 75 years. With our innovative strength, flexibility and reliability we are a leading manufacturer of rail vehicles today. In 2017 Stadler established an independent, international centre of competence for signalling technology. Today, several teams of highly qualified engineers research and develop signalling solutions in Wallisellen. These include solutions in the areas of automated train operation (ATO), train control system (ETCS) and driverless metro trains (CBTC). Join our team and help us shape the future of mobility! Your tasks Creation of concepts, architecture and design description for ATS (Automatic Train Supervision) subsystem Preparation and review of the requirements and specifications of the system/subsystems/HW/ SW/ interfaces with focus on the ATS systems Comparison of concepts with market needs and available technologies Integration of ATS with other subsystems Test Specification for System/Subsystem/SW/and Interfaces from ATS Perspective Execution of model-based and HIL tests Integration and commissioning of systems in the field Specifications and management of validation and certification for ATS systems Your profile Completed technical education as electrical or computer science engineer ETH/TU/FH or comparable Experience in development of software algorithms and object oriented programming (OOP) in Java Experience with Agile Development methods and iterative approach Good operating system knowledge in Linux/windows Several years of technical professional experience in industry and complex system development, ideally in the railway sector Knowledge of Automatic Train Supervision (ATS) subsystem, development of ATS, traffic management or process control systems and/or CBTC standards like IEEE, UNISIG and EN and safety standards (EN 50126,128,1290) is an advantage Fluent in English; other languages such as Germen are an advantage Fascination for building new solutions and applying new methods and technologies Further information Start immediately or upon agreement Applications via agencies are not considered Due to Swiss permit restrictions, applications of Non-EU/EFTA Citizens without valid work permit for Switzerland cannot be prioritized I am happy to help Should you have any questions, please don't hesitate to get in touch. We look forward to receiving your online application. Information for applicants Letter of motivation? This is optional for us. However, we do not want to miss a complete CV, job references and training certificates. A maximum of seven files (each with a maximum of 50 MB) can be uploaded. The Early Clinical Development Oncology (ECDO) group within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) translates world-class science into medical innovation through a diversity of technologies and talents located across three research centers worldwide (Innovation Centers Basel, Munich, and Zurich). We deliver on individual patient needs through a deep understanding of disease biology and the implementation of Personalized Healthcare strategies. Our Vision is to develop curative medicines for cancer patients. Our Mission is to transform pioneering scientific discoveries into effective medicines. pRED Oncology focuses on 2 key areas of expertise which are Cancer Immunotherapy and Molecularly Targeted Therapies. The Medical Director (MD) is a core member of the Early Clinical Development Oncology organization. The MD leads the clinical strategy for one or multiple early oncology drug assets. He / She is the key medical expert on the Project Team and leads the Clinical Expert Team. The MD reports to an ECDO area lead. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following: supports target and clinical candidate selection, is accountable for the design and the clinical and scientific content of experimental medicine studies to evaluate and validate targets in the field of oncology develops a clinical development plan for one or more early stage molecule(s), allowing quick decision making regarding proof of mechanism has overall medical and scientific responsibility for one or several PhI-II studies works with the Biomarker Experimental Medicine Leader to develop biomarker strategies supports and coordinates development and writing of documents such as protocol, investigators brochure, clinical study report, etc. proposes, establishes and leads external collaborations leads the Clinical Expert Team consisting of different functions supporting early clinical development confidently interprets and presents preclinical and clinical data to internal and external stakeholders assures GCP, Clinical Operating Guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures are followed, is responsible for safety management manages one or several clinical scientists Who You Are Youre someone who wants to influence your own development. Youre looking to be part of a dynamic and growing organization where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. We are looking for these qualifications: As the ideal candidate, you bring solid experience in clinical oncology and/or hematology and overall knowledge of the broad research and drug development process in oncology. You are medically qualified (MD), ideally combined with a PhD. Experience in immunology particularly cancer immunology is a plus. You have a consistent record of scientific achievement with significant experience in drug development documented by presentations and publications in peer reviewed journals. Additionally, you have the following skills/ expertise: Patient-related clinical experience as investigator on Phase I/II studies Industry experience (minimum 2-3 years) preferred, You enjoy thinking strategically beyond current standard of care and at the same time able to work hands on, You have a positive mindset and a deep understanding of the challenges and uncertainty of early medical research, You are proactive, have a very flexible attitude, and you can adapt easily to change, You work as experienced matrix leader and decision maker with strong leadership skills to influence and motivate Teams, You have an understanding of contemporary translational research tools, including imaging, biomarkers and an understanding of unmet medical needs in oncology and ability to think beyond current paradigms of care, Are you ready to apply? We want someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Research & Development, Research & Development > Research

Help our clients successfully manage global challenges Are you a curiosity driven problem solver? Do you also believe that great technology needs even greater design? Are you excited by work that lies at the intersection of business consultancy and digital creative agency? Then a career with us will help you make an impact at every level! We are Deloitte Switzerland's Digital practice - our experts develop strategies and solutions that help our clients solve the most complex of problems in the digital space. How you can make an impact As a Trainee at Deloitte Digital you will: · Apply Design Thinking and other user-centric methodologies to identify problems and ideate solutions · Learn how to translate abstract concepts into a digital product in an agile manner · Collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams (i.e. designers, developers, business analysts,etc) · Support our clients in conceptualizing and implementing innovative end-to-end customer experiences across multiple channels - always with end-user needs in mind · Work with different tools and technologies, such as Abstract, Sketch, AzureDevOps, JIRA, Miro, Mural, Nintendo Switch and many more Does that sound interesting to you? If so, then continue reading, because we might be a match. Who we are looking for · A university Master's degree in business/economics, computer science or other STEM subjects · A strong interest and initial internship experience within a digital context; in consulting, a startup or a big company · High degree of flexibility - every day is different and unexpected · A willingness to do what it takes in order to get stuff done · A proactive, creative and curious mindset · A team player who interacts smoothly with people from diverse background and helps out the team when needed · A natural presenter with strong communication skills · Proficiency in English is required, German or French is a strong advantage Your team Become part of a diverse, multinational and highly motivated team of 25 at our Zurich office. We're a team sharing over 15 languages but with the same belief that creativity and consulting are not mutually exclusive. We value diversity and individuality. One thing we really do not believe in is strict hierarchies and stiff meetings. We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes and on-the-job learning, but also by connecting with your colleagues across all business lines. Life at Deloitte As one of the leading global consulting and auditing companies, Deloitte is passionately committed to shaping the future. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. At Deloitte, you can make an impact that matters for our people, our clients and society. We offer an inclusive environment where you can grow your own way and build upon the purpose that drives you. You will benefit from flexible working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes and form lifelong connections in an international and dynamic environment. Want to know more about life at Deloitte? Go to What impact will you make? How to apply We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.    Microsoft Industry Solutions helps Microsoft customers around the world get the best outcomes from their investments in the latest Microsoft cloud technologies. We focus on empowering customers on their digital journey, from envisioning new possibilities to delivering solutions that result in targeted business outcomes and a great customer experience.     The focus of the Consulting Sales Manager role is to lead a team of consultative Industry sellers to accelerate commercial cloud growth by driving digital transformation with priority Enterprise customers.   Responsibilities   Key Responsibilities:     Business Growth: Contributes to strategic planning with One Microsoft peers & aligns team plans accordingly. Coaches sellers on how to create business value for customers, ensuring effective collaboration across internal organization boundaries & with Partners to accelerate deployment & adoption & drive digital transformation with customers.   Business Excellence: Leads the end-to-end business for assigned team, ensuring that sellers meet sales targets & operational standards per required Sales processes & methods. Coaches sellers on business & industry insights, ensuring they leverage industry Go To Market assets & motions to lead transformational customer conversations. Drives sellers to continuously build their sales expertise.   People & Culture Leadership: Delivers success by empowering sellers, driving accountability & executing per Microsoft expectations for Management Excellence, Leadership Principles, Values & Culture.    Qualifications      Business Growth - Ability to: Define & execute sales plans to meet strategic & financial targets, leveraging industry, partner & Go To Market knowledge; Skilled in stakeholder management & relationship building, collaborating across organizational boundaries & coaching sellers in sales methods such as Business Value Selling & 3-Horizon modelling to uncover customer needs & differentiate business value.     Business Excellence - Ability to: Drive seller accountability to successfully meet sales targets & expected operational standards; Skilled in ensuring seller discipline in qualification, pipeline hygiene & close planning, & in building seller proficiency by coaching on required sales behaviors, skills & knowledge.     People & Culture Leadership - Ability to: Develop diverse, inclusive teams, role modeling excellence in driving clarity, generating energy & delivering success through empowering others; Skilled in hiring, coaching, team & talent building & change management      Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.     Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Our International group portfolio of clients include some the largest and most successful of the businesses that Deloitte work with in Switzerland. They are complex, influential and exciting. We understand an audit is not about looking back, but about helping those businesses to plan for a successful future. Description du poste 115,000! outstanding individuals work at Novartis all with different needs and aspirations. Aligned to a single inspirational purpose: to Reimagine Medicine for millions of patients around the world. In this role you will be responsible for the income tax returns of all Novartis Swiss entities as well as other Swiss related tax national or international forms. Preparation of filing position papers and support in the defense vis a vis authorities. Acts as deputy of the Swiss Head of Tax for Swiss Tax compliance matters and represent Swiss Tax with local and global stakeholders for and Group Tax disclosure. Operate as advisory for Swiss tax compliance matters, including M&A, restructuring and projects Your remit will be: Monitor national tax environment and align with local stakeholders to drive quality and ensure compliance with local tax laws, advise Group Tax Team on tax developments having an impact on compliance and disclosures Maintain and govern a good working relationship with tax authorities at cantonal and federal level Represent Swiss Tax vis a vis Swiss based business units and functions in the area of Swiss tax compliance Coordinate and align tax compliance matters with the respective stakeholders at HQ/Country level (such as Funds Flow, FRA, CFO, FSC, business unit, HR, Group Treasury...) Coordinate and review the tax calculations for Novartis Swiss entities Supervise the preparation and filing of income tax returns including alignment of positions with Group Tax and other stakeholders Determine and monitor tax payments, align with stakeholders (Finance, Treasury) Monitor the Swiss group internal movements from a TP perspective and align with the Group Tax TP Lead the discussion with the Swiss tax authorities in the framework of inquiries, audit, litigation Ensure at all times the bridging between IFRS, Statutory, Tax accounts, in all dimensions of P/L vs B/S, cash vs accounting and time dimension Responsible for the SOX filings in the area of Swiss Tax compliance Support Group Tax in the framework of Novartis disclosures (e.g .DAC-6, CbCR, OECD Pillar I and II, etc.) Monitor activities potentially impacting Swiss tax filings, including M&A, BD&, restructurings Act as an adviser to Group Tax, Finance and Business with respect to the opportunity, form and content of position papers Support the Swiss Tax Risk planning on all dimensions including Uncertain Tax Position (UTP) provisioning for Swiss matters and for global matters potentially having an impact on HQ Supports Group Tax and operations with financial data and information, including past events, available from Swiss tax compliance Assess intercompany relationships and guide Global Business Units to ensure compliance Review of business development deals, structuring/restructuring projects aligned with Group Tax and the Group tax strategy and assess impact on filings Support Swiss Planning when engaging with the tax authorities on planning opportunities, implemention of rulings Description du profil University degree or equivalent in Tax or Legal or Finance or Economics required - Additional qualification in a Tax or Finance related area (Tax Expert, Tax Lawyer, CTA) - Specific Tax Expertise relating to Switzerland - 5 - 7 years of tax practice: in big 4 firm (or equivalent), leaving as Manager/Senior Manager (experience as in-house tax manager a bonus) - German language skills essential - The ability to communicate English language skills also a must COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY & INCLUSION: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential. Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network WHY NOVARTIS? 769 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2020, and while we're proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people's lives. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world's toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying! Imagine what you could do here at Novartis! Salaire et avantages Salaire : salary according to profile Référence : 328001BR Jobeo

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, theres no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of. Become part of the leading supplier to the Life Sciences Industries, encompassing both , Lonza Pharma, Biotech and Nutrition (LPBN) and Lonza Special Ingredients (LSI) . Join us by applying for the position as Indirect Tax Manager, based in Basel, Switzerland or Manchester, UK. Key responsibilities: Supports the Indirect Tax Director in developing indirect tax strategies and executing priorities, and in overseeing and enhancing compliance processes mainly in EMEA region (approx. 50 registrations in 10 countries) Stays on top of indirect tax legislative changes in EMEA and ensures proper communication and implementation Ensures correct VAT application and set-up in the accounting processes of companies within the Lonza Group Supports the finance team with the set-up of VAT codes and reports in SAP Creates and improves VAT related documentation Helps the Indirect Tax Director and the VAT Compliance Leader (Staff Selection Commission / SSC Manchester) in reviewing and developing processes and controls for effectiveness and governance Maintains contact with VAT authorities and assists during audits Liaises with external consultants Key requirements: Very good experience in EU VAT, Swiss VAT expertise is a plus Strong knowledge of and practical experience with SAP Bachelors or Masters degree in economics, business, IT or accounting/controlling Good accounting knowledge Ability to communicate at all levels of the business Capability to challenge the status quo and look for opportunities to make improvements in assigned business areas and beyond Fluency in English, German is a plus People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Summary Posted: Sep 2, 2020 Role Number:200188709 Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Combining groundbreaking machine learning techniques with next-generation hardware, our teams take user experiences to the next level. Key Qualifications Proficiency in an object-oriented programming language, such as Python, Objective-C, C++, and/or Swift. Candidates should have experience completing a moderate-sized software project. Strong problem solving and communication skills. Ideal candidates will also have experience in one of the following: HCI/design, linguistics, neuroscience, medicine, public health, biology, information retrieval, computer graphics, robotics, autonomous systems, applied math/statistics, physics, systems engineering, electrical engineering, sensors/signal processing, databases, distributed systems, data mining, econometrics, cognitive science, and psychology. Thesis, capstone project, internship, co-op, and/or industry experience in these fields will qualify. Description Apples AI/ML residency is a year long program inviting experts in various fields to apply their own domain expertise to build revolutionary machine learning and AI empowered products and experiences. The residency will begin with several weeks of coursework focused on machine learning and deep learning, followed by a project with one of our global machine learning teams. Apple AI/ML residents will be matched with a machine learning research/engineering mentor, and will contribute to their teams research, product design, and development. Some residents may also have the opportunity to publish and present their work at premiere academic conferences. Education & Experience Graduate degree in a STEM field or equivalent industry experience in software engineering.

suppliers or other engineers Quality assurance for supplier products and documentation Your background 3-5 years of experience in electrical engineering Knowledge of railway application is an advantage Relevant experience with EPLAN Ideally good understanding of substation automation and control Knowledge of communication protocol (IEC61850, Ethernet TCP/IP), PLC/protection relays or RTU and commercial customers with safe, smart and sustainable technologies for the distribution of electricity. job_description: C&P Technical Project Manager Are you passionate about defining, developing and delivering technology or products that millions of people will be delighted to use everyday? Are you inspired to join a highly collaborative team to develop new experiences for an industry recognised Design-led company ? If so, we have an exciting role, where you will have a major impact on our business.. Creativity & Productivity (C&P) is the biggest division of Logitech, consisting of the tech devices that help people be at their creative and productive best in their personal workspace. Our C&P business is a key pillar of Logitechs future as a global brand known for great design and exceptional user experiences. As the technical project manager, you will lead multi-disciplinary technical teams from the concept definition to the introduction in mass production. Your seniority, curiosity and agility will allow you to drive different types of projects: new technical bricks, a new cross-project feature or a complete device. Your technical background, your ability to reduce risks and solve problems, your results-driven leadership, your great communication and collaborations skills at project level or cross projects will be a huge asset to Logitech. Your Contribution: Move fast. Speak up. Decide and own. Drive change. Exceed customer expectations. These are some of the winning behaviors youll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will: Manage and coordinate the project from the concept to up to the introduction in Mass Production applying project management standards Ability to manage different type of projects: new technology brick, cross-project feature, complete device Scope, plan, budget and follow up the development of new product or new technical bricks based on roadmap Collaborate with Portfolio / Product Design Manager / Engineering to develop project scope and to define project plan. Establish & manage product and project cost, schedule, experience.. Lead a project team - multi-functions and multi-sites worldwide Synthesize and present the project's stake in a comprehensive manner to help the team make decisions, make clear recommendations when needed. Report and communicate on a regular basis. Escalate when project goals are at risk. This includes regular reporting of project status to key stakeholders, Business Group leader through management review meetings and Gate meetings as prescribed by internal development processes Identify, evaluate and escalate the risks associated with project activities and take appropriate actions to control the risks and to drive solutions. Synthesize data and information related to scope or risks change. Collaborate with Functional Manager to improve project organization, efficiency (tools, processes) and time to market. Ensure that project activities operate within the policies and processes of the organization. Key Qualifications: For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team: Minimum 5 years of experience as a project Manager with involvement from initial concept through product delivery with stable manufacturing Strong cross functional knowledge in Mechanical, Electrical Engineering and Embedded Software Expertise developing sustainable product is a plus Deep knowledge of project management standards & methodology Independant. Design Thinking Knowledge and application. Creative mindset Excellent verbal and written communication skills, multi-site development teams, cross-functional teams including marketing and business interfaces. Strong organizational, excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to work across organizations and geographies Faculty to interact, influence and negotiate effectively with all levels of management Ability to manage multiple tasks activities, projects and sustaining projects Ability to travel - Domestic on a regular basis and Intercontinental based on project events.s Good understanding of working with a functional team in a Global Environment Ability to develop comprehensive project development timeline and risk tracking overview by using proper tools. Education: Master degree in Engineering Fluent in English. French is a plus Formal Project Management training and Certification (PMP) would be a plus Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it. As a company, were small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen. But were big enough in our portfolio, and reach for those actions to have a global impact. Thats a pretty sweet spot to be in and were always striving to keep it that way. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at 510-713- 4866 for assistance. #LI-AC2

Position Title Cataract Sales Specialist - German Speaking Regions, Switzerland 03-Apr-2020 Job ID 285033BR Job Description Alcon are the market leader in eye care globally, helping people see better through advanced surgical and vision care products. If an innovative and forward thinking company is what you are looking for and are motivated by making a difference to people’s lives then get in touch! We are seeking an experienced sales professional, ideally with Ophthalmology/medical device or an Optometrist with a strong commercial focus who is seeking a change in their career. You will work with your customers across all German speaking regions therefore speaking fluent German language is required along with good English. Job purpose Drive Alcon Surgical’s advanced technology portfolio (focus on toric & multi-focal IOL’s) sales and market share at target customers. Develop adoption and growth of advanced technology within the ophthalmic market. Major accountabilities Achieve Sales and market share TGT across the Sx portfolio of advanced technology products, i.e. • Toric IOLs (Intra Ocular Lens) • Multifocal IOLs • Verion / ORA • Advanced equipment : LenSx, Wavelight • Deployment of Value-Added Services in support of the advanced technology portfolio Drive advanced technology penetration in target customers : • Develop toric towards standard of care (jointly with Cataract Procedure Managers and other commercial support functions) • Drive full and rapid adoption of LenSx/Verion/ORA according to business opportunity • Interact with surgeons, hospital buyers, head of OR and pharmacists to increase the use of advanced technology • Prepare, negotiate and follow-up offers and close commercial deals • Interact with financial liaisons to discuss financing models and schemes , partnering with Market Access , Business Planning Analyst and Tender, Pricing & Contract team • Participate in trade shows, conventions and trainings educational events & activities with health care professionals (including evenings and incidentally also during weekends ) Role supporting • Ensure technical excellence in support of new and ongoing external and internal training of Alcon devices, in particular for advanced technologies • Drive with local Clinical Application Specialist clinical and training development • Foster collaborative relationships for sales support and customer problem solving with Safety , Technical Services, Marketing, Clinical Application Specialist and logistics • Report to management on competitor activities, customer/market trends and potential for new products and services. CRM • At all times ensure customer segmentation & targeting information is of high quality and up to date • Sales time allocation as per defined Customer approach (Partner, Grow, Protect and Let go) • Timely, complete and effective reporting into CRM system • Efficiently use analytical tools to continuously improve customer satisfaction and sales performance • Create and manage customer account plans Keeps abreast of product applications, technical services, market conditions, competitive activities, advertising and promotional trends through the reading of pertinent literature and consulting with marketing, medical and technical service areas. Consistently act in accordance with Alcon standard operating procedures and Values & Behaviours as well as medical device regulatory environment. Minimum requirements • Experience in Optometry or Optics • Ophthalmologic experience is key • Sales experience in ophthalmology • Fluent German and good English (French an advantage) • At least three (3) years of clinical applications experience, preferably in cataract and femtosecond laser refractive surgery or • At least three (3) years of sales experience, in cataract and femtosecond laser refractive surgery • Deep understanding of optometry / ophthalmic surgery • Deep understanding of laser mechanics/engineering and technical Job Type Full Time Country Switzerland Work Location Rotkreuz Functional Area Sales Division ALCON Business Unit NON-NVS AL COMMERCIAL EMEA Employment Type Regular Company/Legal Entity ALCON SWITZERLAND SA Shift Work No

Basic Info Location Zrich, Generic, Global Job type Full-Time Contract Regular/Permanent Take the next step in your career at ABB, working in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. As the Senior Group Technical Accounting & Reporting (A&R) Manager you will be reporting to the Head of Technical Accounting of the ABB Group, headquartered in Switzerland. You will ensure a true and fair view of financial data provided to all stakeholders of ABB in compliance with the ABB Accounting & Reporting Guidelines based on U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) as well as other relevant instructions including regulations of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Furthermore, you will be ensuring efficient operation of group A&R processes to facilitate timely and accurate preparation of Group reporting in line with the latest regulatory requirements. Your responsibilities Responsible for operational execution and processes of the ABB Group, including definition of the standards and policies for A&R, validation and processing of subsidiaries inputs and preparation of Group public reports. Leading role in Accounting Policy & Practice team in evaluating and concluding on complex US GAAP A&R topics including e.g. revenue recognition, leasing and provisions for industrial companies. Researching on technical accounting matters and preparing technical accounting memos for internal stakeholders and the external auditors. Leading role in group-wide projects with focus on A&R including the implementation of updates to US GAAP standards. Organizing and facilitating internal and external training on accounting and reporting related matters. Designing and maintaining internal controls over financial reporting and performing control activities in the respective area of responsibility in compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley requirements. Functionally managing A&R specialists in a global organization. First point of contact for the group external auditors. Living ABBs core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. Your background Masters level degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration. U.S. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) coupled with a minimum of ten years of experience in technical accounting and financial reporting according to US GAAP and SEC standards, preferably with a renowned public accounting firm (big four). International work experience obtained in a multinational company in the industrial sector. Experience in finance project management involving significant change management. Experience in delivering accounting and reporting trainings according to US GAAP standards. Fluent in English, other languages are an added advantage. Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to deliver clear and concise guidance and instructions to subsidiaries, other Group functions and Business Areas. Ability to be diplomatic and yet persistent in the resolution of identified deviations from ABB Accounting & Reporting Guidelines. Demonstrated ability to establish effective working relationships with personnel at all organizational levels and contributing to a team. Das Institut fr Parasitologie der Universitt Bern untersucht verschiedenste Parasitosen bei Haus- und Nutztieren, sowie auch beim Menschen, in den Bereichen Forschung, Dienstleistung und Lehre. Forschungsschwerpunkte des Instituts liegen bei zoonotischen Helminthosen (Echinococcose, Fasciolose), und protozoren Aborterregern (Neosporose, Toxoplasmose, Tritrichomonose). Der Fokus liegt hierbei auf der Entwicklung neuer Behandlungsmethoden gegen die genannten Erkrankungen. Mehr Informationen zu unserem Institut sind hier zu finden: http://www.ipa.vetsuisse.unibe.ch. Hintergrund zum Forschungsprojekt: Alveolre Echinococcose (AE) ist eine Infektion der Leber mit dem larvalen Stadium (Metazestode) des Fuchsbandwurmes Echinococcus multilocularis. Diese Metazestoden sind durch tumorartiges, infiltratives Wachstum charakterisiert, wobei es zu Metastasenbildung in anderen Organen kommen kann. Unbehandelt fhrt diese Infektion sowohl bei Menschen als auch bei Hunden, Affen, und anderen Tieren zum Tod. Medikaments heilbar ist die AE jedoch nicht. Die heute verwendeten Medikamente haben nur parasitostatische Wirkung und sind nicht in der Lage, den Parasiten abzutten. Daher wird dringend nach neuen Medikamenten gesucht. In unserem Labor verwenden wir die in vitro Kultur des Parasiten fr das Screening von Wirkstoffen zur Identifizierung und Charakterisierung neuer therapeutischer Mglichkeiten sowie zur Erforschung grundlegender zell- und molekularbiologischer Fragestellungen der AE. Diese werden mittels Transkriptom-, Proteom- und Metabolomanalysen ergnzt. Unser Fokus liegt hierbei auf dem mitochondriellen Energiemetabolismus des Parasiten, sowie auf der Wirts-Parasit-Interaktion. Ausgewhlte Themen werden auch im Mausmodell weiterverfolgt. Mehr Informationen zu aktuellen Projekten sind hier zu finden: https://www.ipa.vetsuisse.unibe.ch/forschung/gruppe_lundstroem_stadelmann/index_ger.html. Anforderungen Wir suchen eine Person mit folgendem Profil: PhD in Naturwissenschaften oder (Veterinr-) Medizin Forschungserfahrung Ausgeprgte Erfahrung im Arbeiten mit Zellkulturen und Parasiten, sowie biochemischen, molekularbiologischen und zellbiologischen Methoden Starker Hintergrund in Bioinformatik (Transkriptom-, Proteom-, und Metabolomanalysen), Statistik und Programmieren Erfahrung mit Tierversuchen (Muse) Selbstndiges Arbeiten im Labor, in der Planung und Auswertung von Versuchen, sowie im Verfassen von Manuskripten Teamfhigkeit und Mitbetreuung von PhD und Masterstudenten/-studentinnen Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch Wir bieten Junge, enthusiastische Forschungsgruppe Enge Zusammenarbeit im Team Etablierte parasitologische, zellbiologische, molekularbiologische und biochemische Methoden Betreuung von Studentinnen und Studenten, Mglichkeit der Mitarbeit in der Lehre Projekt des Schweizerischen Nationalfonds (SNF) mit nationalen und internationalen Kollaborationen Gehalt und Sozialabgaben richten sich nach den Grundlagen der Universitt Bern und des SNF Interessiert? Fr allfllige Rckfragen steht die Gruppenleiterin Prof. Dr. Britta Lundstrm-Stadelmann (britta.lundstroem@vetsuisse.unibe.ch) gerne zur Verfgung. Bewerbung (Motivationsschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse, Referenzen) knnen als ein PDF Dokument bis zum 15. September 2020 an Frau Barbara Gautschi (barbara.gautschi@vetsuisse.unibe.ch) gesendet werden. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung! www.unibe.ch

Lonza ist heute ein weltweit fhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft ttig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafr, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lsung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbststndig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben mchten. Fr die wachsende Business Unit Chemicals mit dem Netzwerk API (Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients) suchen wir fr unser Werk in Visp einen Projekt Ingenieur (CAPEX Lead/Technischer Projektleiter) Ihre Hauptaufgaben: Planung, Management und Lieferung von Investitionsprojekten gemss Funktionszielen, Terminplan und Kosten unter Bercksichtigung von Regulatorien, cGMP und Sicherheitsvorschriften Zusammensetzung, Koordination und Fhrung von Projektteams in einer Matrix Organisation zum Erreichen der Projektziele Erstellen der Projektablauf Organisation mit allen notwendigen Fachfunktionen Definition der Projektziele: Qualitt, Termine und Kosten Durchfhrung des Projekt Engineering Designs, mit Prozess- und Verfahrenstechnischem Wissen zusammen mit dem Team durch alle Projekt Phasen Erarbeiten von innovativen und nachhaltigen Lsungen Projektkontrolle, Fortschritts-, Abweichungs- und Vorschau-Berichte Regelmssiger Austausch mit dem Gesamt Projektleiter, dem Projekt Steuerungsteam und dem Kunden Ihr Anforderungsprofil: Master Degree in Engineering, Maschinenbau, Prozess-, Verfahrens-Technik oder hnliches Langjhrige Projektmanagement Erfahrung in der Chemischen- oder Biochemischen Industrie Erfahrung und Expertise im Anlagebau, Prozessen fr die Herstellung von Wirkstoffen (API) unter cGMP Bedingungen, Automation und Infrastruktur Systemen Familir mit den gngigen Projekt Management Software Tools Sehr gute Beherrschung der Deutschen und Englischen Sprache in Wort und Schrift Leader Persnlichkeit, motivierender Team Player und ausgezeichneter Kommunikator, gebt im Management von Matrix organisierten Teams mit verschiedenen Fachfunktionen Ausgezeichnete Analytische- und Problemlsungs-Fhigkeiten um zusammen mit dem Team Lsungen zu erarbeiten, Prioritten voran zu treiben und die Projektziele zu erreichen Fhigkeit selbststndig zu Arbeiten in einer Team orientierten, kollaborativen Umgebung Lonzas Produkte und Services wirken sich tglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Fr uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschftsergebnisse erreichen ist fr uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schtzen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Erfolg bedeutet fr uns moralisch vertretbaren Fortschritt. Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Anstze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lsen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

ROLE SUMMARY Pfizers Chapel Hill site is an early stage cGMP manufacturing facility for the companys gene therapy candidates as they enter Phase 1 and 2 clinical trials. The site contains a cGMP manufacturing facility capable of producing both drug substance and drug product along with the ancillary support areas including QC labs and inventory management spaces. The small size of the Chapel Hill site allows the team to be a flexible manufacturing unit allowing everyone to get involved in the various aspects of a cGMP manufacturing operation while working on multiple gene therapy products for rare disease indications. Gene therapy is an exciting growth area within the biotechnology industry and Pfizers portfolio. Our manufacturing facility is conveniently located on the edge of RTP right off Interstate 40. Technical Operations III of Biotherapeutics Drug Product Manufacturing is a GMP Drug Product manufacturing position responsible for the execution and review of batch records following site approved standard operating procedures (SOP). This position will maintain and prepare equipment, revise SOPs, Train personnel, formulate drug products, aseptically fill and inspect drug products manufactured in the AN-LDM according to approved SOPs and batch records. ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES Manufactures research, pre-clinical (GLP) and clinical (GMP) grade rAAV vectors utilizing shaker flasks, WAVE bioreactors and stir tank bioreactors along with depth filtration, centrifugation, column chromatography, and TFF. Strictly adheres to SOPs, GLP, and cGMP regulations, including GMP batch records, and accurately completes documentation associated with preclinical and clinical manufacturing. Maintains areas and manufacturing documentation in compliance with SOPs, GLPs, and cGMPs. Develops and revises GLP and GMP SOPs and master production records and solution batch records to ensure their compliance with cGMPs. Performs routine maintenance and troubleshooting of equipment and processes. Adheres to Company safety procedures and guidelines by practicing and promoting safe work habits. Has solid working knowledge and skills in procedures, techniques, tools, materials and/or equipment needed for position. Expanding technical skills and range of operational knowledge. Identifies and solves moderately complex problems. Makes decisions that require choosing from limited options. May seek the input and assistance of others. Manages own time and professional development; accountable for own results. Begins to prioritize own workflow. Completes assignments with limited supervision using established procedures and general instructions. Deviations from standard procedures are referred to supervisor. QUALIFICATIONS 7-10 years experience with an AS degree 0-4 years experience with an BS degree Experience in cGMP compliance as related to manufacture of biologics Downstream processing experience Excellent oral and written communication skills; authoring of SOPs Comfortable with training new operators Role tasks will include frequent bending, lifting (up to 40 pounds) and twisting motions. Ability to stand for several consecutive hours Good working knowledge of GLPs and regulatory compliance requirements in a cGMP environment. Experience working with computerized system (bioreactors, chromatography systems, filtration units). Understandings of scientific principles in order to problem solve and troubleshoot test results. Ability to think critically and demonstrate troubleshooting and problem solving skills. The successful candidate will possess strong interpersonal, teamwork, and collaboration skills. In addition, possesses strong workload planning skills, organization, and attention to detail, and follow through. Problem-solving and trouble shooting skills are essential. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to prioritize and multi-task concurrent project demands. Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office required e.g. MS Word, MS Excel. Preference will be given to candidates with commercial upstream manufacturing experience. PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS Must be able to gown into cleanroom environment. Must be able to pass vision and respiratory testing. Must be able to perform simple mathematical calculations including addition and multiplication. NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS 1st Shift position Monday thru Friday 8 hours Occasional weekend work is expected. Other Job Details: Last Date to Apply for Job: February 18, 2021 Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus: YES Sunshine Act Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. Manufacturing#LI-PFE

Job ID: 33372 | Location: Muttenz, Canton of Basel-Landschaft, Switzerland The purpose of Clariant Corporate Audit is to provide independent, objective assurance and consulting services guided by the Standards of the IIA framework and a philosophy of adding value to improve the operations of Clariant. It assists Clariant in accomplishing its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and to improve the effectiveness of the organization's governance, risk management and controls. Corporate Audit is guided by the Clariant Code of Ethics, which outlines Clariant's ethical principles and values to be applied in daily business. Your role as Audit Manager (M/F/D) will help to shape the future by providing independent assurance as the 3rd Line to Management and Board of Directors. You will report to the Head Corporate Audit. Responsibilities Lead the execution of operational, financial and project audits and reviews (pre-, on-site and post phase) Evaluate the risk and internal controls of the audited units and/or processes Identify the root causes of audit findings and investigate, analyze and recommend practical solutions to prevent re-occurrence Manage knowledge and drive innovation to ensure high-quality, value-adding and digitally-enabled audit execution Document audit observations, recommendations and prepare audit reports Communicate the audit results to local and global management Support compliance reviews where required together with Group Compliance Special reviews and assignments Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in accounting / finance / business administration 10+ years of relevant in audit, controls and risk management Big 4 public accounting firm experience is strongly preferred CPA / CIA Qualification qualification Understanding of technology enablers (e.g., Controls monitoring, data analytics) Good SAP Knowledge (FI/CO) Self-starter, ability to proactively problem-solve, identify, advocate for and execute improvements Ability to maintain a positive attitude and embrace change, thrive in a fast-paced environment Managerial courage to confront difficult issues with the appropriate response You have strong communication skills in English, with fluency in Mandarin beinghighly beneficial, and any other languages are an added advantage Willingness to travel regionally and globally up to 50% Our Offer Highly interesting, versatile and challenging work environment. High degree of flexibility in your activities and tasks Attractive remuneration and excellent employee benefits Tailored trainings to support your development needs Andrew Humphreys Regional Talent Acquisition Manager EMEA Phone: +49 619 6757-8912 E-Mail: Andrew.Humphreys@clariant.com #LI-AH1 Clariant is a focused, sustainable and innovative specialty chemical company based near Basel in Switzerland. Last year the recorded CHF 4.4 billion in sales for its continuing businesses, harnessing the talents of its 14 000 employees across 50+ countries. Clariant’s portfolio is optimized for future growth, with a focus in three business areas: Care Chemicals, Catalysis and Natural Resources. We believe that our growth is all about our customers and their success. Investment in innovation capabilities and developing an inspiring environment for courageous and determined minds are therefore key to reaching our goal. Join us and help create through chemistry for customers all over the globe. About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Is Risk Advisory your passion? Then we're the right company for you. Organisations rely on internal controls to mitigate risk and ensure regulatory compliance. Transforming the ways internal controls have been executed in the past and reducing the cost of compliance is currently a key priority on many Board agendas. We strive to help our client in achieving their business performance goals by using different techniques and the latest technology with the goal of building up smart and efficient risk management and internal control frameworks that correspond to the business needs and speed of current change.Deloitte offers deep experience in providing risk and controls transformational solutions that help our clients managing their risks more efficiently and anticipate change and prepare for the future. Our Risk & Controls Transformation team in Advisory is one of the fastest growing service lines in Deloitte. Thus, we can offer unrivalled career growth & learning opportunities. Successful candidates will get the opportunity to help us develop our market offering and the potential to work closely with our key priority clients, either within our own team or together with other Technology and Digital teams as part of a bigger multidisciplinary project team.We are looking for high performing professionals with in-depth experience in business processes and internal controls and with a specific focus and interest in managing business process risks through adequate design, implementation and operation of internal controls to help us transforming the way controls are being operated and designing. Responsibilities Advising our clients to find ways to reduce the current cost of compliance embracing technology and out-of-the-box solutionsSupporting our clients to define good practice controls in the main core business processes and develop long term strategic plans for ensuring continuous complianceUnderstanding business requirements and business transformation and translating them into efficient and smart control frameworksIdentifying operational, compliance or regulatory requirements as well as automation opportunities in the current control environment and design the relevant internal controls to help manage/mitigate these risksDelivering a wide range of client engagements which could include business process and control design, optimisation and automation (i.e. through Continuous Control Monitoring (CCM))Build and maintain client relationships in the risk and controls area to help grow our practiceGaining experience of the latest technologies and understanding/managing the impact of these on the internal control environment of the company (i.e. S/4 HANA)Developing our client portfolio, by supporting business development, practice management and thought leadership activities To qualify for this Manager role you must have: In-depth understanding and ability to discuss the core business processes (e.g. PTP, OTC, RTR, Treasury, Tax, HR, etc.) and respective business risksIn-depth experience in business process and control framework design (re-design), documentation and implementation (including walkthrough and controls design) to mitigate business risksGood understanding of key risk management conceptsExternal audit experience is desirable but not required, if you have previous experience on business and controls advisory workKnowledge of ERP systems (mainly SAP) and others (Ariba, Concur) is an advantageGood understanding of main S/4 Hana processes / changes vs traditional ERP systems and impact on the business processes and controls is a plusExperience working under high pressure and in a fast pace environmentPrevious professional services experience within a Big4 is an assetBusiness development experience, good sales skills and business acumenVery good client management and communication skillsDrive, passion and be proactiveFluent in English, German is an asset Any questions? Get in touch. We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any questions, please contact Rebecca Hodge at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 176909

As Site Operations Manager you will lead the operations activities on the sites Naturex in Bischofszell and Burgdorf. Who wants to collaborate and learn together with teams who are as passionate as you are? Then join us and improve your world. You have: An advanced degree (M. Sc) in Process or Food Technology with further finance or business management trainings Experience of 5 years in a comparable environment At least 3 years experience in a broader leadership position Experience in Supply Chain Management, Superior Customer Experience and Lean Management Business fluent in English and German. Other languages (e.g.French) a plus Experienced in the implementation and optimization of processes incl. associated IT systems Very good skills in controlling Experienced in communicating and presenting Analytical and organizational skills and high ratio orientation Responsible and structured work with affinity to problem solving

<strong>Who We Are</strong> <br/><br/> Roche Diagnostics International Ltd in Rotkreuz is one of the world&rsquo;s leading providers of diagnostic system solutions for clinics, laboratories and doctors&rsquo; offices. The company employs over 2200 people in Rotkreuz and is one of Roche Diagnostics main sites. <br/><br/> Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual&rsquo;s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. <br/><br/> <strong>The Department</strong> <br/><br/> The Direct Procurement department has over a decade of experience and today we are looking to enter the next level of maturity. Join our transformation journey! You can become the strategic sparring partner to our Global Operations and R&amp;D stakeholders with regards to procurement decisions very early on in the process. Help us create a long term strategy to become a key enabler for Roche Diagnostics to grow profitably and to secure and extend its market leadership. What we have to offer is an exercise in organizational evolution, an open path to a truly global career and the chance to successfully lead through influence. <br/><br/> <strong>The Position</strong> <br/><br/> The Direct Procurement Project Manager is accountable for delivering on high value strategic projects according to the relevant Business Area / Business Unit Product Portfolio Strategy, Product Development roadmap, and annual pipeline of initiatives within DOP. The role supports the Business Area / Business Unit Lifecycle Teams and cross functional Lifecycle Project Teams by executing procurement deliverables according to defined Product Development Processes using project management methodologies, stakeholder engagement, and leveraging Roche&rsquo;s category and supplier management strategies to influence and/or own decision-making in sourcing strategies. <br/><br/> As a member of the Upstream Procurement team, the Project Manager is accountable for delivering procurement deliverables on assigned projects and agreed targets, goals to ensure product development milestones are achieved, and material cost, delivery, and quality targets are realized while in compliance with relevant policies, standards, guidelines, and operating procedures. The role is responsible for ensuring the successful execution and completion of procurement deliverables on product development projects while leveraging category and supplier strategies to maximize value to the product portfolio. The Project Manager is responsible for selecting and developing suppliers in alignment with global category and supplier strategies in the pre-launch phase of product development. <br/><br/> <u>This role can be based in Rotkreuz (Switzerland) or in Waiblingen (Germany).</u> <br/><br/> <strong>What you will do</strong> <ul> <li>Deliver on assigned projects and targets: High value strategic projects according to the relevant Business Area / Business Unit Product Portfolio Strategy, Product Development roadmap, and annual pipeline of initiatives within DOP.</li><li>Create all primary product development deliverables and obtain sign off for all major milestones in line with Roche&rsquo;s category and supplier management approach, and in compliance with relevant policies, standards, guidelines, and operating procedures. After project execution, ensure a smooth and efficient handover to the Procurement Operations teams.</li><li>Apply robust project management: Create and execute against project plans. Work in cooperation with Business Project Leaders / Project Managers to ensure the appropriate support is leveraged to deliver project needs.</li><li>Establish effective project support: Ensure robust project support by leveraging category and supplier management, procurement process know-how, and Direct Procurement Project Specialist resources, where applicable. Serve as the primary contact for procurement and ensure issues and needs are addressed and resolved in a timely manner.</li><li>Monitor and mitigate risk: Monitor the progress of projects and pro-actively identify and report any projected risks to overall targets or timelines as well as potential mitigation strategies. Resolve issues and project risks on a timely basis and escalate issues and risks where appropriate.</li><li>Provide feedback: Contribute any feedback to employees that have been involved in the project execution and delivery as requested by their performance managers.</li> </ul> <strong>Who you are</strong> <br/><br/> You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. <ul> <li>Strong background in strategic sourcing and supplier management in new product development and introduction in the medical device/pharmaceutical industry, or other highly regulated industry.</li><li>5+ years&rsquo; procurement or supply chain experience delivering measurable value in strategic sourcing, enterprise cost reduction, and / or operational efficiency projects.</li><li>3+ years of project management experience including risk management, project reporting, and delivering quantitative and qualitative results in complex environments.</li><li>Experience in a scientific or engineering capacity, or vocational training. University degree in Business or Life Sciences is desirable.</li><li>Experience in new product and/or technology transfer processes and requirements</li><li>Strong analytical experience including ability to drive insights from large and varied data sources, data visualization applications (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview) and database applications (e.g. Access).</li></ul> <ul> <li>Experience with enterprise systems (SAP, Oracle) and procurement / procure-to-pay tools such as (e.g. Ariba, Emptoris, SAP) is preferred.</li><li>Knowledgeable in procurement specific systems and processes for the efficient management of sourcing events and contract negotiations (e.g. eSourcing, eAuction).</li></ul> <ul> <li>Life Sciences or Management Consulting industry experience would be ideal.</li><li>Any professional purchasing (e.g. CIPS), project management (e.g. PMP, Prince 2), or Finance related licenses or certifications would be considered advantageous.</li><li>Strong communications skills &ndash; ability to work with senior stakeholders within the business. Strong English along with proficiency within German would be ideal.</li><li>Availability to travel (air and ground both domestic and internationally) for up to 20-30% of time for various meetings at Roche and Supplier sites.</li> </ul> <strong>Roche is an equal opportunity employer.</strong><br/><br/>Procurement, Procurement &gt; Operational &amp; Transactional Procurement

We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations.
