We are Credit Suisse. We offer We are looking for individuals who would you like to use their strategic thinking by being part of the Lombard program - a strategic initiative. Join our truly global, dynamic organization and become part of an inspiring team. • This role, which is based in Zurich, is collaborating with front office, risk management, trading, and IT and therefore grants you high visibility as business partner to internal clients • Lead program workstream in line with the Bank's project management practices and standards • Through constant contact with leaders, you have an excellent platform to build a broad, cross-functional network within the bank • Supervise creating business requirements provided by key business partners, and documenting these into business rules and aligning them with our operating model • Build the bridge between IT and the business by translating and tailoring the technical content into business applicable material with recommendations and insights relevant to the audience at hand • Lead deep dive analyses, data profiling & data transformation rules and proposing solutions for data visualization • Work in partnership with upstream and downstream systems owners and programs to define business solutions and develop functional specifications that deliver requirements • Drive definition of requirements for monitoring and reporting purposes by working in close coordination the business teams to ensure effective data visualization • Perform impact and gap analysis of various changes to systems and processes, as well as scope changes • Oversight of business validation and User Acceptance Testing activity, while working closely with the front and back office teams • You join a forward-thinking team whose team spirit and specific expertise guarantee an exciting working environment and growth opportunities You Offer You offer Are you a dedicated and highly motivated individual who establishes effective relationships with key partners and can make things happen? Then, join us to develop our business! • A university degree, ideally postgraduate or relevant professional qualifications in Finance or Economics, Computer science, Machine Learning or Data or business Management • 5-10 years of experience in project management, collecting and translating business requirements with data management capabilities, process analysis and change experience in a similar role within a large financial institution paired with proven experience of successful project delivery • Understanding Credit Risk from monitoring and reporting processes and workflows perspective with direct experience in credit risk system implementations is an advantage • Proficient understanding of front to back systems and requirements within risk functions of International Banks and Wealth Management to perform processing, reconciliation, calculation and visualization of data • Significant experience of embedding new risk management systems in a sophisticated organization, paired with a deep understanding of strategic program delivery • You are a dedicated problem solver with a positive personality and can-do attitude • Proficiency in English, any other languages are a plus *LI-CSJOB* Ms. V. About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 13,000 employees across the world. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us? About the role As an CoE Area Lead in the DDS Business and Delivery Excellence CoE you have the opportunity to help our customers to reach the next level of their business and delivery excellence. Initiate and successfully lead major, cross-functional programmes and complex projects out of the client project portfolio. Be part of the broader DDS Management team and help our unit to mature and professionalise. Together with the CoE Lead Business & Delivery Excellence, ensure consistent performance of the unit. Responsibilities: Staff team members on projects (jointly with Client Demand Managers, CoE Leads and other partners), supported by the Delivery & Value Management team Lead employee HR/admin activities (e.g. goal setting, performance appraisal, etc.) and a highly diverse team of mixed profiles who lead/work in strategy, process excellence and business transformation projects and Mentor individuals, handle project critical issues through developing/guiding team members by inspiring, encouraging and providing constructive feedback to help improve performance Regularly reviewing assignments and project progress with team members to recognize successes and help resolve (or advance) issues while Building pro-active, co-operative and effective working relationships with customers, peers and senior partners Support major business transformation programmes and other projects and closely work with partners to identify the best method of successfully run project/programme Lead the internal project resources from GDT-DDS and/or Partners as well as external resources, if applicable and form the team and support building the BDE CoE and Contribute to the Knowledge Exchange (KX) across the CoE(s) About the team Join us, the Design & Delivery Services (DDS) unit! We have the exciting mission to enable business transformation and operational excellence initiatives across Swiss Re to fuel profitable growth and strengthen our market position. The BDE CoE is an integral part of DDS. We help our customers operationalise their strategies, business and operating model design and operational improvements and provide project and transformation management & execution incl. agile project delivery. About you As a successful candidate for this role, you ideally fit the below profile: Are a natural problem solver and critical thinker who can easily break down big challenges in smaller ones. You have a passion to perform and enjoy helping others to excel. Live and breathe exemplary collaboration. You're at ease to bring together people from different teams, backgrounds, expertise and seniority levels to jointly create customer value. Demonstrated your ability to influence without direct reporting line and beyond organisational silos. Have a passion for putting the customer at the centre of all work and a consistent track record of delivering results, impact and customer value. Are a great communicator, strong in visualisation and storytelling. Have leadership experience. You prefer working with people as opposed to have people working for you. You know agile leadership principles and strive to be/become a catalyst leader. Have 10+ years of work experience in an enabling role in the business, consulting or an IT related role. Have a great track record and experience in Business Transformation, Operational Excellence, Delivery Management and Digital Transformation. Demonstrate the ability to use data and empirical methods to influence improvements. Are a hardworking learner, courageous to experiment and try out innovative approaches. Interested in this new challenge? We are looking forward to your application! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Position summary About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Technology Audit & Assurance is one of the fastest growing areas at Deloitte, it plays one of the most important roles in the transformation of our Audit & Assurance services. As a member of our Technology Audit & Assurance team you can expect to work with a young, innovative and technology savvy team, that shapes and delivers innovative audit and assurance solutions. In your everyday role you will work in multidisciplinary teams and help our clients with their most challenging problems. You will be involved in clients from the following industries: Healthcare & Life Sciences, Consumer & Industrial Products, Transportation, Energy & Resources, TMT, Banking, Insurance, Investment Management etc. Your projects will take you to several countries and you will work with international teams from UK, France, Asia, US and many others. Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a comprehensive internal and external training program (e.g. CISA Certified Information Systems Auditor). Responsibilities Work with an outstanding client portfolio and client service team. Plan and organize IT internal audit, IT assurance, IT risk and control consulting, internal control and/or internal audit procedures. Review work performed by the teams. Perform Data analytics. Effectively serve client needs and develop strong advisory relationships with client personnel. Display teamwork, integrity and leadership. Utilize leading edge technology and data analytics toolsets to continually learn and deliver business insights to our clients. Provide value-added and relevant analyses of an organization's governance, risk management and internal control structure, performance, and efficiency. Your profile Between 6 - 10 years of relevant work experience (IT audit / SOX controls testing). A University degree in a Computer Science or Information Systems. A relevant professional designation (e.g. CISA or CISSP). In-depth knowledge of core technology domains (SAP and other ERP systems) and risks present in a modern IT organization. Advanced knowledge of audit methodologies and developing key audit deliverables, including process flows, work programs, audit reports, and control summaries. Advanced knowledge of Third Party Assurance Reports (SOC1, ISAE3402, ISEA3000 etc.) Experience in Big 4 (mandatory) Fluency in French and English, German is an asset. Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams, prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments, and manage ambiguity. Strong commitment to professional client service excellence. An excellent interpersonal skills to interact in team environment and foster client relationships. An exceptional leadership, and team building skills Your chance The environment at Deloitte is made up of intellectually curious, smart people; including world class experts - you could become one of them or simply learn from them. Your mix of work will help foster your leadership skills and you'll develop a peer group whom you respect and have fun with. In addition, you will have the opportunity to identify areas of work which are of particular interest to you. Any questions? Get in touch. We look forward to hearing from you! Please be aware that we only consider complete applications, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, by using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position. If you have any questions, please contact Mr. Simone Terlizzi at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 179654

Do you enjoy marketing and are you good at competitive analysis and product positioning? Were looking for an intern to support us in performing competitive studies for our latest product innovation and defining a marketing strategy. Start date is Aug/Sep 2021, duration for at least 6 months. Who is Hilti? If youre new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With 30,000 people in more than 120 countries, which were looking to expand, were a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career. What does the role involve? As intern in our department you will be part of our Application Leadership Management team within Business Unit Installation Systems. Youll work closely with our experts to develop and implement competitive product positioning and support the roll-out of marketing strategy around the globe. Your key responsibilities will be to (1) understand the latest innovative product offering launched in 3 different regions and learn specific needs of these markets in competitive product positioning (2) Perform competitive product analysis including productivity studies and build a comprehensive marketing strategy. You will have both project ownership and responsibility for on-time delivery and quality. INNOVATION - Youll work with some of the industrys most trusted and innovative engineering products. We introduced more than 40 new products, services and software last year. Take a look at some of them. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HRkhVT9FKDkb What do we offer? Well give you the tools you need to excel in your internship, including one-to-one coaching. Youll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as youll manage your own project while being part of a friendly team. Youll not just be another pair of hands but a fully integrated team member with lots of self-responsibility. From there, well trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and well reward you with strategic development discussions and career opportunities. Well support you even before you start with us through relocation and integration support. With the international interns community at Hilti youll never be bored. Further, the snow-draped mountains, crystal-clear lakes and marvelous landscapes in the Happy Valley invite for lots of outdoor activities. Why should you apply? We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. So, if you have no knowledge of construction, thats fine with us. Were more interested in your ability, commitment and drive to succeed. What you need is: Masters student in technical, engineering and/or marketing studies Focus of educational career and personal interest in Marketing, corporate experience is a plus Proficient in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint Strong communication skills, with excellent English and interpersonal skills A proactive approach and self-reliant personality We take our time to get to know you. As part of your recruitment process, youll get to talk to your internship coach as well as your HR Manager who both can answer some of your burning questions. Hilti is an equal opportunity employer.

Published 29 September 2021 Workplace , , Switzerland Category Position Stellenportal In der aktuellen Covid-19 Situation laufen die Rekrutierungen weiter. Es kann dabei allerdings zu Verzögerungen kommen. Vielen Dank für Ihr Verständnis. 100%, Zurich, fixed-term This project is part of an interdisciplinary collaboration between the groups of Prof. Klaus Eyer (functional single cell readouts, ETH Zurich), Prof. Helmuth Gehart (tumor and stem cell biology, ETH Zurich), and Prof. Kruithof-de Julio (urological research laboratory, Inselspital/UBERN). The advertised position will be evenly shared between the laboratories of Prof. Eyer and Prof. Gehart and exist at the interface of engineering and tumor biology. The Laboratory for Functional Immune Repertoire Analysis (Prof. Klaus Eyer, Institute of Pharmaceutical Sciences, ETH Zurich) focuses on developing and applying technologies and analytical strategies that allow us to measure, describe and exploit the functionality of individual cells and systems. Our research currently centers around various fundamental and applied scientific questions for vaccine-mediated protection and personalized medicine. We combine chemical, physical, engineering, and biological aspects in our interdisciplinary approach to achieve our aims. Prof. Dr. Helmuth Gehart (Institute of Molecular Health Sciences, ETH Zurich) is an expert in organoid technology, stem cell biology, and single-cell techniques. He co-developed several new organoid systems (e.g., human liver organoids), integrated single-cell readouts in vitro and in vivo, and currently pioneers nanoliter-droplet organoid cultures. The Gehart research group combines in vivo and in vitro techniques to study the mechanisms of stem cell control and cancer biology to reinvigorate exhausted tissue regeneration and stop the progression of malignant disease. Our laboratories are located on the Hönggerberg Campus in Zürich (Switzerland). Project background Tumoroids serve as excellent in vitro avatars for individual patients due to their ability to reflect the inherent heterogeneity in the tumor of origin. This makes the system particularly suitable for personalized medicine, patient stratification, and evaluating the efficacy of therapeutic approaches. As a result, multiple studies have shown that in vitro drug responses of tumoroids are predictive for the success or failure of a particular treatment strategy in a patient. Despite these impressive results, all organoid assays suffer from the same limitation: The biopsy takes 2-3 months to identify tumor-specific vulnerabilities. Although this is acceptable (though still not ideal) for genetic diseases with slow progression, waiting times of several months are incompatible with the swift therapeutic decisions that have to be taken for cancer treatment. In this project, we want to dramatically decrease this time and accelerate the detection of vulnerabilities and personalize therapies. Job description We offer a funded Postdoctoral position as part of the ETH strategic focus area Personalized Health and Related Technologies. The project aims to adapt and combine the work performed in our two laboratories into an automated and integrated prototype that overcomes the current limitations in organoid screenings. This project aims to study specific vulnerabilities and the survival of individual patient-derived organoids and xenografts, intending to apply these novel methods in clinical practice in the future. To achieve the goals and facilitate clinical translation, we have set up an interdisciplinary research program together with Prof Dr. Marianna Kruithof-de Julio (Dept. of Urology, University Hospital, Bern and Dept. for BioMedical Research, University of Bern, Head of the Urology Research Laboratory and leading expert in prostate cancer stem-cell biology). Your profile The interdisciplinary aspect is central in our group and within this collaboration. You should have a strong disposition to learn and improve novel methods and be open to different research disciplines. Expertise in: programming microfluidics mechanical engineering or prototype generation is required and prior experience with optical methods and standard methods of molecular biology are helpful We are looking for an ambitious team player that can successfully navigate within this collaboration. We offer you an intellectually challenging position in the inspiring atmosphere of an interdisciplinary team and in our collaborations, and the prospect to develop and translate a prototype into clinical practice. Advanced training in different related fields and participation at international conferences is highly encouraged. You must communicate in English (oral and written) fluently and be willing to work in a highly interactive, interdisciplinary, diverse, and international team. A professional work attitude and a proactive and self-driven work ethic are expected. ETH Zurich ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow. Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich In your application, please refer to myScience.ch and reference JobID 53872. myScience.ch

Position Title Investor Relations Director 14-May-2020 Job ID 290380BR Job Description More than $50bn of net sales, more than $12bn of net income, 155 countries where our products are sold. Join Novartis Investor Relations team and become a relationship builder, an adviser to senior management, creative with communicating strategic, operational and financial information whilst exercising judgement and pragmatism to deliver meaningful messages to all our stakeholders. This position will lead quarterly earnings process, including drafting press release and compiling interim financial report and analyst presentation; manage editing process for all materials, incorporating input from across the organization and ensuring message consistency and coherence; set quarterly calendars and write senior management commentary for earnings calls; lead implementation of investor relations communications for specific region; lead and manage support of senior management from ECN and divisions so they are aware of, and well prepared for all elements of communication with investor and analyst community; monitor external trends & macroeconomics by providing meaningful regular analysis and critical evaluations to be used by senior management; translate existing data into relevant information for senior management and Board Your responsibilities: • Draft press release and compiling interim financial report and analyst presentation. • Provide perspective on all investor communications, including annual report and other financial releases, helping craft and advance the Novartis story to address investor perceptions and needs. • Proactively, in rapid time, analyze, prepare and communicate on market moving events to inves-tor community for specific region • Strengthen relationships with our current shareholders through creation and execution of account plans, and expand our shareholder base through identification of new potential targets. • Address inquiries from investors and analysts in a timely manner, providing accurate and bal-anced information on a range of topics from financial to product-specific. Deliver aligned mes-sages that support the Novartis equity story. • Actively support Head of IR on specific projects (e.g. on presentations, analytics) • Serve and liaise with internal Divisions and work proactively to deliver high quality, accurate mes-sages for both IR team and Senior Management to use with investors and analysts. • Plan and support execution of senior management roadshows, bank conference participation, one-to-one meetings and other investor events, including capital markets days (Meet Novartis Management & R&D days) • Capture investor/analyst feedback and share with IR team and appropriate management. • Follow financial market and benchmark Novartis activities vs. peers to inform our IR strategy and messaging. Minimum requirements What you’ll bring to the role: • Ideally medical or science basic degree + MBA or finance (e.g. CFA) • Excellent English oral/written communication skills • 10 years’ experience in IR + finance + communications and ideally the healthcare industry; investment banking, research analyst or asset management with healthcare background Why consider Novartis? 750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives? We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine. Job Type Full Time Country Switzerland Work Location Basel Functional Area Audit & Finance Division CORPORATE Business Unit Global Corp. Finance Employment Type Regular Company/Legal Entity Novartis International AG Shift Work No

Line of Service Assurance Industry/Sector Not Applicable Specialism Assurance Management Level Senior Associate Job Description & Summary Your tasks You will manage one of our premium asset management clients within a larger team. In addition, you will be responsible for auditing onshore and offshore fund vehicles for a variety of clients in the greater Zurich area (private equity and hedge fund products, IFRS). You will be responsible for the planning and implementation of accounting and for coordinating an internationally established audit mandate and you will communicate with both the local CFO and portfolio managers as well as the foreign fund administrators and testing teams. You will report directly to a Partner, who also takes responsibility for your further development, and you will assist in coordinating with IT and tax specialists or in other fields of financial assessment. You will take the lead in designing and supervising the implementation of the audit approach and in drawing up reports and recommendations. You will advise clients on financial reporting and regulatory developments and keep up to date with regulatory changes by attending internal and external seminars. You will join a highly motivated, diversified team in a rapidly developing sector. Your profile You have a bachelor or masters degree, a diploma in economic science or a higher degree from a professional business school. You are a certified accountant or have another equivalent qualification, like a CFA. You have at least three years' experience in auditing asset managers/onshore/offshore fund vehicles and have gained experience in industry relevant regulations (e.g., Collective Investment Schemes Act, AIFMD, UCITS). You are fluent in German and English, innovative and enjoy team work and contact with clients. You have excellent interpersonal and project management skills. You are able to share your expertise and experience actively by teaching, coaching or mentoring others. | Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. We have recently been confirmed as the global manufacturing partner for Moderna’s vaccine against the novel coronavirus, providing a tenfold manufacturing capacity increase. As other businesses face increasing economic uncertainty, we are fortunate to have opportunities for expansion. Through this new collaboration, our work will have a significant, direct and long-term impact on the management of this global pandemic. In order to support our continued growth Lonza is seeking Bioprocess Engineers with a relevant background in Life Sciences and a passion for Biotechnology to join our talent community in Visp, Switzerland. Become part of this exciting opportunity and join our team by applying for the position as Bioprocess Engineer in Upstream Processing or Downstream Processing or BioConjugate Manufacturing. As Bioprocess Engineer, you will ensure that operational activities for clinical and / or commercial manufacturing are performed on-time and within given safety and quality standards You will act as the functional lead for preparation, manufacturing execution, cleaning and changeover in the assigned area In upstream processing (USP), you will be in the lead in one or more defined USP areas (e. g. seed train, main cultivation or harvest) for the production of therapeutic proteins with either mammalian or microbial expressions systems (Bioprocess Engineer USP) In downstream processing (DSP), you will be in charge in one or more defined DSP areas (e. g. capture, polishing or filling) for the purification of therapeutic proteins from either mammalian or microbial cells (Bioprocess Engineer DSP) In the manufacturing of therapeutic BioConjugates like Antibody Drug Conjugates (ADC), you will be responsible for entire processes or process units for clinical and commercial manufacturing projects (Bioprocess Engineer BioConjugates) Master’s Degree in Biotechnology, Bio-chemical Engineering, Biochemistry or related Life Science subject, or Bachelor’s holder Knowledge in either USP (such as bioreactors) or DSP units (such as chromatography) Working experience in biomanufacturing would be an advantage GMP experience and understanding of bioprocess technology Excellent communication skills in English and / or German Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problem... Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started. The Oculus team at Facebook is helping more people around the world come together and connect through world-class VR hardware and software. With global departments dedicated to VR research, computer vision, haptics, social interaction, and more, Oculus is committed to driving the state of the art forward through relentless innovation. VRs potential to change the world is immense - and were just getting started. Our Zurich Core Tech team explores, develops, and delivers new cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundation of current and future Oculus products. From mixed reality and human interaction to natural inputs and beyond, Core Tech is focused on taking new technologies from early concept to the product level while iterating, prototyping, and realizing the human value and new experiences they open up. Our team applies a range of software, computer vision and machine learning techniques to build products that enable new ways for people to connect and share experiences. We're addressing a variety of technical challenges in the areas of real-time image processing, 3D graphics, SLAM and scene reconstruction, machine perception, visualization and human interaction. We're looking for candidates with deep C++ and Python knowledge and experience in building performant software for innovative hardware devices while collaborating with experts across multiple domains. Design core components up and down the software stack, developing primarily in C++ and Python. Build tools and infrastructure to enable product advancements and efficiency-gains across both software and hardware. Collaborate with cross-functional hardware and software teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa. Evaluate, analyze and optimize system resources related to image processing, computer vision and machine learning. Develop solutions for real world problems and integrate solutions into products. Conduct design and code reviews. BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Robotics or related technical field. 2+ years of experience developing software in C++ or Python for high performance and/or real-time systems. Experience working with one or more from the following: Depth sensor technology, computer vision, machine learning, imaging/camera systems and/or consumer mobile products Embedded systems, firmware, drivers, OS/kernel development CPU/GPU programming and optimization 3D graphics, rendering, geometry, and/or visualization Machine learning pipelines for detection or classification from images or videos Cloud computing and data analysis. Applications and resumes to be submitted in English. PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Robotics or related technical field. Experience working on VR/AR/MR.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! Lumentum is a market-leading manufacturer of innovative optical and photonic products enabling optical networking and commercial laser customers worldwide. Lumentums optical components and subsystems are part of virtually every type of Telecom, enterprise, and Data Center network. Lumentums Commercial Lasers enable advanced manufacturing techniques and diverse applications including next-generation 3D Sensing capabilities. Headquartered in San Jose, California, Lumentum has R&D, Manufacturing and Sales footprints worldwide. We seek people who want to be a part of our success and who will bring their energy, expertise, and fresh perspectives to this exciting company. If you aspire to excellence and can bring innovative yet practical solutions to tough challenges, then be a part of our team! Our Commercial Lasers Business Unit is currently looking for a Senior Optical Engineer to join our R&D team in Switzerland. We are looking for an experienced, innovative, analytical, and highly organized Engineer to enhance the optical design of our lasers using state of the art software tools. The chosen candidate will be part of the Business Unit Engineering team developing Specialty Optical Fibers mainly for high power laser applications. He/she will play a key role characterizing the optical fibers and developing optical setups. The candidate must be a team player and a strong problem solver. He/she must have the ability to solve and understand problems with a minimum supervision, should have relevant experience with the skill areas listed, as well as a strong interest in growth and learning in all of them. Responsibilities: Participate to the optical design and tolerancing of high power ultrafast lasers Help to optimize the workflow for optical system design, streamlining the interaction between the optical design software (OEs) and CAD software (MEs). Contribute to the development of innovative principles, ideas, programs and projects. Work on complex problems; provide and apply solutions with minimum supervision Initiate and lead the R&D developments and then document and transfer products to manufacturing Experience Bachelors and 10+ years of work experience in lasers / optics, or equivalent level of education and experience. Experience in optical design and tolerancing with Zemax. Experience with ultrafast lasers preferred Ability to summarize data and present to the technical team Track record showing initiative and creativity in executing assignments Ability to work independently as an individual contributor and as part of team

The Early Clinical Development Oncology (ECDO) group within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) translates world-class science into medical innovation through &lt;br/&gt; a diversity of technologies and talents located across three research centers worldwide (Innovation Centers Basel, Munich, and Zurich). We deliver on individual patient needs through a deep understanding of disease biology and the implementation of Personalized Healthcare strategies. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; Our Vision is to develop curative medicines for cancer patients. Our Mission is to transform pioneering scientific discoveries into effective medicines. pRED Oncology focuses on 2 key areas of expertise which are Cancer Immunotherapy and Molecularly Targeted Therapies. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; The Medical Director (MD) is a core member of the Early Clinical Development Oncology organization. The MD leads the clinical strategy for one or multiple early oncology drug assets. He / She is the key medical expert on the Project Team and leads the Clinical Expert &lt;br/&gt; Team. The MD reports to an ECDO area lead. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;supports target and clinical candidate selection, is accountable for the design and the clinical and scientific content of experimental medicine studies to evaluate and validate targets in the field of oncology&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;develops a clinical development plan for one or more early stage molecule(s), allowing quick decision making regarding proof of mechanism&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;has overall medical and scientific responsibility for one or several PhI-II studies&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;works with the Biomarker Experimental Medicine Leader to develop biomarker strategies&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;supports and coordinates development and writing of documents such as protocol, investigator&amp;rsquo;s brochure, clinical study report, etc.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;proposes, establishes and leads external collaborations&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;leads the Clinical Expert Team consisting of different functions supporting early clinical development&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;confidently interprets and presents preclinical and clinical data to internal and external stakeholders&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;assures GCP, Clinical Operating Guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures are followed, is responsible for safety management&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;manages one or several clinical scientists&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Who You Are&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; You&amp;rsquo;re someone who wants to influence your own development. You&amp;rsquo;re looking to be part of a dynamic and growing organization where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;We are looking for these qualifications:&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; As the ideal candidate, you bring solid experience in clinical oncology and/or hematology and overall knowledge of the broad research and drug development process in oncology. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; You are medically qualified (MD), ideally combined with a PhD. Experience in immunology &amp;ndash; particularly cancer immunology &amp;ndash; is a plus. You have a consistent record of scientific achievement with significant experience in drug development documented by presentations and publications in peer reviewed journals. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; Additionally, you have the following skills/ expertise: &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Patient-related clinical experience as investigator on Phase I/II studies&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Industry experience (minimum 2-3 years) preferred,&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;You enjoy thinking strategically beyond current standard of care and at the same time able to work hands on,&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;You have a positive mindset and a deep understanding of the challenges and uncertainty &lt;br/&gt; of early medical research,&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;You are proactive, have a very flexible attitude, and you can adapt easily to change,&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;You work as experienced matrix leader and decision maker with strong leadership skills to influence and motivate Teams,&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;You have an understanding of contemporary translational research tools, including imaging, biomarkers and an understanding of unmet medical needs in oncology and ability to think beyond current paradigms of care,&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Are you ready to apply? We want someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche.&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Roche is an equal opportunity employer.&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;Research &amp;amp; Development, Research &amp;amp; Development &amp;gt; Research

Help our clients successfully manage global challenges Launch your career as a Consultant in our Tax & Legal team you will advise demanding clients on complex taxation issues. Our Tax team offers a wide range of integrated tax services that help our clients to successfully manage local and global challenges. As part of the tax compliance team, you will advise national and international clients on strategies to simplify tax management and manage the impact taxes have on their business. The main focus will be the preparation of tax declaration work for legal entities. How you can make an impact Get the opportunity to be involved in activities with client contact and be responsible for cross-divisional projects in various industries from the first day. Take responsibility for the preparation of tax returns and tax assessments for legal entities and calculate tax provisions. Together with your team, assist our clients with Tax Accounting and Reporting matters with different financial reporting standards (e.g. US GAAP and IFRS, etc.). This involves both consulting and auditing work. Together with your team, advise our clients on complex tax issues, for example in the tax planning of a multinational company, a corporate restructuring or on tax monitoring. Develop a clear, long-term career path with internal and external professional training offers as well as the time and financial assistance necessary for the training to become a certified tax expert or study the MAS FH in Swiss and International Taxation / LL.M. Swiss and International Taxation. Be part of an international and interdisciplinary team with plenty of learning on the job opportunities Who we are looking for You are curious and bold, respectful and integrative. You bring a positive and result-oriented attitude as well as the willingness to take over responsibility and find solutions for various clients. You have a flair for numbers and business connections as well as thirst for knowledge that enrich our projects with new perspectives. You have completed an apprenticeship (kaufmännischer Abschluss- zum Beispiel Treuhandwesen) or a bachelor or master degree in business or a similar field You enjoy working in the field of tax law, especially doing tax declaration work You communicate confidently in German and English. Any further languages would be an advantage. Your team Become part of a diverse, multinational and highly motivated team of 25 employees at our Zurich office. We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes and on-the-job learning, but also by connecting with your colleagues across all business lines. Life at Deloitte As one of the leading global consulting and auditing companies, Deloitte is passionately committed to shaping the future. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. At Deloitte, you can make an impact that matters for our people, our clients and society. We offer an inclusive environment where you can grow your own way and build upon the purpose that drives you. You will benefit from flexible working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes and form lifelong connections in an international and dynamic environment. Want to know more about life at Deloitte? Go to What impact will you make? How to apply We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on "apply now" to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Stella at All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. 09-Jul-2020 Job ID 284546BR {"QuestionName":"Job Description","AnswerValue":"6,000 scientists and physicians around the world use our data to reimagine medicine and create therapies that save lives. Our research is focused on discovering innovative new drugs that will change the practice of medicine. Novartis Institutes for BioMedical (NIBR) is the global pharmaceutical research organization of Novartis with a mission to discover innovative medicines that treat disease and human health. To do that, our scientists need cutting-edge, state-of-the-art computing systems and NIBR Informatics (NX) is a strategic investment into informatics capabilities, positioning to deliver the systems and services are critical to the future of drug discovery. The Information Products and Data Sciences (IPDS) group in NX is driven to maximize the impact and value to NIBR of software and data. We deliver powerful, functional, beautiful, and integrated software solutions that create a frictionless user experience. Our organization is here to build and apply excellence in product and data management to further Novartis drug discovery. --- Novartis Institutes for BioMedical (NIBR) is the global pharmaceutical research organization of Novartis with a mission to discover innovative medicines that treat disease and human health. Our scientists need cutting-edge, state-of-the-art computing systems and NIBR Informatics (NX) is a strategic investment into informatics capabilities and positioning to deliver systems and services that are critical to the future of drug discovery. NX is a global team of ~350 technology scientists and business professionals working across 5 sites, primarily Cambridge MA (USA) and Basel (Switzerland). Interview with NIBR CIO: https://www.novartis.com/stories/people-and-culture/qa-new-nibr-cio-dimitris-agrafiotis --- Job Description: As the Head of Scientific Products, you will develop and continually update a vision for the suite of scientific products that support NIBR drug discovery and lead the product management team to the successful realization of that vision. Your vision will inspire the cross-functional product organization to deliver value to our scientists and will sustain our team through challenging times. You will bring together technologies, capabilities and outstanding talent to create products that our users will love. You will define the standard for excellence in product management in our organization and synthesize that with your knowledge of drug discovery to create scientific software that enhances and helps drive NIBR science. The Head of Scientific Products will prioritize product roadmaps, direct development resources to maximize value to NIBR science, and will define how we measure product success and value delivery. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities that lead to the growth of our products through constant improvement and innovation while also providing consistent delivery and stable operation of products. You will use your knowledge of these products to promote their meaningful use by giving product demos, sharing user stories, and showing the connection of our scientific products to drug discovery impact. You will work closely with colleagues in engineering, user research, design, support, training, and data science to empower matrixed product teams that deliver on your vision for our products. This will require you to align and coordinate with other departmental leaders and stakeholders to ensure all operational needs are met including security, stability, usability, and sustainability. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Lead, manage and mentor a team of product managers. Product lifecycle management from concept to launch of the products across all scientific product lines. Lead, define, represent and communicate product portfolio strategy to all stakeholders and NIBR leadership. Assess product development progress and enhancement opportunities. Evaluate product development results. Evaluate and provide input into strategic plans for each product line. Drive innovative ideas, solutions and products through leadership and decisive action. Build incredible teams and processes to deliver products that satisfy the needs of customers. Become the key evangelist of our products and participate in education activities, conferences, discussions with thought leaders within and outside of Novartis. Regularly present to stakeholders, NX, and NIBR leadership Position Title Head of IT Scientific Products, Information Products and Data Sciences

Liebherr Machines Bulle SA est le centre de compétences des moteurs à combustion (Diesel et gaz) et composants hydrauliques. L’entreprise développe et fabrique des produits diversifiés utilisés dans le génie civil, l'exploitation minière, l'agriculture, l'énergie décentralisée, l'ingénierie mécanique & industrielle ainsi que l'aviation. Les missions En qualité d'Opérateur de banc d'essai pour la production, vous conduisez et suivez les tests sur banc d’essai des moteurs à combustion Vous recherches les pannes et établissez les diagnostics nécessaire de manière autonome Vous réalisez les réparations des produits directement au banc si nécessaire Vous contrôlez la conformité produits réalisés Vous renseignez et suivez les documents associés à la gestion de la production et de la qualité (indicateurs, suivi de production, relevés de contrôle, etc.) Vous participez activement à maintenance de vos outils de travail Vous garantissez l’ordre et le rangement de votre poste de travail en accord avec les principes 5S du département Profil Vous êtes titulaire d'un CFC de mécanicien automobile, mécatronicien (h/f/x) ou d'une formation équivalente Vous avez de bonnes connaissances du français, la connaissance de l'allemand et de l'anglais sont un atout Vous avez de l'expérience en diagnostic moteur Vous avez de bonnes connaissances d’un système MES, des connaissances d'un systeme ERP sont un atout Vous êtes une personnes autonome, structurée, consciencieuse, flexible, fiable et qui se démarque par sa capacité à collaborer au sein d'une équipe Notre offre Nous vous proposons une activité passionnante au sein d’une équipe jeune et dynamique, une rémunération en rapport avec vos compétences ainsi que des prestations sociales d’une entreprise moderne Liebherr Machines Bulle SA Nadege Malan +41 26 913 31 11

The Role: Creativity & Productivity (C&P) business group is the biggest division of Logitech, consisting of our mice, keyboards and presentation remotes. It is a key pillar of Logitechs past, present and future as a global brand known for great design and exceptional user experiences. As Product Manager for our global C&P Business Group, you will be asked to lead the definition and development of new experiences and innovation ingredients which will be integrated into new products. Your product development experience will allow Logitech to anticipate consumers needs in new and meaningful ways, and a deep understanding of the mid to long term trends to stay ahead of competition. Are you passionate about product design, new technologies, contributing to experiences that millions of people will interact with everyday in their lives and make a positive impact? If so, this is a great opportunity for you! You will report to the Head of Sustainability, Creativity & Productivity Business Group, based in Switzerland and you will work within a team of product and business managers whilst working closely with our Logitech engineering and design teams. Your Contribution: Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. These are the behaviors youll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will: Define the user-centered vision of C&P key experiences and innovation ingredients. Collaborate with business, design and engineering teams to build mid and long term innovation and experience strategy and roadmap. Drive the identification of best-in-class and innovative technical solutions in close collaboration with Engineering. Develop point of views on new features and technologies. Collaborate closely with Engineering and Design teams to reach optimal tradeoff between product experience, sustainability, time to market and cost. Lead the harmonization of the product experience across the Business Group. Key Qualifications and skills: For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team: Graduate degree in business, engineering and/or product design Demonstrable experience in a product management or product development position. Strong ability to empathize with consumers and consumer challenges and tensions, demonstrable experience in global consumer needs and developing products in multiple cultures and/or used by multiple user groups. Passion for the tech industry. Ability to quickly grasp technology constraints and capabilities. Strong interest in electronics and technology business, industry / industry issues and competitors. Strong understanding of product life cycle processes, engineering principles and design constraints. Strong interest in environmental sustainability. Passion to make a positive impact. Ability to thrive in a multi-disciplinary environment and to both lead and collaborate in cross functional teams. Recognised leadership skills-strong ability to lead by influence Excellent communication (oral & written) skills. English required. Decisive and able to deal with ambiguity, guiding other team members through it. Excellent creative and problem solving skills Excellent organizational and project management skills Self-starter with a high-degree of self-motivation. Strong business acumen-capable of big picture thinking. Best candidates will be curious, insightful and creative. Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it. As a company, were small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen. But were big enough in our portfolio and reach, for those actions to have a global impact. Thats a pretty sweet spot to be in and were always striving to keep it that way. Major Accountabilities : Develop marketing strategies, programs / campaigns & ready-to-use promotional materials (physical and digital content) : 1. in partnership with Global Marketing for new Product Launches 2. independently for established in-line products Provide marketing plan direction, guidance, and oversight to ensure best-in-class marketing execution (for new product launches & established in- line products), cross-market consistency (where appropriate), and maximum marketing ROI (by minimizing duplication and maximizing impact), including Medical Affairs plans, scientific evidence, and podium presence Coordinate all international brand marketing initiatives that will help the top 12 international markets achieve the annual and intermediate-term sales and market share objectives Provide strategic input for Medical / Economic Evidence and publication plans as member of world-wide Medical Evidence Teams Regularly update campaign materials and promotional assets as Alcon and competitor market presence evolves and customer needs / preferences change Synthesize and share best practices (e. g. lessons learned new product launch lead markets, etc.) creating a cycle of continuous improvement in marketing execution and application of novel channel innovations across the International Surgical business Establish Commercial KPIs and track performance with discipline Provide International input into upstream Global franchise strategy to ensure innovation programs (internal R&D and external L&A / partnerships) meet International needs Reports to the Head of Marketing, International Advanced Technologies. Works closely with key members of the IMG Team, including the Area Marketing team which supports all International markets beyond the Top 12 Experience & Competencies : 8+ years of broad experience in progressive marketing positions in highly competitive global medical devices, pharmaceutical or consumer health care product industries (customer facing / sales experience and / or ophthalmology experience preferred, but not required) Experience developing and launching Digital Health products and services, especially revenue-generating SaaS solutions and related professional services Strong technical aptitude, work experience and training on technologies, particularly those relevant to Healthcare systems integration Previous experience in a country marketing role Proven expertise in global product strategy, brand marketing, and portfolio management Track-record of successful, multi-country new product launches Capability to work in a complex global framework, including strong stakeholder experience and ability to lead cross functional teams in a fast-paced and high-demand environment Demonstrated strong long-term strategic thinking and planning for business success. Ability to bring innovative thinking, challenging status quo and managing the ambiguity Experience coaching and developing skills of others in marketing, project management and technical / clinical areas Minimum : Bachelor’s Degree; Desirable : MBA Fluency in English, other languages are a plus

At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients lives and we are ambitious in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. Within Roches Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED), Neuroscience & Rare Diseases represents a major focus area where we are committed to realizing our long-term vision of changing lives of patients with severe brain disorders. Our research and early development activities center around large and rare indications within the four major pillars of neurodevelopmental disorders, movement disorders, dementias, and multiple sclerosis. With strengths across diverse disciplines, Roche is uniquely positioned to lead in transforming science to medicines for patients with disorders of the nervous system. To achieve our goals, Roche pRED Neuroscience & Rare Diseases is currently undergoing a major and exciting recruitment effort for a large number of new positions including 2 Research Associates in Transcriptional regulation and in Functional genomics within the Department of Research. All positions are based in Basel, Switzerland. The position We are seeking two highly motivated Research Associates to join the Functional Genomics laboratory and Transcriptional regulation laboratory within the Neurogenomics section in Neuroscience and Rare Disease (NRD) organization. Neurogenomics in NRD spans the interface of human genetics, single cell genomics, functional genomics, molecular biology, and advanced computational methodology. In this role, you will be joining a team of researchers working at the cutting edge of human genetics and functional genomics in a highly collaborative environment to identify new therapeutic hypotheses through target identification and target validation to build and advance transformative medicines for neurodevelopmental disorders, dementia, movement disorders and multiple sclerosis. The successful candidate will work under the supervision of established scientists in these laboratories focusing on development of experimental methods for genome-wide CRISPR based screens, develop quantitative assays measuring gene editing in target and non-target cells, cell-based assays measuring the expression and the biological functions of specific genes. He or she will design, perform and analyze experiments for multiple early stage preclinical programs. Your main responsibilities Perform culture of human stem cells, including maintenance, expansion, transfection and differentiation. Perform research requiring molecular biology techniques including DNA/RNA analysis, droplet digital PCR, CRISPR/Cas9, protein isolation and analysis, and other plate-based assays. Analyze and present experimental data. Develop and qualify quantitative assays measuring gene editing using flow cytometry. Assess and implement new analytical technologies. Moreover, as an Associate, you will be a member of the Roche Interns Network that offers you chances to connect, have fun and get to know Basel. This position presents the unique opportunity to gain first-hand insight into discovery research at a leading pharmaceutical company. We expect outstanding motivation, creativity, analytical thinking, strong communication skills and a strong dedication to productivity. Who you are Essential BS in life sciences with 3+ years of relevant assay development experience or MS with 1+ years of relevant experience or associates with 10 years of industry experience with proven experience in required skill sets. Experience of working with different types of mammalian cells, including primary cells. Hands-on experience in development ddPCR or qPCR-based assays. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Desirable Hands-on experience of flow cytometry-based assay development is preferable. Experience with immunoassay development (ELISA/AlphaLISA or related formats) is preferable. Experience in assay development for cell and gene therapy products is a plus. Are you ready to apply? Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. For non-EU / EFTA citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland (e.g. B-Permit, C-Permit) and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, Roche cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations. PhD's and pos-docs's graduated cannot be considered for associate roles in Roche pRED. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Research & Development, Research & Development > Research

Help our clients successfully manage global challenges What do we do? Our Human Capital team helps organizations manage and sustain their performance through their most important asset: their people. Leveraging research, analytics, and industry insights, we support clients to design and execute critical programs from business driven HR to innovative talent, leadership, organizational and change programs in business transformations. Did you know? We are the largest Human Capital practice in the Swiss market and are widely recognized by our clients for our ability to walk in their shoes as a true partner, bring leading insight and expertise and consistently delivery high quality work. How you can make an impact As part of the Human Capital Consulting team, you will collaborate with clients from day one to drive productivity, value and impact by unlocking human potential and creating an organization that is resilient to risk, fit for the future and grounded in meaning for workers. As exponential technologies, new business models and regulation reshape the way people work, learn, collaborate and lead, we work with clients to ensure that their people strategy enables the business strategy. If you are passionate about working with business leaders to shape their HR strategies, to digitize and transform their HR functions or to implement and adopt HR technologies, we would love to hear from you! In this role you will: Work with Swiss and international clients in all stages of the transformation lifecycle Advise our clients on all aspects of the digitalization of their HR function through the design, planning and deployment of SAP SuccessFactors and other digital technologies Bring new perspectives and build bridges between HR and IT for our clients Work on unique projects where you will lead the rollout of HR solutions and enable HR functions to create value Play an active role in business development and proposal creation by collaborating with different industry and account teams across Deloitte Use our global methodologies to design and deliver strategies and programs to drive people-led transformation initiatives Get the opportunity to specialize and obtain certifications in the leading tools on the HR technology market Who we are looking for Required: Significant experience with SAP SuccessFactors implementations Understanding of technology architecture and security concepts Experience in building and maintaining calculated fields in SAP SuccessFactors Experience with release management Fluency in English, French or German is a plus Flexibility to travel within Switzerland Education and experience: A University degree (Bachelor's degree or preferably an advanced degree) or equivalent experience in a related specialization Minimum 6 years of relevant professional experience in a consulting or industry role Minimum 3 years of experience with SAP SuccessFactors implementation projects as Engagement Manager and/or Solution Architect SAP SuccessFactors certified, additional certifications are a plus (Oracle, Workday) Preferred: Excellent people management skills and an enthusiastic, positive, 'can do' attitude An incisive thinker, confident with concepts, analysis and frameworks, with the ability to structure work and deliver under pressure An excellent relationship builder with clients and fellow consultants, with great interpersonal skills and the ability to build and sustain long-term relationships Passionate about doing an outstanding job for the client An independent worker, taking initiative and happy taking on responsibility Excited to take on new challenges and demonstrate clear potential and ambitions to pursue a successful career with us Ideally experience in a Consulting environment Ideally experience and relationships in the Swiss Market Your team Become part of a diverse, multinational and highly motivated team in our Zurich office. We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes and on-the-job learning, but also by connecting with your colleagues across all business lines. Life at Deloitte As one of the leading global consulting and auditing companies, Deloitte is passionately committed to shaping the future. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. At Deloitte, you can make an impact that matters for our people, our clients and society. We offer an inclusive environment where you can grow your own way and build upon the purpose that drives you. You will benefit from flexible working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes and form lifelong connections in an international and dynamic environment. About the job Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers. Using your technical and leadership expertise, you run Engineering-focused projects that are well-defined under supervision. Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Responsibilities Work with Google Engineering teams to design, develop, implement, launch, and support new services and enhancements to existing services. Develop and execute plans under a set of implementation and delivery time constraints, optimizing for a blend of cost, schedule, and features. Collect and analyze relevant data and take actions accordingly. Facilitate broad collaboration with clear communications and documentation. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Location: Seattle, WA, Washington, United States Requisition ID: 55591 Schindler stands for mobility. Mobility needs experts. Join our team in Seattle, WA. Founded in Switzerland in 1874, the Schindler Group is a leading global provider of elevators, escalators, and related services. Schindler mobility solutions move one billion people every day all over the world. Behind the company's success are over 60,000 employees in more than 100 countries. With U.S. Headquarters in Morristown, New Jersey, Schindler Elevator Corporation is the North American operating entity of the Switzerland-based Schindler Group. Schindler is one of the leading global manufacturers of elevators, escalators and moving walks. Schindler employs over 5,000 people in more than 230 locations in North America. The company specializes in latest-technology engineering as well as mechanical and micro-technology products designed and rigorously tested for comfort, efficiency and reliability.
