| Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer An exciting role encompassing the management of interactions between Credit Suisse and Swiss regulatory authorities, especially FINMA as the global lead regulator of the bank. You will manage interactions between regulators and Credit Suisse senior management as a gatekeeper for a broad universe of regulatory topics covering the CRO area. As an contact person you influence on the messaging to regulators by ensuring consistency and completeness. The organization and execution of FINMA supervisory reviews and selected statutory audits will also be part of your area of responsibility. Front-to-back management of ad-hoc regulatory inquiries through a network of internal subject matter authorities will be in your responsibility. You will have the opportunity to connect the dots between topics and regulatory interactions in order to improve the strategic value proposition of the team. In this role you will be providing mentorship to internal partners on interactions with regulatory authorities. This position is located in Zurich, Switzerland but with the chance to build up your internal network by working with colleagues located around the world. Become a part of a highly motivated team acting in a dynamic environment! Your future colleagues The team is made up of skilled professionals forming a group that is recognized by all internal and external partners. Each team member takes on responsibility for the content of what is being delivered to the regulators through challenge and quality assurance. The foundation of the team is based on having team members with gravitas to interact with senior members of management as well as breadth and depth of substantive knowledge to be able to brief senior partners of complex topics in preparation for their regulatory meetings. Lastly, it requires strong execution focus to manage all regulatory interactions and coordinate the front-to-back processes of these interactions and regulatory commitments. All team members show a high degree of collaboration within the team. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm's D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. You Offer University degree, other higher education or degree in a banking-related field of study. A minimum of five years of relevant work experience, ideally within a similar role in a global financial institution or audit firm. Cross risk expertise and understanding of the risk management regulatory framework You possess a deep understanding and interest in the global regulatory environment. Due to your profound analytical skills and a structured way of working you are able to work on and deliver simultaneously on a variety of tasks. You combine sound interpersonal and communication skills with a team-focused approach. You are proficient in German, with a high level of fluency in English (both written and spoken). Understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work LI-CSJOB* G. Wiendlocha would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Switzerland - Zrich Risk Group Functions Job Reference # 214930BR City Zrich Job Type Full Time Your role Do you have experience in quantitative risk modeling with a focus on credit risk measurement in financial institutions? Are you an innovative thinker who likes to challenge the status quo and apply new analytical techniques to solving quantitative problems? Do you enjoy working in a highly specialized team to develop and deliver solutions? Then we are looking for you to: Create, develop and maintain macro-forecasting and stress testing models for credit risk of UBS use techniques from quantitative risk management, financial mathematics and econometrics to develop, assess, and change models Understand credit portfolio specifics; discuss requirements, modelling decisions and impacts with business, finance and risk stakeholders Analyze credit and macroeconomic data and identify patterns Assess and select different possible model specifications and calibrations Implement model specification as prototypes mainly using R Engage with client advisors and risk officers across the globe to deliver risk measures and management solutions for their specific portfolios Support key regulatory projects of the bank as required e.g. US CECL, CCAR/DFAST, IFRS9, Basel IV and other support regulatory exercises Your team Youll be working within the Credit Stress Methodology WM Americas team in Zurich. The team has members in US, Switzerland, Poland and India. Our role is to develop and maintain firm-wide credit risk models covering UBS's Retail and Wholesale portfolios and models for RWA forecasting. The results of our models are used to assess the impact of macro-economic scenarios on the firm's profitability, financial statements and capital adequacy. We interact with a number departments across the bank (incl. Front Office, Finance, IT, Credit Risk Management, Business pricing / steering) on a regular basis. For the development of our methodologies, we use techniques from quantitative risk management, financial mathematics and econometrics. Your expertise A graduate or PhD degree a in a quantitative field such as Financial Mathematics, Financial Engineering, Statistics or Econometrics A sound practical understanding of macro- and microeconomic relationships as well as financial markets and banking products is preferred strong analytical, conceptual and organizational skills with the ability to work to tight deadlines cooperative and team-oriented approach, while able to complete tasks independently with a high quality standard Experience with high-level programming language, and knowledge of statistical modeling software (preferably in R) Excellent communication skills with colleagues at all levels in the organization Able to explain technical concepts in simple terms to facilitate collaboration Fluent in English, both in oral and written form Self-driven and pro-active in taking new initiatives and carrying them though completion Able to deliver high quality results in a fast pace environment with tight deadlines About us Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world. We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. Contact Details UBS International Recruiting Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Risk Advisory - Trainee/Consultant, Data Privacy & Data Protection - Zurich/Basel (80-100%) About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312'000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Cyber Risk Services at Deloitte In a rapidly changing world where information is the new currency, the corresponding information security and privacy have become a board level challenge. Deloitte has the largest Cyber capability of the Big 4 in the European marketplace with over 600 Cyber Risk Specialists staffing thousands of client engagements. The team combines a wealth of deep industry knowledge and technical expertise. Within the Cyber team, we provide our clients a full spectrum of security and privacy services, from strategy to large-scale transformation programmes, fixing security issues and delivering tangible benefits. Leading security and privacy experts with the right level of intellectual curiosity drive our business. You will be continuously challenged, build leadership skills and long lasting relationships with a team that respects you and is fun to work with. In addition, you can drill deep and become a specialist within an industry sector or grow as a generalist. What you'll do • Support the delivery of a portfolio of data protection and data privacy related engagements across our business, working seamlessly and collaboratively with colleagues in other parts of the organisation and around the globe. • Establish credibility with current and prospective clients by demonstrating specialist knowledge of various aspects of data protection, information security and regulatory compliance. • Provide support in guiding business and technology partners on data privacy and data protection matters and methodologies. • Engage in projects for clients across various industries, in close collaboration with a highly motivated team and supported by our senior team members. • Work with proposition owners to enhance our tools, methodologies and knowledge assets; create innovative new service offerings based on market needs and support to ensuring our leading market position as innovators in the cyber regulation and technology space. What you need • A Bachelor's or Master's degree in IT, Business IT, or similar education. • Strong interest in the entire ecosystem of information and data protection. • Affinity to design, develop, implement and maintain information protection strategies and frameworks. • Interest in methodologies regarding Data Loss Prevention, Digital Rights Management, Data Classification, Tokenization and encryption, data masking. • A passion for information and cyber security beyond privacy and data protection e.g. in application protection, identity and access management, incident response, vulnerability management. • Strong interpersonal skills and capability to develop strong relationships. • Initial experience in delivering work in a project-based setup. • Certifications such as CISSP, CIPP/E, CIPM, CIPT, PMP or others indicating specialist capabilities, are a plus. • Fluency in both English and German are required. French skills would be a plus. Any questions? Get in touch. We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal by clicking on the apply button. If you have any question, please contact Rebecca Hodge at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom.

Roche Diagnostics has more than 4000 field service engineers globally who are crucial to the success of the division. The Global Business Process Management Team within Global Customer Support (GCS) is responsible to improve, harmonize and automate services processes worldwide. The main platform to automate and support those processes is our CRM solution based on salesforce.com. As Global Business Process Manager for Field Service you are a) responsible to analyze, review, harmonize and improve field service processes and b) you act as business product owner for the CRM solution related to field service. For all activities you will work very closely with your regional counterparts as well as with IT teams and external partners. Further, you will closely collaborate with your team members responsible for customer support centers, digital customer-facing tools, IoT solutions as well as change management, training and communication. Until early 2022 you will be involved in driving the implementation of a new field service solution (based on ServiceMax) to all 60+ affiliates globally. Your strong leadership, communication and stakeholder management skills will be key for success. You will mainly work on: Support the process and design stream of the implementation project for the new field service solution (based on ServiceMax) until early 2022. The project reviews field service processes globally and harmonizes them as well as delivers a new digital solution for 4000+ field service employees, dispatchers and back office employees. Define the global strategy for field service and implement it, anticipate trends and how they can be successfully integrated to the field solution As product owner for field service you will constantly improve the business processes and lead the development of according tools, focusing on user satisfaction and efficiency improvements to ultimately provide better service to our customers. Work closely together with the regions, key affiliates, DIA IT and process management teams as well as the new field service solution program team to ensure a successful implementation. Manage stakeholders on all levels and across the organization to further improve field service processes and deliver innovative solutions. Work closely with the customer experience team to ensure that customer-facing digital solutions fit according to the field service processes. Who are you? Excellent leadership skills, especially leading in a global matrix organization Experienced in leading global projects and according teams at the interface of business and IT/digital Analytical and result-oriented individual with good communication and stakeholder management skills, very strong team player and used to work in a highly collaborative environment Excellent project management and organizational skills as well as a structured approach to work Very strong business acumen, highly customer-oriented Experience within service business, especially field service, and a good understanding of IVD product portfolio and IVD customers is an advantage Experience with salesforce.com preferred Masters degree in management, economics, IT or engineering Fluent in English (written and spoken), any other language is a plus (e.g. German, Spanish) Ability to travel 30% or more globally Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Information Technology, Information Technology > IT Business Process Management, Consulting and Support

We are looking for an experienced product manager to lead and execute growth and monetization initiatives, in collaboration with Doodle's marketing, customer success and Ad-sales teams. You'll work to understand how people find Doodle today, and create new, innovative ways to expose the core values of Doodle's free and premium products to a wider range of users. You'll partner with our data, design, engineering and marketing teams to increase the number of people who find value in Doodle. You will be responsible for delivering on critical business outcomes, such as increasing subscriptions, leads and Ad revenues, and decreasing churn. With us, you will: Establishing a product vision and shared set of priorities for monetization and growth across the team and the company. Work with marketing, data and design to better understand our customers and their needs - driving experiments across online channels, landing pages, checkout funnel, and product onboarding. Improve our existing growth loops and test new ones to fuel new account growth. Introducing new ad formats and optimizing the existing ad stack globally, in close collaboration with our ad sales team. Define and prioritize user stories and work with engineering and design to implement and iterate. Some Things We Consider Critical For This Role Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in business, technology or related fields. 3 or more years experience working as a Product Manager or in a related discipline in the digital space. Comfortable working with data and analytics. Comfortable delivering in a fast-growing business. Ability to communicate with many stakeholders across different parts of the organization. Build consensus by default, but can drive hard decisions when needed. Eligible to work in Switzerland. Excellent English written & spoken. Experience working in growth teams - a big plus Digital advertising experience - a plus Experience with Agile Product Development Methodology - a plus Fluent in German - a plus What's awesome about working at Doodle? Develop yourself and work on interesting projects in an open-minded and diverse culture Every Doodler gets a yearly budget for education, conferences, and learning resources Party with your colleagues at international retreats Travel to some of our lovely offices worldwide Enjoy a cozy office atmosphere with plenty of plants, fresh fruits and a fridge full of drinks (beer too!) Premium Doodle memberships, also for your friends and family So, get in touch! At Doodle we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities (EEO) are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, disability, religion, gender, sexual orientation. Doodle embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work and our products will be. We want to hear from you, so please don't hesitate to apply! Location Zürich

A challenging and interesting role as member of a team within the General Counsel Division, providing legal coverage to one of the banks current key regulatory projects, affecting bank wide all divisions and regions. A role where you act as an interface between legal and business and are responsible for providing comprehensive legal advice to various partners related to products and contracts affected by the regulatory changes focusing on lending products (margin, mortgages, RAL, corporate finance etc.). A role within the legal stream of an interdisciplinary project in which you will be accountable for contract review as well as amendments to a portfolio of different types of contracts, and act as 2nd level support to negotiation teams. The chance to use your strategy and project management skills at its best, but also to have a close interaction with the business divisions and functions. The opportunity to work in a challenging regulatory environment and to support and cooperate with Senior Management on operative but also strategic matters. We are open do discuss flexible / agile working. A university degree in Law (JD, Master, LLM, etc.), a qualification as an attorney is an advantage. A minimum of 3 years of experience in the banking industry or in a law firm with a focus on lending products. Strong interest in financial products, the current legal and regulatory developments applicable to finance products and affecting the finance industry. Already proven strong project management and analytical skills with a distinct flair for handling challenging issues. Strong interpersonal and communication skills for building up relationships with internal partners which help you to work as trusted advisor to several stakeholders within the project. You are a dedicated problem solver with a positive personality and can-do attitude. As a committed team member, you show the ability to work efficiently and independently. You have proven skills of Microsoft Office application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English are required, solid understanding of German is an advantage. It would be a strong plus if you bring knowledge of any additional language (e.g. French or Italian). *LI-CSJOB* Mr. Tim von Martin would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal.

About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Your opportunity We are offering the opportunity to join as a Manager to support our challenging and rapidly expanding business. As we continue to grow and execute our plans to strengthen our market-leading position, we are looking for focused, aspirational and collaborative practitioners with a commitment to growing their career in Corporate Audit to join our team. Our Audit team is looking for you! Our auditors help our national and international customers to achieve their corporate goals, manage their risks and improve their business performance. Is auditing your passion? Then we are the right company for you! What you can expect from us You will be joining the leadership team and provide you with the opportunity to lead a team in planning, managing and executing audit engagements, within a risk based environment and in an efficient and effective manner.You will own a number of key client relationships; building your personal brand and credibility.You will also be supported to grow this unique skill set in the Swiss market and to contribute to the growth and development of Audit in Deloitte Switzerland.A chance to act as a role model and develop talented team members, through evaluation and counselling.You will audit the annual and consolidated financial statements of national and international clients in accordance with Swiss and international accounting standards (Swiss CO, FER and IFRS)We offer you a varied and challenging role in a fast growing company.You will join our motivated, multicultural team at our office in Geneva or Lausanne.We offer you a work environment dominated by a strong team spirit that will allow you to develop both professionally and personally. Your qualifications Successful candidates must be a Certified Accountant (Swiss CPA, ACCA or equivalent)You have worked at least 6 years in a Big 4 audit firm in the field of the audit of local and international firms and are able to manage international engagements as well as teams.Strong analytical, organizational and interpersonal skills are a requirement.You communicate confidently in English. French would be an asset.You are proficient with commonly used computer applications, e.g. Microsoft Office, competency in data analytics is an advantage. Any questions? Get in touch. We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any questions, please contact Mr. Simone Terlizzi on talent@deloitte.ch. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 175533

Standort: Oberentfelden, Aargau, Schweiz Ausschreibungs-ID: 46601 We Elevate... You Schliesse dich Schindler an und hilf uns, die Welt der Mobilitt zu verbessern: Nutze deine Fhigkeiten und bewege mit uns die Menschen. Schindler wurde 1874 in der Schweiz gegrndet und zhlt als familiengefhrtes Unternehmen mit globaler Prsenz zu den Weltmarktfhrern im Bereich Aufzge, Fahrtreppen und Fahrsteige. Die Werte Mitarbeiterentwicklung, Integritt und Vertrauen, Qualitt, Sicherheit und Mehrwert fr den Kunden sind unser Erfolg. ber eine Milliarde Menschen vertrauen tglich auf Schindler. Unsere langjhrige Erfahrung und Innovationskraft machen uns zur Nummer eins im Schweizer Aufzugs- und Fahrtreppengeschft. Gestalte mit uns die Welt von morgen, als Verkaufsleitung Neuanlagen (m,w,d) 80-100% Du bewegst... Fhrung des Geschftsbereichs Neuanlagen (1 Sales, 1 Sales Assistant) in der Geschftsstelle Aarau Strategieentwicklung fr die Bearbeitung von Markt-/Kundensegmenten Verkauf von Aufzugsneuanlagen und Akquisition von Neukunden Sicherstellen einer nachhaltigen Kundenbeziehung durch professionelle Beratung und Betreuung Organisation von Kundenevents und Kundenverblffungen Du hilfst uns... Technische oder kaufmnnische Ausbildung im Verkauf Mehrjhrige, erfolgreiche Verkaufserfahrung im Bau- bzw. Baunebengewerbe ist Voraussetzung und idealerweise im Liftbusiness Verkuferisches Talent, rhetorisches Geschick und Verhandlungsstrke Spass am Kundenkontakt und technische Affinitt Selbststndiges und lsungsorientiertes Arbeiten Kenntnisse in prozessbezogenen EDV Anwendungen wie z.B. MS Office und SAP Du hast die Chance... .. mit uns deinen nchsten Karriereschritt zu machen und voll durchzustarten

Location: Zug, Switzerland At Landis+Gyr, we share a collective and sole mission: to help the world manage energy better. With over 6,000 employees in 30 countries and as the leading provider of integrated energy management solutions, we ensure that both utility companies and consumers can improve their energy efficiency, lower their energy costs and contribute to the sustainable use of resources. For our Group Tax Department at the company headquarters in Zug, we are looking for a highly motivated: Senior Manager Tax Reporting & Compliance The Senior Manager Tax Reporting & Compliance is responsible for the consolidated US GAAP income tax reporting of the Landis+Gyr Group and the tax compliance of the Swiss entities. Your main responsibilities will among others include: Review and prepare income tax entries in the consolidated accounts (US GAAP) Collaboration with Group Accounting team, prepare the Half Year and Annual Report according to US GAAP and SIX filing requirements including footnote and financial report Preparation of presentations and documentations for the half year and year end closing Review and prepare the quarterly reporting / forecast / budget income tax information including tax expense, tax provision, effective tax rate and cash tax Monitor the effective tax rate and cash tax payments and prepare forecasts Close collaboration with regional CFOs in EMEA, Asia Pacific and the Americas as well as Group Finance and Tax functions Assess, develop and document the effectiveness of internal controls in tax and review where appropriate and ensure compliance of Group Tax processes to Group ICS Review the US GAAP tax reporting for the Swiss legal entities and first point of contact with regard to consolidated tax accounting matters for business units and external audit team Pro-actively seek out and develop solutions to mitigate risks and identify opportunities to optimize Take full ownership for the Swiss income and transaction tax compliance Manage the relationship with the Swiss tax authorities and advise various stakeholders on Swiss tax matters This expert position requires the following skills & experience: University degree or relevant professional qualification (e.g. Swiss tax experts) in finance, accounting, business informatics or similar qualifications Minimum 8 years work experience gained in a senior position in the tax accounting field either in-house or in a leading public accounting firm Excellent knowledge of and proven track record in managing and optimizing in US GAAP tax reporting Analytical and creative thinking including financial planning, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to perform in-depth research and analysis Readiness of mind, strong analytical skills and a methodical way of work Self-starter, highly flexible, able to work under pressure and team-oriented personality Proficiency in MS Office and working knowledge of Cognos is a plus Fluent English and German, any other language is a plus We offer you an exciting opportunity in an international and innovative environment at an industry leading company. If you have the necessary skills and expertise, but above all the drive to make a real difference and take on responsibility, then we are very much looking forward to meeting you. Please send your application to jobsCH@landisgyr.com, Philipp Ruffiner, HR Business Partner. Unfortunately, applications from external personnel service providers cannot be considered for this position.

Lonza ist heute ein weltweit fhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft ttig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafr, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lsung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbststndig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben mchten. Fr den Standort Visp suchen wir aktuell ein/e Schichtmitarbeiter/in in der QC Lonza Specialty Ingredients (LSI). Als Mitglied unseres QC LSI Schichtteams bist du im 4-Schicht System zustndig fr die Durchfhrung und Freigabe von zeitkritischen Proben (GC, HPLC, Titration UV, pH, usw.) unter Einhaltung der ISO und cGMP-Richtlinien. Die Instandhaltung bestehender Infrastrukturen gehrt ebenfalls zu deinen Aufgaben. Deine Aufgaben: Selbstndige Durchfhrung insbesondere von zeitkritischen IPC-Analysen, aber auch Produkten, Labormuster, etc. (GC, HPLC, Titration UV, pH, usw.) Regulatorisch konforme Dokumentation der Ergebnisse gemss ISO und cGMP-Richtlinien Einfache Strungsbehebung und Kontrolle von Analysengerten Selbstndige Ttigkeit im Rahmen von Projekte und bernahme von Verantwortung Dein Anforderungsprofil: Eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung wird vorausgesetzt, von Vorteil Erfahrung im Bereich Analytik Du besitzt einen sicheren Umgang mit potentiell gefhrlichen Stoffen Teamfhigkeit, verantwortungsbewusst und Belastbarkeit zeichnet dich aus Hohes Qualittsbewusstsein und eine effiziente Arbeitsweise ist fr dich selbstverstndlich Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse und einen guten Umgang mit dem PC und Standardsoftware ist ein muss Lonzas Produkte und Services wirken sich tglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Fr uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschftsergebnisse erreichen ist fr uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schtzen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Erfolg fr uns bedeutet moralisch vertretbarer Fortschritt. Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Anstze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lsen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

Your field of responsibility Join us in an IT requirements engineering role to deliver high quality custody services for Securities Corporate Actions, Income and Redemptions. In this role, you are responsible for the transformation of business requirements into valuable end-to-end IT Business services. In an agile application software environment you will identify, document, model, test, coordinate, manage and support high quality software requirements. You provide functional and IT related expertise covering all aspects of requirements engineering and you will find a platform to build up and expand your knowledge in Securities Operation and Engineering disciplines. Your future colleagues Embedded in the COO Division of Credit Suisse, our function is one of the key pillars of Group Operations Solutions. The Function 'Corporate Actions, Income & Redemptions (CAIR)' provides high quality announcement, notification, and processing services for all corporate action, proxy, dividend, and interest events for the bank and its clients. We aim to provide professional, cost-effective services to help our clients thrive. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Your skills and experience We are looking for: Graduate degree or higher education in Economics, Computer Science or equivalent 2+ years’ experience in requirements engineering and/or securities operations. Knowledge of the solution delivery process Modeling skills using UML with tools, e.g. Enterprise Architect. Object oriented programming skills is an advantage. High ability to think abstractly and learn from experience. No reservations to jump into new development opportunities and open minded to join our DevOps journey. You are a result orientated team player with a pragmatic approach and good communication, presentation and negotiation skills. Open personality with a “Yes, I can do” attitude Understanding of Active Directory and Group Policies (required), scripting tools and automation, automated software deployment for Enterprises such as Marimba (preferred) Understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work *LI-CSJOB* Mr. J. Albinus would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal. Your new employer Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training. We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know. Global IT Category Manager (80-100%) Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences. This is a global leadership role since our company has subsidiaries in 50 countries. You will be reporting to the CIO, based in Switzerland as part of a talented IT leadership team who will work closely with you to define demand, decide on make or buy then to select, evaluate and manage vendor partnerships. Unlike a usual IT procurement manager, you will focus on the end-to-end TCO when selecting our IT partners. With the help of your strong IT skills, you will consider each factor that influences a vendor’s overall value. In addition to cost and quality of a service, you will evaluate the benefits and risks of partnering with a vendor, their reliability, the long-term compatibility and their intangible values. Ultimately, your goal is to maximize value and minimize risk. Are you exceptionally committed, a self-starter with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to apply logical thinking and a good reasoning ability to tactical problems? Then we are looking forward to meeting you! Your responsibilities Develop and update IS Partnering and Sourcing Strategy as part of the company’s overall IS Strategy document, renewed in a 3 year cycle and in cooperation with the company’s sourcing department. Build ongoing vendor relationships Build a strong foundation for a win-win long-term collaboration with our suppliers to facilitate further development of strategic applications and platforms Partner with internal customers to understand business needs Partner with project sponsors, project managers and department leads to understand business requirements - then, establish requirements, scope and criteria for the evaluation of IT partners Develop IT procurement policies Establish, analyse and optimize the business’s IT procurement strategy ensuring alignment with business goals, such as service level agreements, and the IT- and procurement strategy Analyse procurement data Collect and interpret procurement data including cost analysis reporting, benchmarking spend, RFP data and return on investment Manage vendor selection Leverage RFx process to facilitate strategic sourcing and manage the RFP timeline. Lead initial market research and vendor profiles to aid supplier selection. Create, issue and manage RFPs. Manage proposal evaluation and final vendor selection; sourcing Use vendor management best practices throughout negotiation, contracting, onboarding and renewal; conduct regular vendor performance evaluations and supplier risk assessments Optimize IT procurement processes Perform regular reviews of our established IT procurement processes to ensure continual improvement. Subsequently refining policies, due diligence questionnaires and RFP templates In cooperation with your peers, i.e. Head of IS Operations and applications you will be responsible for SLA fulfilment, supplier sustainability/compliance, cash management and cost reduction with a TCO perspective; establish and run proper governance on strategic and operational level with relevant suppliers Your background Strong IT background and proven track record in comparable position of 5-10 years; experience in implementing applications like SAP, SAP BW, MS Dynamics CRM, CAx/PDM Relationship and conflict management Strong negotiation skills with experience in contract management for IT services Navigating tricky situations with tact and respect yielding positive results Strategic thinking and creative problem solving along with being adaptable Detail orientation, creativity Availability to navigate dense, complex documents and then advocate for your business Communication and collaboration skills Fluency in English required Benefits Canteen Childcare Flexible work practices More about us ABB Turbocharging (www.abb.com/turbocharging) is at the helm of the global industry in the manufacture and maintenance of turbochargers for 500 kW to 80+ MW diesel and gas engines. Our leading-edge technology and innovation enable our customers to perform better and produce fewer emissions, even in the toughest terrains. Approximately 200.000 ABB turbochargers are in operation across the globe on ships, power stations, gen-sets, diesel locomotives and large, off-highway vehicles. November 19, 2020, ABB announced the planned divestment of its Turbocharging Division. Turbocharging is a successful and profitable Division in a mature market and has been for long a highly self-reliant business within ABB. ABB has decided to take this step, acknowledging that for Turbocharging to realize its full potential going forward, a new setup is required. As the next step, alternative ownership options, including a spin-off to the Swiss stock market, will be assessed, considering value for customers, ABB and the future of the turbocharging business. We look forward to receiving your application. The recruiting process is being led by Elina Seibold, Talent Partner ABB Switzerland Ltd. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tatig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafur, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Losung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbststandig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben mochten. An unserem Standort in Visp, Switzerland suchen wir einen Wissenschaftler QC Mikrobiologie (m/w/d) . Die QC Mikrobiologie beschaftigt sich u.a. auch mit grossen Bereichen von Mikrobiologischen Analysen an unserem Stanort in Visp. Mit dem stetigen Wachstum des Standortes werden auch neue Analysentypen innerhalb der Mikrobiologie eingefuhrt und neue Produkte getestet. Als Wissenschaftler in der QC Mikrobiologie (m/w/d) sind sie Stellvertreter fur das gesamte Team der Mikrobiologie und fuhren mikrobiologische Analysen an, welche vor Ort entwickelt und verifiziert werden . Ihre Aufgaben: Sie sind ein wichtiger Teil des QC Mikrobiologie Analytik Teams Sie sind verantwortlich fur Verifizierungsplane und Verifizierungsberichte Sie begleiten Projekte im Rahmen von Routinen Sie erarbeiten Losungen fur Projektproblematiken und definieren Verbesserungsschritte Ihr Anforderungsprofil: Sie verfugen uber ein abgeschlossenes Studium (FH/BSc/MSc/Diplom) im Bereich Mikrobiologie / Biologie oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Grundwissen uber Bioburden und/oder Endotoxin Analyse ware wunschenswert GMP Erfahrung ware wunschenswert Sie mogen wechselnde Herausforderungen innerhalb der Projekte und sind flexibel Sichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab. Lonza's Produkte und Services wirken sich taglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Fur uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschaftsergebnisse erreichen ist fur uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schutzen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Erfolg fur uns bedeutet moralisch vertretbarer Fortschritt. Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Ansatze im Bereich Life Sciences zu losen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

WAS WIR ALLE GEMEINSAM HABEN Unsere Werte leben Du selbst sein und zugleich andere achten und integrieren Leidenschaft fr Heimeinrichtung Performen & liefern beim Lernen & Entwickeln Spa haben!

Do you want to work in a sector that sets trends and lives fashion? Do you always have the wishes of your customers in mind and want to be part of a dynamic team? Then start your career now at INDITEX, the world's largest fashion retailer! We think innovatively and offer you countless possibilities for your personal and professional development! Take your chance and become part of the INDITEX fashion world!     Your advantages with us   Become part of our team and take advantage of our opportunities for rapid development, our attractive employee discounts and organise your day with flexible working hours.     Job description   The job of Visual Merchandiser requires creativity, a passion for fashion and being up to date with the latest trends. The VM is responsible for the professional presentation of the goods in accordance with the company's guidelines. He analyses sales and adapts product placement to guarantee the best results. The VM is also part of our sales team. Excellent customer service is therefore indispensable.     Your in-store assignment     Commercial tasks:    Analyse turnover indicators and set up an adequate commercial action plan in order to increase sales results.   Managing stock rotation   Communicate and coordinate the presentation of products with the Regional Sales Representative   Knowing the market and the main competitors      Product exhibition:    Presenting products on the sales floor on the basis of coordination photos and internal guidelines.   To professionally set up the articles of our assortment following the trends of the collections, seasons, sales, etc...   Make changes in presentation when necessary   Manage furniture, lighting and presentation equipment   Manage mannequins and showcases   Share your knowledge and communicate constantly with the rest of the team      Profile    Passionate about fashion, always up to date with the latest trends   Enjoys working in a team   Enthusiastic, ambitious and organised   Commercial sense and likes customer service   Investigated, reliable, accomplishes its tasks quickly and efficiently   Ability to work under pressure   Flexibility to work a variety of hours including nights, weekends and holidays   Talent for product presentation   Good vision of space and proportions   Attention to detail   Sense of initiative, autonomous   Basic analytical knowledge for sales promotion      Experience   At least 1 year experience in a similar position     How to apply ?   Ready for a new challenge in the world of fashion ? Send us your CV !

Position Snapshot &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Location:&lt;/strong&gt; Konolfingen (Bern), Switzerland &lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Company:&lt;/strong&gt; Nestl&amp;eacute; Product Technology Centre &lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Act. rate:&lt;/strong&gt; 100% &lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Type of contract:&lt;/strong&gt; Undefined period of time contract &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Position Summary&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; Our Product Technology Centre in Konolfingen (Bern), Switzerland, develops for Nestl&amp;eacute; worldwide, new products, processes and packaging concepts in the areas of Milk and Nutrition. In addition it also provides technical assistance and engineering support for major Capital Investment Projects to our factories. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; Our Nestl&amp;eacute; Nutrition Science and Technology department and more specifically the group &amp;bdquo;Food Biotechnology is looking for a Research scientist in probiotic development &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; The Nutrition Strategic Business Unit (SBU) is part of the Nestl&amp;eacute; Group. Our mission is to nurture a Healthier Generation. We will achieve this by leading the way in research and development of science-proven nutrition solutions and by partnering with parents and healthcare professionals around the world. At the heart of our mission is the knowledge and understanding that nutrition in the first 1 000 days of life, from conception, through pregnancy and throughout the child&amp;rsquo;s first two years of life - has a direct and significant impact on health and performance in later life. Our product portfolio includes such trusted and well-recognized brands as NIDO, LACTOGEN, GERBER and CERELAC. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; A day in the life of Research scientist in probiotic development &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; Manage innovation projects aiming at developing new probiotic &amp;amp; synbiotic concepts &lt;br/&gt; Scale up new probiotic manufacturing processes (from laboratory scale to factory) &lt;br/&gt; Optimize process performance of current probiotic strains &lt;br/&gt; Propose new ideas &amp;amp; assess new technologies to improve probiotic stability &lt;br/&gt; Propose new concepts with short, medium but also long term applications in alignment with our business strategy and demonstrate feasibility &lt;br/&gt; Present results to stakeholders and at international conferences &lt;br/&gt; Work in compliance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) &lt;br/&gt; Mentor temporary fellows (MSc students, apprentices, BSc fellows) &lt;br/&gt; Work in team with laboratory technicians and organize their work when necessary &lt;br/&gt; Interact with experts in the field of probiotics (internally and externally) &lt;br/&gt; What will make you successful &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; PhD in microbiology or biotechnology &lt;br/&gt; 3-5 years of experience in the field of fermentation or probiotics/lactic acid bacteria is a must &lt;br/&gt; Experience in molecular biology or powder science is a plus &lt;br/&gt; Ability to work autonomously with a strong team spirit &lt;br/&gt; Advanced or fluent in English &lt;br/&gt; Flexible, open-minded and curious

To progress any support calls and liaise with BiT staff and 3rd parties to ensure the prompt resolution of all requests in line with the Service/Operational Level Agreements <br/> To ensure change control for all business applications and ensure thorough System/UAT testing prior to a full and controlled release <br/> Develop and maintain strong working relationships with key customers at all levels to understand their business drivers and work with the systems users to understand requirements and deliver/promote technical solutions as appropriate. <br/> Ensure all Project Changes are fully documented &amp; colleagues trained prior to handover to the service desk function. <br/> Ensure the delivery of required outputs set by the business to the BiT manager to acceptable time, quality and cost <br/> To act as project lead on key Services business application projects and implementations ensuring that all measures are taken for successful delivery. <br/> To develop and maintain system documentation and procedures that includes: <br/> Application Support Procedures <br/> System and Technical Configuration Documentation <br/> User Training for new systems <br/> Provide technical expertise in the development of new and existing applications. This includes: <br/> Assess the requirements of new workflows, and determine whether these are required <br/> To liaise with suppliers on issues pertaining to routine and adhoc <br/> To seek, understand, and translate business operational process needs into &lsquo;improvement specifications&rsquo; or new application development <br/> Work with other members of the Applications Teams to ensure that interfaces with other applications and third party products work. <br/> Work with suppliers and customers to ensure that existing applications are optimized to meet business needs. <br/> Work with suppliers and customers to implement new applications or new modules within existing applications <br/> Identify suitable new and emerging technologies, develop business cases &amp; coordinate proof of concepts <br/> To manage and develop data integrity and security standards for the systems, co-coordinating requests for access within agreed parameters. <br/> To organize regular meetings with system users to maintain a working awareness of their service operations. <br/> Manage and plan a schedule for the safe introduction of new releases/patches to meet service requirements. <br/><br/> <strong>What we need to see from you:</strong> <br/> Experience of implementing and managing applications for a similar sized organization and environment. <br/> Project management experience through a project management life cycle <br/> Document Management experience (2+ years) <br/> CRM usage general understanding <br/> Understanding of Finance systems <br/> An understanding of infrastructure and networks <br/> Able to approach challenges with a diagnostic approach and to be able to find new solutions to difficult IT and business problems. <br/> Able to work with 3rd party support organizations to deliver a high level of service to users. <br/> Able to liaise with both internal customers and external companies at all levels in an efficient manner <br/> Experience of Business process Improvement aligned to support IT implementations <br/> Analytical approach and able to work effectively to solve problems. <br/> Capable and organized team player with excellent communication skills, who sharing ideas and best practice within the team and across the organization for the benefit of the business <br/> Proactive approach to continuous improvement &amp; innovation <br/> Self -motivated and enthusiastic <br/> Confident and humble individual that&rsquo;s highly motivated and oriented on results, teamwork and learning; <br/> Ability to independently conduct meetings with engineering-level, management-level or executive level customer personnel in regard to positioning solutions <br/> Understand the implication of change though the implementation of technology to the business <br/> Strong structural work methods, multitasking and time management skills <br/> Solid problem solving and assertive consultative skills. <br/> Travel required, up to 25%. Roches Clinical Development organization is structured by therapeutic area and is responsible for developing and executing the late development (Phase II IIIA) clinical strategies and plans to deliver medically-differentiated therapies that provide meaningful improvement to patients. The Principal PD Clinical Scientist participates in the development of the Clinical Development (CD) strategy and plan and supports various deliverables for effective and efficient CD plan execution for the assigned molecule(s)/indication(s). Principal Clinical Scientists/Clinical Science Directors have regular external interactions with cooperative groups, key opinion leaders (KOLs), external vendor partners supporting the work of CD, etc. They also participate in external interactions with health authorities (HAs). Principal Clinical Scientists/Clinical Science Directors are typically assigned the most complex, largest-volume, and/or most strategically-critical CD projects/programs in the relevant therapeutic/disease area. Giredestrant is an investigational oral selective estrogen receptor degrader (SERD) that is being investigated for the treatment of hormonal positive (HR+) breast cancer across different settings. The candidate will have the responsibility to become the medical monitor for our ongoing clinical trials. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Cross-Functional Team Leadership & Management Leads and/or otherwise participates in the relevant Clinical Science Team (CST) Represents CD in sub-teams (Study Management Teams) relevant to assigned molecule(s)/indication(s). As needed and appropriate, addresses CD study or other program-specific questions; provides updates; delivers presentations, etc. May act as the lead CD representative on sub-teams As appropriate, coaches and guides less experienced CD management and staff 2. Global Clinical Development Planning Stays abreast of internal and external developments, trends, and other dynamics relevant to the work of CD to maintain, at all times, a fully current view and perspective of internal/external influences and/or implications for the assigned therapeutic and disease area(s) Collaborates with a variety of internal and external partners and stakeholders, such as clinical investigators, clinicians, scientists and KOLs, as well as multidisciplinary internal groups, including other groups in PD, research, business development, commercial operations, legal, etc. Provides additional guidance and direction to CSTs and other relevant teams in developing all CD plan components (e.g. analytics/data strategy, KOL development, publications strategy, etc.) Participates in HA meetings. Ethically, effectively and professionally represents the interests of Roche and patients 3. Clinical Development PlanImplementation Provides strategic clinical science support for assigned studies and programs: o Leads or otherwise participates in ongoing CST and relevant sub-team meetings, other interactions, and communications o Collaborates with clinical operations, other groups, and PD Medical Directors/Clinical Development Physicians to develop consistent language and criteria for the Informed Consent Form (ICF), protocol eligibility, protocol dose modification, protocol safety, Case Report Forms (CRFs), CRF instructions, etc. Helps ensure consistent use of language and criteria across multiple Roche teams and projects (includes partner studies) o Writes, or oversees others in the development of, additional clinical science documentation and/or clinical science input in other documentation managed by other Roche groups (e.g., protocol summaries, safety monitoring plans, process documents, investigator brochures, etc.) o Conducts or oversees others in conducting clinical review of study data; identifying and evaluating study data trends, outliers, protocol violators, etc. and working with others to develop and communicate relevant medical inquiries o As appropriate, responds to HA inquiries Works with others to drive ongoing data generation to address unmet medical needs and identify new or extended CD studies or other programs for the relevant therapeutic area of assignment QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE: We are looking for a professional with an advanced Clinical/Science Degree (life sciences preferred) and 12 or more years clinical trial experience (must demonstrate a minimum of 8 years clinical trial experience in pharma/biotech industry, with knowledge of Phase II III drug development). You will bring: Experience working on a clinical team (or equivalent), Strong orientation to teamwork Solid experience authoring aspects of a/or full global clinical development plan or full clinical study protocol Broad experience in the principles and techniques of data analysis, interpretation, and clinical relevance (e.g., ISS, ISE, competitor data, etc.) Comprehensive understanding of product and safety profiles and in-depth knowledge of medical aspects of GCP (Good Clinical Practice), ICH (International Conference on Harmonisation of Technical Requirements for Registration of Pharmaceuticals for Human Use), FDA, EMEA, NICE, and other relevant guidelines and regulations Clinical leadership: is recognized as a subject matter expert in his/her field (includes external recognition as an expert); able to evaluate, interpret and present highly complex data for a series of studies (prospective and retrospective); has made significant contributions to an organizations drug development (whether for Roche or another organization); has identified and created clinical development strategies that have led to label-enabling product definitions Outstanding interpersonal, verbal communication, and influencing skills: has built and cultivated important relationships both inside an organization and externally. Has proven abilities to influence internal partners and stakeholders, thought leaders, national advocacy organizations, national standard-setting bodies, and other relevant external parties Strong cross-functional team leadership skills; has consistently excelled as a cross-functional project team leader Ability to travel (

Basic Info Location Baden, Aargau, Switzerland Job type Full-Time Contract Internship Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. You will be part of the HR Operations Switzerland which is embedded in the HR function of our Global Business Services (GBS) organization. You will work in a dedicated and highly professional team based in Baden. As an intern in this team, your role will be focused on supporting current projects that give you the opportunity to contribute to the digitalization of HR processes and to collaborate with different stakeholders. If you are passionate about HR topics and eager to work in an international and fast-paced environment, this is your chance to make a difference and start your ABB career. Your responsibilities Support the implementation of a new benefits platform and other projects in the area of operational HR services Take over administrative project tasks such as user acceptance testing, process documentation or data analysis Support different administrative personnel processes in the area of Employee Lifecycle and Compensation & Performance Contribute to the development and implementation of process improvements for efficient, standardized and digital HR services Your background Successfully completed Bachelor's degree in economics or related fields First relevant work experience in the HR area through internships - ideally combined with project experience Flexible, committed personality with interest in project and process work; Structured and reliable way of workingExcellent Microsoft Office skills, knowledge of SAP is an advantage Fluency in English and German More about us Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Lets write the future, together. Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your full application (motivation letter, CV, references) only via our online careers tool. A better world begins with you at www.abb.com/careers ABB Switzerland Ltd. Elina Seibold Talent Partner Phone: +41 79 595 75 71 www.facebook.com/ABBCareer www.xing.com/companies/abbschweizag www.linkedin.com/company/abb www.instagram.com/abbcareer ABB Data Privacy Statement: https://new.abb.com/privacy-notice/candidate Reference Number CH75555215_E1 Publication date 2020-07-31

Your field of responsibility As part of an agile and diverse team, you act in the role of an IT Architect to shape the future of the banks Banking Products and Pricing software systems. Pricing related software products are key components offering flexible ways to steer the pricing of customer products, but also support internal users with modern, efficient and transparent tools to fulfill regulatory needs as well as reporting. In this role you will: Shape the architecture of modern, state-of-the-art enterprise applications while working in a small and agile team with the possibility to bring in new ideas and explore new technologies. Drive the road map for the transition of business-critical fee calculation processes from a large legacy application to the strategic pricing platform in close collaboration with the product owner, requirement providers and other partners from IT and business Deliver solutions end-to-end from design, implementation, test automation to support (DevOps approach). Use the opportunity to contribute in a collaborative environment supported by modern software development tools with JIRA & Confluence and DevOps toolchain & Continuous Integration (Jenkins, GIT, Pipelines) Be responsible to define Non-Functional Requirements and Service Level Agreements (NFRs & SLAs) to ensure stability, reliability, and scalability to allow robust operation and growth with business demand Provide technical guidance for the development team and translate the defined functional and technical backlog items into reasonable user stories leveraging other backlog items Thrive the future technical evolution of our business-critical systems in a highly competitive and agile environment closely aligned with all relevant partners Have the chance to work with modern architecture and usage of the latest technology like Angular, Java/JEE, Rest Services, Micro Services, Spring Boot, Oracle DB, Business Rule & Process Engine (Flowable), Cloud etc. Use state of the art software development tools like JIRA & Confluence and DevOps toolchain & Continuous Integration (Jenkins, GIT, Pipelines, Openshift) and test frameworks Have the possibility to build a broad network across teams internationally Collaborate and align closely with various bank internal stakeholders from business and IT as well as representatives from external partners (vendor) Your future colleagues We build, maintain and transform applications for the Swiss Universal Bank. In line with the bank’s strategic position to be the leading digital bank for Switzerland, we work together in a truly agile way: Value for us comes from smart solutions that cover our diverse clients’ needs in creative and sustainable ways. We believe in empowered and self-organized teams to deliver our state-of-the-art solutions. We foster an engineering driven culture and an environment promoting life-long learning. We are a department, which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Your skills and experience With the following skills you will be successful in this position: At least 6 - 8 years professional experience in Java development (JDK 8) and solution architecture as a Full Stack Developer (FSD) and an academic degree in Computer Science or an equivalent education. Experienced with designing distributed enterprise applications with modern technologies like JEE, SpringBoot, JPA, Oracle DB, integration technologies (API-Management, Messaging, REST, SOAP, JMS/MQ) and client side UI technologies (e.g. Angular, JSF). Affinity to modern software engineering concepts such as SCRUM, domain- & test driven design Strong OOP, design-pattern and architecture skills with a passion for delivering quality software. Creative problem solver with proficient communication skills in English and German, which enable you to build lasting relationships on various seniority levels of the organization. Strong dedication to Continuous Integration and DevOps, having practical experience with Maven, GIT, Jenkins and Delivery Pipelines. You are a dedicated and forward-thinking problem solver with a positive personality and can-do attitude You are a full stack Java developer who has experience in both front and backend development and actively drive innovations within the team and strive for high quality of our software. Solid knowledge of SQL with working experience with a relational DB like Oracle Strong practical capabilities in stakeholder and communication management driving key topics forward (e. g. monitoring, DevOps, NFRs, solution architecture, domain architecture, migration of technologies, EOL, etc.) Understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work. *LI-CSJOB* Mr. R. Alaimia would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal. Your new employer Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. The company is a global financial institution whose interests in asset management range across the sectors of private banking, institutional management and investment funds. The Senior Hedge Fund Advisor is a fund specialist responsible for advising clients and for assisting them in managing their hedge fund portfolios. Should you be successful in your application as Senior Hedge Fund Advisor your role will be centred upon advice on hedge fund portfolios also would also entail selecting and monitoring alternative fund managers. Some of the chief responsibilities will include a remit in client relationship management, where by you provide advice around constructing and managing hedge fund portfolios. You should expect to have to adopt a pro-active approach to developing and attaining clients' overall objectives. Another central area of this well paid Switzerland fund job is of course analysis and research. You can expect to have to contribute to analyse and be engaged in the selection and monitoring of alternative investment funds. As Senior Hedge Fund Advisor the last main area of duties involves marketing. You will be asked to contribute to the preparation of marketing presentations and manage various projects. For serious consideration for the Senior Hedge Fund Advisor vacancy you should have at least four years' experience in the hedge fund industry and around a decades worth of experience in the finance industry. It is expected you will be University educated and individuals with qualifications like MBA, CFA, CAIA are welcomed. During interview you will have to display an extensive knowledge of hedge-fund strategies and managers. Coupled with that you will have many contacts in the alternative fund industry and be fluent in English and French. The Senior Hedge Fund Advisor is a very well paid Swiss fund job offering a first rate basic and bonus potential. For more information on the Senior Hedge Fund Advisor opportunity or other Geneva jobs or Swiss fund jobs please contact our Switzerland fund recruitment consultants.

Switzerland - Zrich Risk Group Functions Job Reference # 210320BR City Zrich Job Type Full Time Your team Youll be working in the Group Risk Regulatory Management team within Risk Methodology based in Zurich. And youll play a vital role in seeing that the necessary risk frameworks are appropriately embedded across the division. As a risk regulatory specialist youll partner with various stakeholders including exposure to senior management to manage regulatory and associated risks. Your expertise masters degree in a finance-related area with a strong mathematical background ideally regulatory relationship management experience for market, credit, treasury and/or liquidity risks demonstrated knowledge of risk model development and/or risk model validation of market and credit risk models excellent knowledge of risk management and regulatory control frameworks i.e. FINMA, CCAR/DFAST, FED/OCC SR11-7 skilled communicator who adapts style to audience and conveys clear, accurate and concise information to senior management ability to work well under stressful situations, challenging environments with demanding stakeholders critical thinker focused on details, with solid analytical and reporting skills, strong project management skills About us Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world. We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. Contact Details UBS Business Solutions AG UBS Recruiting Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, theres no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of. Due to the growth at our site in Visp, we are currently looking for several Manufacturing Specialists for our Ibex-facility. In this role, you will be responsible for executing the operational activities of assigned manufacturing projects in specific areas (Up-stream or Down-stream processing) with respect to safety and quality standards and on-time-in full delivery. Key responsibilities: Executes manufacturing activities in the area of mammalian cell culture and/or purification according to cGMP guidelines, ensuring batch execution, evaluating test results, resolving issues, troubleshoot manufacturing equipment and make recommendations for resolution Supports execution of SHE (Safety, Health, environment), EM (Environmental Monitoring), operation and cleaning risk analysis for the assigned products and the implementation and control of defined measures Supports to establish timely and with high quality the required production documentation (preparation and review of electronic batch records) specific to the assigned production area Reviews production documentation and works on deviations, change requests and implementation of CAPAs to ensure high-quality GMP standards Working as production expert in Capital investment projects for building and commissioning of the manufacturing units. Responsible for delivering all input required for the specific set-up, commissioning and qualification of the manufacturing suites and equipment including automation Supports Engineering and workshops for campaign preparation and change-over activities in the facility Key requirements: Bachelor / Master's degree within Biotechnology, Biochemistry or related disciplines Strong knowledge level of biotechnology (biotechnical engineering preferable) and in the area of Mammalian cell culture / protein purification Basic GMP understanding is a plus Excellent communication skills, team player, driven and solution-oriented Fluency in English and German is mandatory People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Do you want to make a significant difference in how the world is looking tomorrow and contribute to the innovation of state-of-the-art, cutting-edge technology products? Then look no further and join our Product and Application Management Team in Mnnedorf, Switzerland as Application Specialist NGS (Lab Automation) 80-100% What you will do In this new role you will focus on developing optimized scripts for Tecans own and 3rd party Genomics reagents that will be part of Tecans solutions offer. You will be part of the HQ core application team and will pass on the best practices to counterparts in the field and provide 3rd level support to resolve customer issues. Responsibilities will include Developing scripts to operate Tecans liquid handlers with various NGS library prep kits Demonstrating script functionality via testing in alignment with internal or partners requirements Assembling necessary documentation and technical marketing materials for script release Testing new hardware and software components for NGS library prep automation Being the technical point of contact for external and internal stakeholders in NGS library prep automation and collecting technical and scientific feedback from customers and partners Working closely with Product Managers and other members of the Genomics Automation team during new product development Supporting pre- and post-launch activities such as customer support, trainings, technical writing and scientific content creation for marketing What you bring along Master Degree or PhD in Life Science, Biology/Biochemistry with focus on NGS Prior experience with liquid handling automation scripting and/or programming is a plus Minimum two to three years of hands-on work experience in academic or industry settings with NGS library kits Good understanding of NGS library prep kit properties from different vendors Knowledge of good laboratory practices Fluent English skills; German skills are an advantage Strong communication skills Customer-oriented mind-set Highly structured with integrative and analytical way of thinking Readiness to travel up to 20% What you will get Progressive employment conditions Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits package Exciting career opportunities Wide range of training courses International and diverse environment (30+ different nationalities) Strong company culture with rich history Global mindset with Swissness at heart Extremely attractive location overlooking the lake of Zurich Look no further and apply now! We are looking forward to receiving your application online. Please submit your resume (w/o picture and w/o cover letter, reference letters and diplomas are optional). We will only consider direct applications and no applications from recruiting agencies. #lifescience #healthcare #automation #medicaldevice #biology #biotechnology #genomics #ngs #sequencing #scientist We care about people - Join the market leader. People every day all around the world will benefit from more personalized healthcare. The promise of better, faster, more cost efficient solutions is now within our grasp.
