Do you want to make a difference in the world of tomorrow by contributing to state-of-the-art technology? Look no further. Join our Global Marketing team at Mnnedorf, Switzerland as Internal Communications Trainee 80-100% (February to October 2021) What you will do As the Internal Communications Trainee, you will support internal communications activities, contributing to a regular flow of relevant and engaging communications to Tecans global workforce. Working closely with colleagues from the marketing team, you will work on creation of videos, written communications, intranet publications, and the development of printed material. Responsibilities will include Hands-on support for the development of Tecans new Intranet, including developing and optimizing templates, preparing and uploading content, and working with various stakeholders to ensure a superb user experience. Tracking Intranet performance using predefined KPIs, identifying areas for improvement and regular reports. Organizing resources and technical requirements for live video streaming events. Tasks will include setup of the broadcasting site, coordination with IT and external agencies. Supporting management of editorial calendar; following up with content providers; supporting review and approval processes. Supporting production of internal communications, such as sales success stories, executive management updates, etc. Recording raw video material as required and working with external vendors to produce final video content with a focus on creativity and the wow effect. Working with the global marketing team to set up new product launch sessions to introduce Tecan solutions to the global workforce. Manage internal Tecan newsletter; collaborate with colleagues across the globe to derive with interesting stories for publication. What you bring along University degree (BA or MA) in Communications (may be ongoing). Experience working with video and photo cameras; ability to produce quality video footage is a must. Digital savviness and ability to rapidly adopt new technologies; experience with SharePoint. Strong written communication skills are mandatory as well as ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders from different departments, seniority levels, cultures and countries. Previous experience in a multinational company would be a strong plus, especially within the internal communications team. Strong organizational skills, proactive and able to work independently. Excellent English skills are a must, German or any other language would be beneficial. Motivation to learn and "can do" attiditude; must be a team player What you will get Progressive employment conditions Comprehensive compensation and benefits package Exciting career opportunities Wide range of training opportunities Extremely attractive location on the lake of Zurich International and diverse working environment (30+ nationalities) Strong company culture with rich history Global mindset with Swissness at its heart We look forward to receiving your application online. Please submit your resum (without picture and without cover letter, reference letters and diplomas are optional). Description du poste Are you interested in conducting risk assessment and testing control frameworks? Are you interested in business processes audit? Are you at your best when working within a team? We're looking for a Compliance & Operational Risk Control specialist to: continue to strengthen the financial control environment analyze and understand key financial reporting controls in scope of SOX 404 perform Design Effectiveness (DE) and Operating Effectiveness (OE) testing as per internal methodology to agreed deadlines support stakeholders in understanding reported control deficiencies and related risks identify and escalate any potential testing issues / exceptions to appropriate teams and the stream leads maintain high quality testing documentation, trackers and issue logs, ensuring these are kept up-to-date and accurate Description du profil bachelor degree or equivalent qualification in accounting, finance or related field excellent time management skills and ability to meet ambitious deadlines skilled communicator who adapts style to audience and conveys clear, accurate and concise information; fluent in both English and German critical thinker focused on details, with solid analytical and reporting skills an understanding of internal control testing requirements and/or process mapping up to 3 years experience in operational controls, financial reporting controls or internal control areas (preferable) any experience working within the financial services industry or professional services firms (preferable) studying towards suitable professional qualification such as CIA, ACA, ACCA (preferable) Salaire et avantages Salaire : salary according to profile Référence : 239617BR Jobeo

You are looking for an internship in a highly professional, innovative, and international company where you can gain exposure and experience in the field of IT? Excellent, because we are constantly looking for motivated and dynamic interns that are eager to join our experienced and forward-thinking Global IT teams and get to know Hilti as a company. Based on your individual strengths and interests, you will explore IT trends and work on exciting and value-adding projects in close collaboration with expert teams across multiple disciplines. Who is Hilti? We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. Hilti is a multicultural workplace with 127 different nationalities committed to global teamwork. Global IT within Hilti is a truly global team with main hubs in Buchs (Switzerland), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia) and Plano/Tulsa (USA). All locations have highly competent teams who work very closely together. Hilti`s Global IT team is known for their focus on sustainable value creation by translating latest IT innovations into value creating solutions & services. What does the role involve? As an intern in Global IT you will be part of an international team working on innovative, real-life IT challenges. You will work closely with our experienced Hilti IT professionals and managers as well as with relevant business stakeholders. You will explore the characteristics of the respective field and relate them to our strategic business and IT needs. The internship in Hilti Global IT will allow you to gain experience in project or process management, improve your technical expertise, and have hands-on experience. Amongst others, we offer internship opportunities in the following IT areas: Digital Marketing & Sales IT, FICO & HRM systems, Supply Chain Management IT, Product IT Services and IoT, Enterprise Architecture, IT Governance, Data Science, Information Management, IT Security, IT Infrastructure Services, and Workplace Technologies. So, just let us know about your individual strengths and motivations or suggest topics that are of special interest for you, and we can jointly discuss collaboration options. The start date is flexible to the student's availability with an internship duration of 3 to 12 months. Use your internship as a kickstart for your professional career in a leading international company that is powered by innovative and value-adding IT solutions. What do we offer? We’ll give you the tools you need to excel in your internship, including one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own project while being part of a friendly team. You’ll not just be another pair of hands but a fully integrated team member with lots of self-responsibility. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with strategic development discussions and career opportunities. We’ll support you even before you start with us through relocation and integration support. With the international intern’s community at Hilti you’ll never be bored. Further, the snow-draped mountains, crystal-clear lakes and marvelous landscapes in the Happy Valley invite for lots of outdoor activities. Why should you apply? Become a valuable member of our highly professional and international team of IT experts and meet the challenges of a global multinational company using latest technologies. You will have the freedom to act in the responsible area with career prospects in a dynamic environment as well as excellent opportunities to develop yourself to higher levels and wider range of knowledge. We have a clearly defined career development track for every individual employee and an excellent team whom are duly rewarded by performance. What you need is: Master or PhD student in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related fields Strong IT affinity and ideally first work experience in the field of network technologies Strong communication skills, with excellent interpersonal skills A strategic approach and good problem-solving skills A thirst to learn and challenge yourself Fluent in English Hilti is an equal opportunity employer

Ajouter aux favoris AI/ML - Applied Machine Learning Engineer, Information IntelligenceRetiré des favoris Pour voir vos favoris, connectez-vous avec votre identifiant Apple. Vous n'avez pas d'identifiant Apple ? Summary Posted: 8 Feb 2021 Weekly Hours: 40 Role Number:200211673 Have you ever wanted to work on the machine learned natural language processing system powering Siri? Join the Information Intelligence team and build groundbreaking natural language understanding technologies and deploy them on a global scale. This work involves developing modern, sophisticated deep learning models built using state of the art word embeddings and model architectures. Key Qualifications Key Qualifications Academic and proven experience in NLP and ML, or similar experience in developing language technologies for shipping products. Strong coding and software engineering skills in a mainstream programming language, such as Python or Go. Familiarity with NLP/ML tools and packages like TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas et al. In-depth knowledge of machine learning algorithms and ability to apply them in data driven natural language processing systems. Ability to quickly prototype ideas / solutions, perform critical analysis, and use creative approaches for solving complex problems. Ability to collaborate closely with multi-functional teams. Experience working on search engines is a plus. Description Description We are looking for a highly motivated technologist with a strong background in Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning. In this position you will apply your problem solving skills to language technology challenges and opportunities within Information Intelligence, which involves development of large-scale language technologies for many languages worldwide. The primary responsibility of this role is to develop and ship innovative machine learning and NLP solutions for the Siri assistant and various other Apple products. You will also collaborate with data scientists to distill insights from petabytes of data to guide your work, team up with search engineers to help enrich Siri's understanding with deep knowledge of the world, and work closely with Siri experience engineers to together craft the kind of user experiences that continue to surprise and delight our customers. Apple's most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programmes. We're proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount - both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company's success. You'll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programmes that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products. You will be fully eligible for Apple benefits. The programmes vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements. Apple benefits programmes vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements. Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Education & Experience Education & Experience MSc, PhD in Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field with specialisation in natural language processing and/or machine learning or equivalent experience. | D&C Technology supports our Digital & Commerce division to reach its ambitious revenue growth and productivity increase targets. This by ensuring a stable trading & operation environment as well as delivering strategically important projects. The project portfolio consists of system landscape modernization (move to cloud, implementation of a micro-service based architecture and decommissioning of legacy applications and technologies) and delivering market differentiating own built or purchased applications. We are looking for a IT Project Manager who will be responsible for structural medium to highly complex IT projects to join our team. Your main responsibilities Coordinate and deliver projects on time within budget and scope own the full life cycle from initiation to deployment / delivery Define and report on project success criteria. Provide status reporting on all project dimensions to project sponsor and steering committees Develop a sufficiently deep technical and business understanding to be able to interact with business and IT subject matter experts Place a strong focus on stakeholder engagement, requirement engineering, scope & change control, assumptions, planning & risk management Your qualifications You have substantial experience & expertise (proven track record) in building and leading agile teams towards project execution, and applying a best combination of agile and waterfall-based project methodologies incl. tool deployment, metrics definition, reporting You demonstrate high performance with the ability to navigate quickly between high- and detailed levels, and you are ready for hands-on work where needed You lead in a collaborative way and have strong stakeholder management skills (at management but also technical & business team levels) Your working style is characterized by customer focus, results and risk orientation, strong planning and organization skills and excellent communication skills Ideally you have IT and business understanding with industry and domain expertise in energy trading, Front, Middle- and Back-Office processes Proficiency in English, German preferred, French or Italian a plus

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Report to the Chief Operating Officer and Director of Communications and for the Investment Solutions & Products group, working across business areas globally. You will join a forward-thinking team, whose team spirit and specific expertise guarantee an exciting working environment and growth opportunities You will maintain and prioritize a network of executive diaries to optimize media appearances and client engagements and coordinate meetings to ensure operational efficiency. You will own the tracking and dissemination of materials internally to executives, including social media analytics, media clips, and other compiled reports. You will identify where support can be given to the Management team proactively. Together with the team you will facilitate the day to day business management support, that includes activities such as preparation, coordination and execution of governance meetings, town halls and other external and internal communication measures. You Offer Are you a dedicated and highly motivated individual who establishes effective relationships with key partners and can make things happen? Then, join us! We are looking for: A team player with very good organizational skills and a very structured and efficient work approach; attention to detail and high quality standards are essential. University degree or similar and several years of experience in a similar function. Flair in setting priorities combined a sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability. A proactive mind-set paired with flexibility, dedication and self-motivation to cope with pressure in a fast paced and demanding environment. Proficiency in English and German. Any other languages are a plus. *LI-CSJOB* Ms. A. Zaydowicz would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Your field of responsibility Join us as a Junior Relationship Manager within the growing High-net-worth individuals (HNWI) Eastern Europe Team in our International Wealth Management division located in Geneva. You have oversight of account openings (e.g. domiciliary companies, trusts, foundations) and execution of all tasks and processes (e.g. politically exposed person, reputational risk review process) of a private banking account's life cycle. You handle securities and foreign exchange transactions, exposure to derivatives, liquidity management, credit issues and all administrative tasks along the client life cycle. You deliver top service to our clients and for ensuring a smooth administration, allowing the senior Relationship Managers to further develop the business. Your future colleagues Join a highly motivated team dedicated to the HNW clients segment. You support some of the most talented senior relationship managers, servicing well-established HNWI relationships. This is an excellent platform for personal and professional development within a highly committed and collaborative team in an international and fast-paced environment. If you consistently strive to learn, seek new technologies to redesign, improve existing processes and achieve efficiencies, we are the match for your ambition. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Your skills and experience You’ll be a good match, if you have: University degree or equivalent education At least 2-3 years of experience in Private Banking Proven hands-on experience ideally in Russian market and strong affinity for the culture Strong client and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate efficiently at all levels Ability to cope with pressure and a high level of flexibility, responsibility and attention to detail Diligent work approach with respect for our risk and control obligations Fluency in Russian and English is a must, French is a plus Understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work M. Who we are At Roche, over 90,000 people across 150 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity, and on seeing each other’s differences as an advantage. To innovate healthcare, Roche has ambitious plans to keep learning and growing – and is seeking people who have the same goals for themselves. At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. The Position “Synthetic Molecules Technical Development” (PTDC) brings a broad range of experience across drug substance (DS), drug product (DP), analytical sciences and manufacturing S&T, and collaborates closely with key partners in the departments Research and Early Development (pRED / gRED), Pharma Technical Development PTD and Commercial Manufacturing (PTG). PTDC is responsible for late stage technical development of our small molecules (SM) pipeline, manufacture of DS and DP for clinical studies and the transfer to the SM manufacturing network. As a Postdoctoral Fellow, you will develop and implement state-of-the-art methodologies and a computational toolbox to use measured particle properties to design formulation compositions for oral dosage forms (meaning primarily tablets). This position is part of the Drug Product Small Molecules Development organization, reporting to the Section Head of Formulation and Process Sciences, working closely with colleagues in Formulation and Process Research & Development (intended users of the methods and tools) and Particle and Formulation Characterization (subject matter experts in measurements and their use). In this position you will: Develop quantitative methods to help design drug product formulations Extend and develop computer-aided tools to enable such methods Combine computer/modelling/IT techniques and material science insights from the team with an interest in pharmaceutical development to create and improve methods and tools to design drug product formulations Interact with material scientists, data scientists, and formulators to match requirements with scientific breakthroughs and possibilities offered by 21st century computing tools Roll out your tools, train users, and manage their deployment, including transfer to IT service support where required. Publish your findings. Who you are: A highly motivated data scientist with experience in data liberation and processing, analysis, programming, and optimization Someone who enjoys and has experience in creative, data-driven quantitative modelling To develop new scientific methodologies: Your experience and investigative attitude allow you to work independently and to learn about new scientific areas. You further have demonstrated experience in creative development. You have very good interpersonal and communication skills , are able to build good working relationships, and work well within a multidisciplinary team. To drive culture change, the role requires independence as well as influencing so a proactive stance is a must. Requirements PhD in data science, or PhD employing computational / optimization methods applied to natural science, materials science, chemical engineering, pharmaceutical sciences, or chemistry Experience in quantitative techniques such as modelling, statistics, data science and/or software development and ideally applied to natural sciences Experience with programming languages and technologies, for example Python + Dash, R + Shiny, SQL, cloud computing platforms such as AWS or GCP, Docker, etc. Track record of scientific publications as journal articles and conference talks Fluency in written and spoken English All applications need to include a CV, a motivation letter and a certificate of your PhD. Our preferred start date for this fellowship is 1st February 2022, but please clearly indicate your availability on your motivation letter. Do you know what Roche stands for? Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. If you still have questions, then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq Closing date: 19th December 2021 Job Level: Individual contributor

WHO YOU ARE Candidate profile (text) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL Together with the Team Leader Sales you will drive the optimization of the IKEA shopping experience in your sales area in order to secure an excellent customer experience and thus influence sales growth. You will also develop your leadership skills as you learn how to motivate and inspire a team using your sales experience and product knowledge. You are passionate about sales, take initiative, are result-driven and have a strong customer-orientation. You have experience working in a sales or customer service environment. You are interested in people's everyday life at home and home furnishing. You are a proactive decision-maker with strong analytical capabilities and prioritization skills. You are open to change and highly flexible. You speak the local language fluently and communicate well in English. Key responsibilities (title) YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES Key responsibilities (text) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL • Making sure that your sales area is in excellent condition, fully stocked and the IKEA product range presented in ways that inspire the customers. Understanding and making the best commercial use of the various IKEA sales and communication channels to reach customers. Actively consulting the customers and driving sales. Taking responsibility, together with the Team Leader Sales to align your strategy with the national action plan in order to reach your goals. Supporting the Team Leader Sales in steering the sales to your department's top-selling products, prioritised products and IKEA service products in order to maximise sales and long-term profitability. Promoting the IKEA social and environmental commitment and working with your team to understand how, together, you can contribute to sustainability. Team vision ( title) ABOUT THIS WORK AREA Team vision and mission (text) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL We are the ones meeting our customers - in our stores, online, in our catalogue and beyond. We have knowledge of the IKEA product range, local markets and customer needs and we constantly find new ways of making real connections with our customers to maximize sales and profitability. Together with thousands of colleagues around the world we're a diverse team working for the continued global success of the IKEA Concept - a concept that helps millions of customers create a better everyday life! Local section (title) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL GOOD TO KNOW Local section (text) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL Please submit your application online and make sure to include your CV, motivation letter and any other relevant documents. Unfortunately, paper applications cannot be taken into consideration. Following a first selection, successful candidates will be invited to a phone or video interview. After this step, we will invite selected applicants to a face-to-face interview with the line manager and possibly other stakeholders. A trial day, where you can get to know your team and get a better insight into your potential future workplace, may also be part of your application experience. We are reviewing the applications continuously and will close this position as soon as we find the right candidate so please apply as soon as you can. It is important that you are flexible in terms of working hours. Early or late shifts within our opening hours and Saturday assignments will be part of your working schedule. If you are successful and receive an offer for this position, you will be required to submit your police record prior to receiving a contract. WHY YOU WILL LOVE US From the deep forests in Sweden, we have spread our culture and values around the world. At the heart of our offer are our beautiful home-furnishing products and solutions, made with care for our planet, reaching millions of customers. At the heart of our business, are our wonderful co-workers representing diversity in all dimensions and passionate for life at home. We all contribute with our uniqueness and we want to grow and develop together. Our vision, “to create a better everyday life for the many people” inspires and guides us in everything we do. This is IKEA. WHAT WE ALL HAVE IN COMMON Living our values Being your unique self, while respecting and including others A passion for home furnishing Performing & delivering while learning & developing Having fun! Ikea

Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Company description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Job description: In a world that’s changing faster than ever, our purpose acts as our ‘North Star’ guiding our more than 300,000 people – providing the context and meaning for the work we do every day. In doing so, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, clients and communities. Thanks to our innovative services in auditing, tax consulting as well as transaction and management consulting, we proudly drive our clients into the future. As the only one of the Big 4 with a specialist cross-border practice dedicated to the Financial Services Sector, we offer our clients seamless, consistent and high-quality services around the globe. With our Assurance Services, we strengthen public confidence in global capital markets and promote sustainable growth. If you’re looking to develop your individual skills whilst working in interdisciplinary and multicultural teams, come join us! What you can expect – enriching experiences that will last a lifetime • As a Finance, Accounting and/or Audit specialist, you are supporting and advising our Insurance OR Banking clients in accounting, audit and regulatory topics • You are a key member or leading teams supporting our Insurance OR Banking clients in implementing new accounting standards, adapting and transforming their Finance function, reporting processes and operating model - striking an optimal balance between effectiveness, efficiency and control • You are experienced in business development and motivated to excel in selling Advisory and Extended Assurance projects • You pro-actively share your knowledge and experience - contributing to continuously coaching and developing our teams What you can contribute – skills for shaping the future • Bachelor or Master degree, complemented with a further relevant professional education (e.g. Swiss Certified Accountant, CPA, or ACCA) • 6 - 15 years of relevant experience in Audit and/or Consulting within the Insurance OR Banking sector – incl. expertise in latest IFRS developments • Proactive, flexible and team-oriented from concept and design through to implementation of projects. You have an intellectual curiosity and you are willing to go “the extra mile” • Able to leverage your relevant external network and build your internal networks in a fast-paced and international environment investing in sustainable relationships • English and German are a prerequisite Stick to your plans and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. • International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals • Constant personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning • Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility • Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system • Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free* Your ambition is as bold as ours? As part of our high-performing teams, you’ll build the skillsets and growth mindsets to become the leader you want to be. The leader the world needs. Harness our scale, our tech, our teams and our culture to realize your potential. Learn from the best, surround yourself with the curious, ask better questions to seek better answers. The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. Make the next step and apply for this position online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66). * exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni

Ringier is a diversified media company with about 7,300 employees across 19 countries. Ringier is a Swiss family-owned business with head offices in Zurich. Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, theres no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of. For Drug Product Services (DPS) , our successful Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) branch, located in Basel, Switzerland and Stein, Switzerland, we have exciting opportunities. Become part of a group that enables its customers to meet some of the greatest challenges in patient treatment and join us by applying for the position as Technical Proposals Manager Drug Product Services. Key responsibilities: Responsible for providing timely and accurate translation of customer needs into proposals of time, cost and quality Create project proposals, timelines, plans, quotations and pricing by coordinating and working with multiple technical and operational groups Ensure good understanding of customer requests and technical project needs Assess feasibility as well as agree activities, resources, costs (including CAPEX) and timelines Transcribe proposals into asset, resource and financial planning systems as appropriate Provide value proposition, price and T&Cs to Sales in interaction with Commercial Development Work with operational groups and finance to ensuring the planned and actual scope are as accurate as possible Attend and lead customer meetings (on or off site) Key requirements: Significant industry experience in a Pharmaceutical company with parenteral Drug Product (formulation or process) development, analytics and/or manufacture Substantial knowledge of clinical product development and commercialization of parenteral Drug Products as well as customer facing experience Demonstrated ability to manage multiple, scientific projects and make sound scientific and regulatory interpretations and judgments Proficiency in English required, German language skills beneficial Extensive experience of program / project management within a scientific environment Ability to identify creative commercial, workable solutions Proven persuasive communication skills in a highly scientific and technical environment Diplomacy, negotiation skills, independent work skills, strong work ethic Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced, pressured environment Every day, Lonzas products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

The tender specialist will be part of the Global M&S organization of the railway segment. You will be active for the railway segment, working in conjunction and close cooperation with ABB local sales and tendering organization of the countries. Through your activity you will promote the ABB portfolio and solutions to railway stakeholders (EPCs’, system integrators, consulting companies, railway and urban transportation operators) in order to achieve ABB market penetration and growth aspirations. Reporting to the Global Marketing and Sales Railway Manager, you will develop railway solutions starting from the pursuing stage to make ABB offering more attractive and competitive. As a member of the GMS Railway you will contribute to implementing the global railway segment sales strategy in order to reach the annual goals. Your responsibilities Guarantee railway application technical competence in order to be identified as a railway ex-pert within ABB organization and a recognized competent counterpart by customers Lead offers’ preparation in coordination with the bid and proposal department of the offering unit: ensure that the technical and financial aspects of offers are properly assessed, including prices and trading conditions Guarantee that technical and commercial offers are in compliance with tender documents as well as customer’s inquiries and specifications Lead internal approval process for demanding opportunities Ensure regular follow-up with ongoing opportunities in close cooperation with the colleagues of the GMS Railway and the entire organization Actively take part in initiatives for capturing opportunities at the early stage, develop technical solutions in order to influence end-user specifications Maintain and enhance customer satisfaction by providing excellent service at all stages of the sales process Your background Masters in Electrical engineering 5 years of professional experience for tendering in MV and LV IEC equipment. Experience in railway application and ANSI standards will be considered a plus Sound knowledge of tendering processes and tools Fully independent in developing technical solutions including MV and LV Switchgear, protection relays High level of self-motivation, curiosity and desire to learn about new technologies and solutions Efficient in managing priorities. Must be well organized, responsible and accountable Advanced level in English and Spanish. Other languages will be considered as a plus Highly proficient in MS Office, tools for equipment sizing, technical drawings software (i.e. Autocad, Visio) Willingness to travel according to business’ needs More about us We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your full application (motivation letter, CV, references) only via our online careers tool. The recruiting process is being led by Stephan Kuehne, Talent Partner ABB Switzerland Ltd. Responsible Sourcing Manager - Your future position? Givaudan recently launched its updated and strengthened responsible sourcing program, Sourcing4Good. As a Responsible Sourcing Manager you will help drive the program through our end-to-end supply chain by working with the RS team to drive the implementation of our responsible sourcing projects following Givaudan's corporate strategy and targets. Your work includes sustainability improvements across the Naturals, Synthetics and Indirect Materials and Services (IM&S) supply chains and you will ensure your focus is on bringing value for our teams, suppliers, communities and customers. You will report to our Head of Global Responsible Sourcing, you will need to travel, around 20% of time. To be based in a European facility, such as: Multiple locations: Vernier (Switzerland), Kemptthal (Switzerland), Ashford (UK), Argenteuil (FR) In this exciting role your main responsibilities will be the following: Implementation: Determine yearly action plans with essential milestones for your portfolio. Work with your team mates to implement a new operating model with Procurement, through guiding and supporting procurement category managers in the integration of key elements of the Sourcing4Good program into their daily work. Drive and accelerate progress on your portfolio of the program, and will support and cover for team mates when necessary. Work with suppliers and external partners to identify gaps against the Givaudan Responsible Sourcing Policy throughout supply chains in each spend category Identify necessary improvements, agree and accomplish action plans and monitor progress: Drive the gathering and accumulation of materials attributes data to meet our customers' increasing demands for supply chain information. Business Partnering: Promote the responsible sourcing program with all relevant partners. Develop and deliver regular training to category managers and suppliers. Present regular progress reports to our category manager workforce and Procurement and Business leadership teams. Ensure a constant dialogue is maintained with your partners such as Procurement, Sustainability, Corporate Communications and Commercial teams. Provide relevant content for customer presentations and individual requests, and attend customer meetings. Supplier Engagement: For certain raw material supply chains you will travel to foster collaboration and accelerate progress. Communications: Be an ambassador for Sourcing4Good both inside and outside the business, and for Givaudan's Purpose and Sustainability goals. Build advocacy for Sourcing4Good throughout the business. Use our communications platforms to bring visibility to Givaudan's sustainability and responsible sourcing activities. Your successful profile includes: Bachelor's degree or equivalent in, Environmental Sciences, Engineering or Sustainability or a related field Minimum 5 years' experience in responsible or sustainable sourcing or sustainability topics and sustainability standards Experience in an international environment within a matrix organization Experience in creating valuable improvements throughout supply chains in a direct and indirect supplier setting, including up to farm level Experience in sustainable sourcing of commodities, such as Palm products and RSPO certification Fluent in written and verbal English, any other language would be appreciated Knowledge in local field-project staff, local communities, government agencies, the not-for-profit sector and the scientific community Solid project management experience with a structured and process-driven approach, and the ability to record, measure and document progress Ability to build teams and navigate with autonomy. Ability to transform data into useful information and a convincing presentation Passion for learning and sharing expertise on sustainability topics Open-minded and creative in finding innovative, effective solutions Experienced in budget management Some of our Benefits: Paid Time Off and family leave Retirement plan Sport and leisure clubs At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people’s lives. You work within an inspiring teamwork culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions and divisions. Join us and Impact Your World Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers and partners. Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world. Givaudan

Responsibilities Preparation of customer documentation and 8D reports in collaboration with internal departments Regular attendance in meetings (including preparation) with the customer to follow-up on open points Planning with supplier management and project management (development) quality manager Responsibility for customer PPAP (Production Part Approval Process) and follow-up of PPAP availability Preparation of customer visits and audits and accountability for technical reviews and audits as required by the customer Overall responsibility for claim handling and problem solving (8D etc.) and ensure targeted response time Lead or participate in Quality Management related and cross-functional projects and statistical analysis Requirements Master or Bachelor degree in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, industrial engineering or similar qualification Thorough knowledge of quality methods, additional trainings in Quality Management and related disciplines would be an advantage 3 to 4 years of professional experience in a similar position within a matrix organisation and with direct customer contact Proficiency in English and in German, good knowledge in French is an asset Very good knowledge with MS Office, a CRM software and good knowledge of an ERP software Good analytical and communication skills, independence as well as team player attitude, assertiveness and customer orientation Our offer We offer an exciting activity in a young and dynamic team, payment commensurate with your skills and social benefits of a modern company Liebherr Machines Bulle SA Nadege Malan +41 26 913 31 11

Administration Lausanne, Switzerland Description Position at Logitech The Role: The Junior Data Scientist ideal candidate will work in the Data Science team from the Analytics & Machine Learning department and will run analytical experiments and will regularly evaluate alternate models via theoretical approaches. He/She will implement models to fit the strategy defined at the team level. His/Her responsibilities ranges from solution proposal to project implementation. He/She will work in our European Headquarter based in Lausanne. One major aspect of his role is the interaction with the Business Group departments. He/She will work closely with our IT center based in Chennai and with various actors in our regional headquarters (Euroep, America and Asia-Pacific). Your Contribution: Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. These are the behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will: Implement Machine Learning and Deep Learning models Contribute positively as a team player in order to increase the team’s contribution to Logitech success Contribute to the extension of the long term vision of the team Key Qualifications: For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team: Familiarity with Python Good knowledge of Unsupervised and Supervised ML algorithms including Neural Networks /Deep Learning Familiarity with Text Mining, Natural Language Processing, and Social Network Graphs Understanding of Business purpose of a project Ability to transition from the Prrof of Concept phase to a final application Ideally, already had exposure to large data sets In addition, preferable skills and behaviors include: Team player Ability to adapt to any situation Entrepreneurial / innovation mindset Hands-on to get things done fast and able to work in ambiguity and without continual guidance Inquisitive mind with the ability to recognize inefficiencies and challenge the status quo Attention to detail combined with creative thinking Good written and verbal communication skills Ability to connect easily with colleagues Ability to tailor insights to present clearly to technical and non-technical audiences Multi-cultural exposure, especially exposed to our three regions’ cultures Education: Bachelor degree in Business Analytics or Engineering with a background in statistics Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it.As a company, we’re small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen. But we’re big enough in our portfolio, and reach, for those actions to have a global impact. That’s a pretty sweet spot to be in and we’re always striving to keep it that way. “All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employmentwithout regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.” #LI-CD1

Position summary About Deloitte Deloitte is one of the fastest growing business consultancy firms in Switzerland, where experts develop strategies and solutions that help clients manage even the most complex problems.Is business consultancy your kind of work? Then a career with Deloitte will help you make an impact at every level. We, as Deloitte Digital, are looking for a talented team member who is able to tackle questions such as: What is the next big thing in tech and what does this mean for business? How can we use Design Thinking to help our clients? How can a company harness its social media presence to enhance profitability? How do we translate an abstract concept into a digital product in an agile manner? And how can we deliver the best digital solutions to our clients? As a Manager with a focus on content and commerce within our team, you'll take a leading role in advising our clients on their digital journey, helping them to exploit various channels to strengthen their brand and grow their business. You will define and deliver digital strategies and support our clients in creating striking user experiences in the areas of content and commerce. This spans every aspect from experience strategy, creative design, advertising, and branding, to platforms, solution implementation, and roll-out. Who and what are we looking for? Academic record of achievements from a reputable university or equivalent (preferably with a Masters degree in Computer Science or Engineering) 5-8 years of relevant work experience, with evidence of delivering user experience focused software development projects Strong project management skills, including end-to-end agile delivery Excellent presentation and communication skills with the ability to articulate business solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences Good understanding of leading content, commerce and campaign management platforms such as Adobe Experience Management (relevant certifications are considered an advantage) Good understanding of design thinking- and service design principles Some understanding of digital architectures principles and building blocks, and how to apply them to solve business challenges Ability to work effectively with a variety of clients and in challenging situations, establishing credibility and trust quickly Passion for Digital Marketing trends and technologies Proficiency in English, German skills are a plus Who are we? We are Deloitte Digital. Our team consists of people from all over the world working in Zurich, who speak more than 15 languages. You can expect to be fully integrated in a team with support from experienced project managers, as well as taking ownership of work streams and projects with a high degree of independence. Although we value diversity and having an own opinion, we all share the same belief that creativity and consulting are not mutually exclusive. Any questions? Lets get in touch - we look forward to hearing from you! Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 178408

You oversee automation activities. For example, you automate the onboarding of virtual network functions or orchestrate new connectivity capabilities. What you achieve The complexity of our network keeps growing, and our mobile network customers keep having higher expectations. That's why we rely on effective automation. Joining the network management and orchestration team, you design and implement our in-house orchestration framework and lead our automation activities. You speed up the onboarding of a new network function or enable 5G network slicing. With an innovative mindset, you connect different stakeholders (like network function suppliers) and make the mobile network's automation capabilities ready for the new cloudified decade. Why you succeed Bachelor's or Master's degree (ETH/Uni/UAS) in computer science or similar Higher-level skills in cloud services as IaaS (e.g. Openstack, VmWare), CaaS (e.g. Kubernetes), or cloud management and orchestration (e.g. ONAP) Know-how of 3GPP and ETSI MANO architecture a plus Familiar with RedHat Linux, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, DBMS, security basics and automation, familiar with frameworks like Camunda, Ansible, Temporal.io, and OSGi Proficient in OO-Software Enginerings, e.g. Java or C# Agile and lean methodology (e.g. Scrum, SAFe) and DevOps mindset Open-minded, customer-oriented, and self-driven personality, ready to set priorities and make decisions Good English and German a plus Curious to know more? As DevOps Engineer Orchestration ... you start as soon as possible ... you can partly work from home ... you do not travel regularly SwissCom

The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, needs, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform designs. In this role, you will investigate user behavior and user needs using empirical research methods, such as logs analysis, survey research, path modeling, and regression analysis. Google’s Consumer UX team is responsible for the user experience in Google Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping and more — products and experiences used and seen by many people. In this role, you will set the foundation for a research team within the Consumer UX Insights and Innovation group tasked with establishing insights and principles around user decision-making.User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Cyber Risk Services at Deloitte In a rapidly changing world where information is the new currency, the corresponding information security and privacy have become a board level challenge. Deloitte has the largest Cyber capability of the Big 4 in the European marketplace with over 600 Cyber Risk Specialists staffing thousands of client engagements. The team combines a wealth of deep industry knowledge and technical expertise. Within the Cyber team, we provide our clients a full spectrum of security and privacy services, from strategy to large-scale transformation programmes, fixing security issues and delivering tangible benefits. Leading security and privacy experts with the right level of intellectual curiosity drive our business. You will be continuously challenged, build leadership skills and long lasting relationships with a team that respects you and is fun to work with. In addition, you can drill deep and become a specialist within an industry sector or grow as a generalist. What youll do Advising organisations on how good cyber security looks like based on data, cyber security threats and risks they face as an organisation within their industry Identifying and explaining cyber risks within complex new digital transformation initiatives You will shape and deliver innovative solutions by implementing people, governance, process or technological improvements You will work alongside our Cyber leads to develop disruptive market propositions across a number of industries You will build and develop long-term relationships with (senior) cyber professionals and other relevant stakeholders across our client organisations You will lead high-profile security transformation programmes to deliver security improvements and help deliver a step-change in security capability What you need A clear and demonstrable understanding in 2-3 security domains inclusive but not limited to; advanced threat readiness and protection, application protection, identity and access management, cloud security, incident response, information privacy and protection, cyber risk analytics and vulnerability management Technical or specialist experience with supporting certifications in one or more of; security technology deployment or operation, operating system build/support/configuration, networking, software or web development, coding, system or solution architecture initiatives, cloud initiatives, incident response/management, and technical risk assessments Commercial awareness and business acumen, including specifically a deep understanding of cyber risk to both business processes and supporting technology and mechanisms to measure and manage that risk Strong interpersonal skills and experience of developing effective working relationships and influencing outcomes Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate highly complex concepts effectively, appropriately tailored to people from a range of cultures, technical backgrounds and seniorities Strong analytical and problem solving skills with up-to-date knowledge of the latest cyber-attack techniques and threats Relevant cyber qualifications, for example CISSP, CISM, PCI QSA or equivalent, are seen as beneficial Relevant industry knowledge from your experience in-house or with previous clients and the ability to derive specific industry insights/trends You will have a top tier Cyber consulting background, or equivalent experience delivering significant change in complex organizational environments with demanding stakeholders Fluent or native in English and German, both written and verbal language skills are mandatory, whilst additional local languages such as French are considered beneficial Any questions? Get in touch. We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any question, please contact Irina Rusu at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 177305

At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients lives and we are fearless in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. Who we are: The Immunology Incubator is an innovative interface between Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) and the next generation of academic leaders. High potential, early-mid career investigators and postdocs with an Immunology background are embedded within pRED to conduct exploratory research that advances disease understanding and uncovers novel therapeutic targets. pRED has an opening for an Immunology Incubator Postdoc Fellow within the Immunology Department located in Basel, Switzerland. We are seeking an independent and highly motivated researcher for our Postdoc position to advance understanding of the mechanisms underlying the progression of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). Specifically, the research project will aim at investigating lung myeloid cell functional diversity and niche instruction by structural cells, primarily (but not only) in animal models of COPD. What your tasks will be: Drive the in-house implementation of the disease induction in a well-known mouse COPD model Utilize single cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to define the transcriptional signatures of myeloid and structural cell populations isolated from the mouse model for further hypothesis generation. Perform detailed immune phenotyping of the cell (sub)populations of interest using multi-color flow and mass cytometry. Carry out ex vivo studies in primary immune cells and structural cells to further mechanistic understanding. Form close collaborative relationships with other scientists within the Immunology Incubator, Immunology group and technical teams in other functions. Who you are: Youre someone who wants to influence your own development. Youre looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point. Furthermore, you have obtained a Ph.D. no longer than four years ago in Cellular and Molecular Immunology and have performed experiments using in vivo models of lung diseases. Having several of the following skills will further boost your application: You have a profound understanding of the lung innate immune system and are eager to identify underlying mechanisms that will drive next-generation therapeutics. You have experience of the state-of-the-art single cell RNA sequencing techniques, ideally from lung tissue. You have a track record of hands-on experience with animal handling and procedures. You have experience with flow and/or mass cytometry. Knowledge of immunohistochemistry and other tissue staining techniques is a plus. You possess good knowledge in independently planning and executing mechanistic studies using in vivo and/or ex vivo lung disease models. Your excellent English skills, written and spoken, complete your profile. If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients lives. If you want to work in a hardworking team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now! Please include a detailed CV with a publication list, and a cover letter describing your interests and your expected date of availability. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are dedicated to building a team that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Research & Development, Research & Development > Research

About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 13,000 employees across the world. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us? About the Role We are looking for a Product Owner to join us for our Data Engineering & Analytics product. We are a Product Area of 6 products taking care of all digital solutions for Sourcing, Finance Group Operations, Legal, Compliance, Audit and some of Group Digital Transformation's portfolio at Swiss Re. We work in a scaled agile model with a shared leadership team and broad aligned autonomy for our squads. We are located across the globe but share the same values of passion, openness, respect, humbleness and curiosity in our team. And we strive to improve our work for our customers every day. Is this for you? Then we want to get to know you! The role includes the following responsibilities: • Develop a product vision. Collaborate with the chapter lead to build a target architecture on how to consolidate the different data marts in your responsibility onto Swiss Re's target platform including a migration strategy and long-term roadmap. Partner with stakeholders to understand their data insights & analytics needs and integrate them into the product backlog. Work closely with internal and external data engineers, BI developers and analysts in the squad to design and deliver product improvements. Prioritise work items from the backlog, set the sprint goals and participate in agile events. Maximise the product value and take ownership of the corresponding budget. Define outcome-based metrics (OKRs) and measure the value built. Co-lead the squad together with the Scrum Master and technical Chapter Leads and foster an agile mentality. Improve data quality, automate data loads and curation as well as strengthen data governance. Collaborate with Swiss Re's Group Data Services to understand strategy, discover best practices and influence their direction. About You • A university degree in IT, Business Administration or equivalent qualification. Several years of practical experience with data services including ETL tools, data mart design, integration services like Azure Data Factory and visualisation tools like Power BI. Detailed real-world experience with Scrum or similar agile methodologies. A Scrum Product Owner certification is a plus. A passion for delighting your customers. Outstanding communication skills and emotional intelligence. Strong analytical skills. A passion to lead people in your squad with your interpersonal skills, through listening, inspiring, encouraging as well as giving/receiving feedback. English language proficiency, with optional German skills. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, including gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Swiss Re offers modern work models and attractive workplaces that allow all employees to adapt to changing work preferences and life phases. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Liebherr Machines Bulle SA is the centre of excellence for combustion engines (diesel and gas engines) and hydraulic components. Switzerland - Zürich    Audit    Group Functions    Job Reference #  225990BR    City  Zürich    Job Type  Full Time    Your role  Are you a sharp evaluator of risk? Can you investigate complex situations and propose recommendations?  We’re looking for someone like that who can: – drive or work as a team member on reviews and audits of specific business areas, including thematic and front-to-back – conduct reviews and audits of specific business areas, provide practical, innovative and value-added recommendations to issues identified – manage complex audits and lead audit teams across different regions – analyze and assess operational and IT risks (cyber security and resiliency, data protection and confidentiality, technology change, technology reliability) assumed by both the business and support functions – identify and evaluate the effectiveness of controls designed to address those risks – document and communicate audit issues, root causes and risks, and prepare reports of audit findings for UBS senior management – prepare reports of audit findings for UBS senior management, monitor the results, risk profile and developments across GIA network and provide input for planning sessions    Your Career Comeback  We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.    Your team  You will be working in Group Internal Audit (GIA) Team in Singapore, Switzerland, UK or US. GIA is an independent function that supports UBS in achieving its strategic, operational, financial and compliance objectives. We do this by assessing key processes as well as governance, risk management, and the control environment within all business divisions and Group Functions (GF) functions globally. We are independent in our work and report directly to the Chairman of the Board and the Audit Committee. We are a talent powerhouse that attracts and develops the best people by driving career growth in and outside the department. Our team IT Audit organization is responsible for auditing technology globally. In your role, you will be covering in particular audits related to application security as well as other technology risks.    Your expertise  – a degree in information security, computer engineering or science (Masters Degree a plus) – at least 8 years of experience in IT audit, IT security or IT risk management preferably within the financial industry. This experience could have been gained at a consulting firm or in an internal audit function. – recognized IT security certifications, such asCertified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) and Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH). – A detailed understanding and hands-on experience in application security focusing in particular on application programming interface (API) management, mobile/web application firewalls and mobile apps security. – Solid understanding of the entire software development lifecycle, software testing methodologies, and paradigm shift to and risk associated with cloud-based development. – strong analytical skills and quantitative approach to problem solving – willingness to keep up with industry, regulatory developments and learn new concepts and methods – ability to effectively communicate with senior stakeholders – fluent in English with excellent verbal and written skills – Knowledge of Investment Bank, Wealth Management or Asset Management products and expected automated controls will be an added benefit.    LI-UBS      About us  Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.  We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?    Join us  We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.    Disclaimer / Policy Statements  UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. This gives you the opportunity to work on projects and with national and international stakeholders Our activities are extremely varied, ranging from advisory projects, to internal/external audits & to risk management of businesses and information systems. During your projects, you will work closely with financial, operational and IT stakeholders to our customers as well as with the other Service lines of Deloitte. Our services include : Advisory and IT Audit Internal Audits Governance, Risks and Conformity Security, Integrity and Process Optimisation Your profile : You are a graduate or future graduate from an engineering/business school, or University You are curious and have a thirst for knowledge, bringing fresh perspectives to our projects You can analyse complex problems and to develop and communicate solution options You can collaborate and interact smoothly with people from diverse backgrounds Fluency in English and German Both IT and Finance/accounting skills are an advantage What we offer : The possibility to work on challenging projects in collaboration with a team of dynamic consultants in a multicultural & stimulating environment A clear career path with a professional training curriculum Our company : Deloitte is one of the main audit and consulting companies in the world and provides services in the areas of audit, tax and legal advice, consulting and corporate finance. Die Liebherr-Components AG mit Sitz in Nussbaumen in der Schweiz ist als Handelsgesellschaft zuständig für den weltweiten Vertrieb von Komponenten und Systemlösungen der Firmengruppe Liebherr auf dem Gebiet der mechanischen, hydraulischen und elektrischen Antriebs- und Steuerungstechnik. Ihre Aufgabe Sie bearbeiten Ersatzteilanfragen und -angebote für Komponenten von Liebherr und übernehmen die Verantwortung für die Abwicklung der Ersatzteilbestellungen Sie kümmern sich um die Disposition und Terminüberwachung, die Koordination der Logistik und Fakturierung Die Steigerung der Kundenzufriedenheit liegt Ihnen am Herzen, Sie fördern die Kundenbindung Selbständig erledigen Sie die allgemeine Korrespondenz mit Kunden und Lieferanten Sie führen enge Kontakte mit Lieferanten sowie internen Stellen und übernehmen die Koordination Sie pflegen die Ersatzteil-Preise und Rabatte (Stammdatenpflege) Sie prüfen und bearbeiten Gewährleistungsanträge (gemäß Vertragsbedingungen) Sie bearbeiten und verrechnen Schulungen, Serviceleistungen und Reparaturen Sie optimieren die Kundenintegration in die Digital Service Lösungen der Liebherr Gruppe (z.B. MyLiebherr) Sie unterstützen den Teamleiter bei der Umsetzung von fachlichen und organisatorischen Aufgaben Sie helfen mit bei der Umsetzung von fachlichen und organisatorischen Aufgaben Ihr Profil Sie haben eine kaufmännische oder technische Grundausbildung mit Weiterbildung im Verkauf- oder Exportbereich (Aussenhandelsfachmann-/frau) Sie verfügen über mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Customer Service, Customer Care oder Kundendienst, von Vorteil in einem Industrie- oder Handelsunternehmen im internationalen Umfeld Sie sind eine gewinnende und kommunikative Persönlichkeit mit Verkaufsflair und Sie interessieren sich für technische Produkte Wichtig sind uns auch Ihre hohe Dienstleistungsbereitschaft und Kundenorientierung Sie sind ein Organisationstalent mit Überzeugungs- und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit Sie haben eine Affinität für Daten, digitale Lösungen sowie gute ERP und MS-Office Kenntnisse Gute Deutsch- und Französischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Englischkenntnisse sind erwünscht Sie schätzen ein dynamisches Umfeld und arbeiten gerne selbständig Unser Angebot Die Firmengruppe Liebherr bietet Ihnen als international erfolgreiches Familienunternehmen eine einzigartige Vielfalt an Aufgaben und spannende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Zudem profitieren Sie von den Sozialleistungen eines modernen Unternehmens mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen. Sie erhalten eine gründliche Einführung in Ihr neues Aufgabengebiet. Werden Sie noch heute Teil unseres starken Teams und lernen Sie die Firma Liebherr als zuverlässigen Partner kennen. Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Bei Fragen kontaktieren Sie bitte Jeton Tahiri unter: +41 56 296 4041. Lernen Sie uns kennen: liebherr.com/karriere Liebherr. One Passion. Many Opportunities.

Description du poste Digital Media Planning Project Leader 100% (F/M) As Digital Media Planning Project Leader, you will be part of the Brand Communication team. Responsible for Swatch media planning campaigns in collaboration with the Head of Media Planning, you will be working on a wide variety of projects, managing campaigns at HQ level, supporting local markets for local campaigns, and providing best practices on next-generation digital media trends. Collaborate with our teams in the markets and coordinate the digital media campaigns Collaborate and coordinate with the in house Copywriter for creation of Ad copy, as well as with the Brand Image & Digital Marketing teams for the digital asset development Prepare the trafficking sheet for the Digital Media Campaigns, by liaising with the eCommerce team and the Digital Marketing team Track, monitor and optimize performance of the Digital Media Campaigns against key KPIs and evaluate the final results Continuously analyse the Digital Media Campaigns (Paid Social Media, Display, Search) and adjust strategy and budgets accordingly together with our agency Assemble and analyse data on Digital Media Campaigns performance and communicate strategic recommendations Generate bi-weekly, monthly and quarterly analytics reports and other reports as needed on ad hoc basis - by liaising with the eCommerce and Digital Marketing team Maintain relationships with agencies and third-party vendors who supports our paid marketing efforts Stay up to date on the latest Digital Media trends and best practices Description du profil Besides your positive and analytical personality, you bring a degree in Marketing / Digital Media and min 3 years' experience in a similar position, preferably in a web media agency. Languages In addition, you possess excellent communications skills and are fluent in English (Mandatory); German and/or French is a plus.
