About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of our 15,000 employees across the world. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us? About the Team The Connectivity Services (CS) team is responsible for the infrastructure services (e.g. WAN, LAN, Security Services, DC LAN, Wi-Fi, etc) for the SwissRe Global Network, Production Facilities for DCs and ICT Rooms, Service Transition & Decommissioning. About the Role In your role as Cloud Network Engineer, you would contribute to the following areas: Develop and maintain an extensive understanding of the Swiss RE Cloud network environment. Develop, validate and update key engineering artifacts such as standards/best practices, design documents and decisions. Design and document solutions to meet requirements and that are easily scalable for the enterprise. Work closely with architects and engineering teams to understand emerging technologies and how they would benefit Swiss RE and its users. As senior technology leader work closely with networking associates to understand emerging network technologies and their application in the evolving Swiss RE network topology. Transforming, integrating, and automating network infrastructure to tightly integrate with SDN (Software Defined Networking). Develop automation for network related changes/deployment. Monitor and troubleshoot network related issues with support from external providers. Participate in network health diagnostics and optimization via proper monitoring and capacity planning. Assist with the definition and tracking of key performance metrics. What we are looking for: Experienced Senior Cloud Network Engineer to work on innovative, enterprise level Azure/AWS/Alibaba cloud network design and integration topics. Integration and implementation of Public Cloud networking/security solutions to support Swiss Re's evolving cloud landscape. Candidate will be responsible for the design, engineering and implementation of Public Cloud networking infrastructure and integrations aspects between Public Cloud and On-premise. Candidate will work with external providers who will provide the create/develop/refine ops model. Candidate is expected to work on aggressive timelines engaging with application teams and other teams to troubleshoot highly secure and complex network environments. Candidate is also expected to perform development activities to provide reliable and scalable automation from a deployment point of view. Candidate should be able to multitask and work in an agile environment. Senior level collaboration with multiple teams including but not limited to application, security and infrastructure teams. About You Knowledge on Public Cloud networking concepts, firewalls, network security is a must. Experience that is also data center centric e.g SDN (ACI), switching, routing, firewalling technologies. Azure, AWS and Alibaba experience required including deploying virtual security/network appliances. Very strong technical knowledge of enterprise networking solutions for very large environments including multi cloud integration concepts such as Express Route, Direct Connect etc. Very strong technical knowledge on routing protocols such as BGP, ISIS etc. Demonstrates self-motivation, leadership ability, strong team player who enjoys a fast-paced atmosphere Ability to manage multiple priorities, commitments and projects. Ability to learn very quickly in a fast-paced environment. Scripting abiltiies and other IaC tools e.g Shell, Python, Chef, Puppet, Terraform plus others 5+ years in designing, supporting/troubleshooting and deploying network configurations. Language skills: English is mandatory. German is a plus. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We provide feedback to all candidates via email. If you have not heard back from us, please check your spam folder.

Within the Robotics Business Unit, Hamilton develops and produces pipetting robots for the automation of liquid handling processes; from standard solutions to highly complex systems that are precisely tailored to the needs of our customers. Our customers come from a wide range of research and development backgrounds. This ranges from the pharmaceutical and food industries, all the way to cell and DNA research. Within Robotics, there exists a diverse range of career opportunities: from mechanical engineering to software development, and from application specialization to product management or market segment management. Whether it's in the technical, scientific, or financial field, we offer limitless opportunities for professional development. Responsibilities Initiate and further-develop the digital transformation for the launches of specific digital products for the Robotics Business Unit Assess and integrate IoT products into the Hamilton Robotics Product Portfolio Elaborate and present smart product visions and product proposals (i.e. formal Product Proposals) Maintain close contact with stakeholders, in order to identify and prioritize various needs Collaborate with the Marketing Communication department Collaborate on the creation of requirements specifications, in close cooperation with the product owner in Requirements Engineering Continuously monitor product success, in accordance with defined success factors (post-market surveillance) Coordinate digitalization strategy and software development with the US headquarters (Reno, Nevada) Learn more about our liquid handling systems here: Qualifications Completed BSc / Masters studies in Computational and Data Science or Computer Science Experience in Robotics and Automation An initiative-taking, communicative and team-oriented personality, who enjoys working within interdisciplinary teams Personality with a high degree of assertiveness and persuasiveness Reliable and independent; sense of responsibility and has organizational skills Fluent in German and English (both oral and written) Jobcloud

At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients lives. We are courageous in both decision and action, we believe that good business means a better world. Roche Diagnostics has built a new strategic group, Roche Information Solution (RIS), charged with creating a modern portfolio of decision support software products that change the way patients are cared for. Our challenge is to bring-together complex diagnostic and treatment data from medical devices and IT systems within a hospital, and intelligently process and present this data to clinicians, researchers, and caregivers to improve research outcomes and patient care. We are looking for an intern to further develop prototype clinical decision support apps for the NAVIFY platform. The focus of this project is on analysis of digital pathology images, and will be performed in a cross-functional setting. In this position you will: Use computer vision and deep learning methods to analyse digital pathology images. Use insights to improve personalized healthcare and drive clinical decision support applications. Be part of an exciting, multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural team of scientists at Roche and benefit from interactions with different functions at Roche. Your profile: You are currently enrolled as an MSc or PhD student or recently finished your studies with a background in computer s cience, physics, mathematics or engineering (hard requirement) . You have extensive and demonstrable hands-on experience with computer vision techniques and deep learning frameworks in Python; preferably Pytorch. You are an expert Python programmer. Experience with graph convolutional neural networks is a plus. You know how to run computationally demanding simulations and analyses with large amounts of data on the cloud; preferably AWS. You do not shy away from serious data wrangling to create the best data sets You have a strong interest in biomedical imaging and the translation of state-of-the-art research into clinical applications. You can work autonomously while following and delivering on overarching goals. You are fluent in English (both verbally and in writing). The starting date of this internship is upon availability (preferred Summer 2021) and it will run for 6 months . Applications need to include a CV and a cover letter. In your cover letter, please clearly indicate your preferred starting date, as well as your match with the profile we are looking for. Due to regulations non-EU/EFTA citizens must provide a certificate from the university stating that an internship is mandatory as part of the application documents. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients lives and we are courageous in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. The internship in Roches Group Informatics People & Culture team in Kaiseraugst offers you the unique opportunity to learn more about our mission, what we do, working in an agile organisation, how we support patients on their journey, as well as meeting and working with lots of great people! Your contributions will focus on employee engagement and employee development programs. During the 9-12-month internship you will: Support IT employee development programs and initiatives in collaboration with People & Culture to ensure a cohesive learning approach for employees Coordinate, continuously improve, and engage our global workforce of 3500 employees in our employee development platform, the Career Compass Consult with key stakeholders for input and provide recommendations of potential solutions to employee development initiatives Prepare communication materials in collaboration with IT Communications using the best channels for information distribution and engagement Who you are We are keen to discover talents who are passionate about learning and show great curiosity in discovering new things. At the Roche Headquarter site in Basel/Kaiseraugst, employees from over 90 countries are doing now what our patients need next. We contribute our share towards achieving our mission and to make our vision of personalized healthcare happen. We offer you a multicultural workplace in a modern environment, which at the same time requires you to be open-minded and adaptable. As an intern you will join our Roche Interns Network that offers you chances to connect, have fun and get to know Basel, in the heart of Europe. For this internship we are mainly looking for an enrolled student or recent graduate whos passionate about and skilled in human resources, adult learning, sociology, psychology, or business. Experience in the area of training design, organisational development, or employee development would be a plus. Youre a self starter, and highly motivated to learn about designing and operating employee development and employee engagement programs. What do you need in your toolbox: An understanding of project management methodologies and experience running a project A passion for people development and building strong networks Able to work independently with little guidance, have an enthusiastic and open-minded attitude Highly collaborative and an ability to multitask while remaining organized Advanced knowledge in Googles suite of applications (Mail, Calendar, Drive, Google Currents, Hangouts) Fluent in spoken and written English, German is an advantage If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now. The preferred start date is October 2020 or upon availability for 9-12 months. Please clearly indicate your preferred starting date and duration of internship in your motivation letter. Lonza ist heute ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15‘000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. Am Standort Visp wird ein/e Anlageningenieur /in gesucht. Ihre Aufgaben Technische Projektleitung bei Planung und Realisierung von Investitionsprojekten, bei Pauschalkrediten und Sondermassnahmen Planung, Realisierung und Betreuung von Produkteumstellungen und einführungen Verfahrenstechnische Berechnungen und Optimierungen in der Anlage Umsetzen und Überwachen von Anlageoptimierungen und Projekten Erstellung von Machbarkeitsstudien von Neuanlagen und/oder Umbau bestehender Anlagen inkl. Kostenabschätzung, Terminplanung und Funktionalität Einhalten von cGMP-Richtlinien in den Anlagen und Mithilfe bei der Qualifizierung von Anlageteilen sowie Sicherstellen der Änderungskontrolle Durchführen von Risikoanalysen, um die Sicherheits-, Gesundheits- und Umweltanforderungen einzuhalten Vertretung des Betriebes an Behörden- und Kundenaudits Erarbeiten und Einhalten von allgemeinen Abläufen, Anlagekonzepten, Anlagestandards Pflege und Überwachung der Anlagendokumentation mit durchgängiger Erfassung und Pflege der Daten von Technischen Plätzen, Equipments und Ersatzteilen, Ersatzteillisten, Betriebsanleitungen und SOPs, etc. Schulung des Instandhaltungsteams hinsichtlich Prozess- und Anlagenkenntnis, technischer Schulung sowie Sicherheit, Hygiene, Umwelt und Qualität (cGMP) Mitverantwortlich für die Erstellung und Überwachung der Budgets (Instandhaltung, Umstellung, Pauschalprojekte und Investitionen) Umsetzung und Entwicklung der aktuellen Instandhaltungsstrategie zur Sicherstellung der erforderlichen Anlagenverfügbarkeit unter Berücksichtigung der Wirtschaftlichkeit Einhaltung von technischen Richtlinien und Gesetzen wie Lonza Standards, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), etc. Umsetzung der Vision und Kultur des Unternehmens und Förderung des Transfers von technischem Know-how an die Mitglieder des Instandhaltungsteams. Ihr Anforderungsprofil: Technikerschule (HF) / Fachhochschulstudium (FH) / Hochschulstudium (ETH) Fachrichtung Maschinenbau oder Verfahrenstechnik Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Engineering im GMP-Umfeld Kenntnisse in MS-Office, SAP, COMOS Selbständiges, strukturiertes und flexibles Arbeiten, belastbar, starker Teamplayer mit ausgeprägter Motivationsfähigkeit und sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten Strukturierter lösungsorientierter Arbeitsstil, innovativ und offen für neue Ideen Verständnis für Geschäfts- und Finanzprozesse Fliessende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse Lonza’s Produkte und Services wirken sich täglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Für uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschäftsergebnisse erreichen ist für uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schützen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Erfolg für uns bedeutet moralisch vertretbarer Fortschritt. Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Ansätze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lösen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

In a world that's changing faster than ever. Our global promise: "Building a better working world" guides our more than 300,000 employees around the globe and provides the basis for the work we do every day. With our innovative services in audit, tax, transaction and management consulting, we lead our clients into the future. In Consulting, you will be involved in management and business consulting. We provide seamless, consistent and high-quality services to our clients around the world. Our team works collaboratively with our clients to manage engagements and lead teams across all aspects of the CFO`s agenda. The needs of our clients are driven by global trends within a firm`s finance function as well as wider business transformations. Line of Service Advisory Industry/Sector Not Applicable Specialism Operations Management Level Senior Associate Job Description & Summary Your tasks You will, together with the team, deliver high-impact projects engaging with senior stakeholders from high-profile clients across the Life Sciences industry. The projects typically include transforming operating models and implementing digital and analytics platforms across R&D. This includes driving productivity gains though process automation and enabling insights from advanced analytics and AI. The outcomes we help clients deliver include driving faster development timelines, exploiting internal and external data through advanced analytics and machine learning, improving quality and compliance amongst many others. The functions covered include all those across R&D, with particular focus on early and full development, regulatory affairs, product safely and medical affairs. The role will work closely with our consulting teams covering commercial, market access and other functions across the Life Sciences value chain. You will work with international clients and we will provide you the opportunity to gain experience working in multi-cultural teams within Switzerland and abroad. You will be collaborating with PwCs global network of life sciences R&D and Technology experts, you will access to our market leading propositions, methodologies, assets and training materials. You will work in a fast growing team. The environment is driven by respect, collegiality and strong teamwork. Your profile You have a Bachelors or Masters degree in a science-related discipline plus experience working in life sciences, either as a consultant or within R&D at a life sciences company. You have had exposure to some of the following areas: digital strategy development, operating model design, process improvement, technology implementation and digital & analytics technologies in an R&D environment. If you are from the industry, you will have experience in some of the steps needed to bring an asset to market. You pay attention to detail, have strong problem-solving skills and are technologically proficient. You have excellent teamworking, interpersonal, listening and communication skills. You are fluent in English and ideally have knowledge of German and/or French and you have travel mobility to serve international clients. You are a passionate team player during worktime and enjoy socializing with clients and colleagues after work. job_description: &lt;h2&gt;Aufgaben&lt;/h2&gt; &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; In dieser spannenden und vielseitigen Funktion arbeiten Sie an der Umsetzung von Umbauten, Neubauten, R&amp;uuml;ckbauten sowie Kleinprojekten. Sie sind f&amp;uuml;r die personelle und fachliche F&amp;uuml;hrung der Mitarbeitenden sowie der externen Ressourcen in den Projekten verantwortlich. Ihre T&amp;auml;tigkeiten reichen von der Planung und Organisation bis hin zur termingerechten Umsetzung, Durchf&amp;uuml;hrung sowie Koordination der Projektschritte sowie &amp;ndash;beteiligten. Sie stellen die Zusammenarbeit mit der Gesch&amp;auml;ftsf&amp;uuml;hrung und dem Team sowie zwischen den internen und externen Schnittstellen sicher. Zu Ihren t&amp;auml;glichen Aufgaben geh&amp;ouml;ren die Personaleinsatzplanung inkl. Kostenkontrolle sowie die Umsetzung der Verkaufsf&amp;ouml;rderungsmassnahmen. Allgemeine administrative Aufgaben runden Ihre abwechslungsreiche T&amp;auml;tigkeit in unserem erfolgreichen Unternehmen ab. &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; &lt;h2&gt;Anforderungen&lt;/h2&gt; &lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt; Sie verf&amp;uuml;gen &amp;uuml;ber eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Polydesigner/-in 3D oder eine handwerkliche Ausbildung mit einer gestalterischen Zusatzausbildung. In Ihren bisherigen T&amp;auml;tigkeiten haben Sie bereits in diversen Projekten mitgearbeitet und konnten Ihre analytischen F&amp;auml;higkeiten einsetzen. Zudem verf&amp;uuml;gen Sie &amp;uuml;ber ein gutes Organisationstalent, gute EDV-Kenntnisse sowie technisches Flair und arbeiten selbst&amp;auml;ndig und exakt. Flexibilit&amp;auml;t, Eigeninitiative und ein sicheres Auftreten zeichnen Sie weiter aus. F&amp;uuml;r die Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Anspruchsgruppen sind wir auf ein stilsicheres, m&amp;uuml;ndliches wie auch schriftliches Deutsch sowie auf Franz&amp;ouml;sischkenntnisse angewiesen. Weitere Fremdsprachen sind von Vorteil. Ausserdem besitzen Sie den Fahrzeugausweis B. F&amp;uuml;r die vielseitigen Aufgaben setzen wir eine strukturierte, verantwortungsbewusste und selbstst&amp;auml;ndige Arbeitsweise sowie einen sehr versierten Umgang mit MS-Office Programmen voraus.

At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, weve become one of the worlds leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world. ASPIRE is a multi-year program that will define, design, and deploy Future ERP solutions based on SAP S/4 HANA and other cloud/on-premise technology platforms. The program will enable simplified, standardized, and harmonized global business processes by using SAP, Life Science Industry and Roche best practices. The Engagement and Change Management Lead will be a key role working closely with the ASPIRE Program team and Roche ERP Leadership team to achieve a true step change in how ASPIRE transformation is delivered into Roche to improve the business benefits and reduce the TCO of the ERP systems for Roche. The Engagement and Change Management Lead role will be a strategic role and be directly accountable for leading comprehensive bottom-up assessment of transformation and change management opportunities and capabilities and working with the ASPIRE IT and Roche ERP teams to structure and size the opportunities to deliver the results of ASPIRE to Roche. This will combine processes, solutions (template, automation, technologies) and ways of implementing change (agile, training, process, procedure, communication, etc.) to achieve the expected benefits. This role ensures a consistent approach to the IT change management, training, communication globally and delivers efficient and effective governance of the global transformation agenda, which spans functions, businesses and regions. Your primary responsibilities include: Strong collaboration with ASPIRE Program team, Workstream leads and Project team members Define the ASPIRE IT engagement and change management roadmaps and strategies Define and lead the transformation governance Lead the transformation team (communication, OCM, training) to a high performing team delivering on its commitments Manage the IT transformation capability (change management, training, communication) accelerating transformation and value creation to drive toward the expected outcomes Support the change delivery of ASPIRE program and projects You bring the following qualifications: Masters, MBA degree level or equivalent in business or IT Proven track record of successfully managing large scale global ERP/ SAP transformations +10 years of experience in Organizational Change Management, Training, Communication and Coaching Background in ERP project management, focusing on implementation projects, typically in the area of Lifesciences and IT Demonstrated ability to influence and foster collaborative relationships with ability to engage resources outside of direct-control to gain consensus, meet deadlines and achieve goals and objectives stakeholders in a highly complex cross-functional, global environment Outstanding communication skills are essential with the ability to communicate credibly and effectively on appropriate details level, across the program team from technology oriented team members, internal executives in Program Leadership and sponsors Excellent leadership (VACC), management and interpersonal skills in large enterprise as well as experience in delivering projects using Roche project management methodology (PMM) or equivalent Prior experience with SAP Solution Manager is desirable Are you ready to apply? We are looking for someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. When applying for this position, already project yourself in the future. Think about what could come next and how you wish to build your future. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Business Services & Support, Business Services & Support > Business Services

GF Machining Solutions is one of three divisions of GF, headquartered in Biel/Bienne (Switzerland). GF Machining Solutions is one of the world’s leading providers of complete solutions to the tool and mold making industry and to manufacturers of precision components. The division is present in more than 50 countries with its own sales companies. The key customer segments are the aerospace, the Information and Communication Technology (ICT) as well as the electronic, medical, and automotive industries.    Event Specialist   Temp position - 5 months       Switzerland, Bienne      Workload: 100%      Your tasks   The Event specialist is responsible for the production and for the follow up of external and internal events from conception through to completion depending on the size of the event. He/she acts in direct link with local marketing all over the world.    He/She will work on EMO Milan organisation from July to end of October 2021.    Your mission :     Implementation of GF MS event strategy, that must be applied by Sales companies in local events, to ensure our consistent image on exhibitions and conventions.  Development, production and delivery of projects from proposal up to delivery (e.g. timelines, venues, suppliers, legal obligations, staffing and budgets).  Delivering events on time, within budget, that meet (or exceed) expectations.  Producing detailed proposals for events agreeing to, and managing a budget.  Coordinating of venue management, caterers, stand designers, contractors and equipment hire.  Identifying and securing speakers or special guests.  Planning room layouts and the entertainment programme, scheduling workshops and demonstrations.  Coordinating staffing requirements and staff briefings.  Liaising with marketing and comm. colleagues to promote the event.  Coordinating suppliers, handling client queries and troubleshooting on the day of the event to ensure that all runs smoothly.  Post-event evaluation (including data entry and analysis and producing reports for event stakeholders).    Be on site in Milano 2 weeks before EMO and during EMO.     Your profile     Education & Training: Degree in Communication and/or Marketing   Experience: Experience in event coordination is mandatory, in industrial environment is a plus.   Experience with international/intercultural teams   Strong knowledge and understanding of currents trends in all kind of media   Languages: English fluent – Italian business level.   + at least another language: French, German much appreciated   IT skills: MS Office, SAP is a plus   Personal skills:   excellent organizational skills and attention to detail   project management experience   time-management skills and the ability to work under pressure   problem-solving skills and diplomacy   strong communication, teamwork and negotiation skills   sales and/or marketing skills   the ability to manage budgets   a flexible and adaptable approach.       Our offer     GF assists its employees to maintain work-life balance, for example, by offering flexible work arrangements.   Our employees contribute a lot to our success. This is why GF places great importance to career development. Annually, as an employee, you can discuss how to advance your career with your supervisor.   GF enables its employees to spend quality time with their families after a child is born and grants them two weeks parental leave in addition to the parental leave provided for in the existing collective labour agreement. We also guarantee expectant mothers a full- or part-time job comparable to their previous job if they return to work within one year after the birth of their child.       Your contact      Fanny Brault   fanny.brault@georgfischer.com     GF Machining Solutions Management SA  Rue du Pré-de-la-Fontaine 8  1217 Meyrin  Switzerland

With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 20,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment. CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL's therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally. We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team! Responsibilities Qualifications CSL Behring is a global biotherapeutics leader driven by its promise to save lives. In Bern more than 1600 employees develop and deliver life-saving therapies to treat people with rare and serious medical conditions worldwide. For our location in Bern, we are looking for a Director, Research Innovation Europe (100%) (m/f/d) In this exciting role, you will have lead responsibility for driving research innovation in Europe via identifying and facilitating the integration of new assets and technology opportunities into the Global Research portfolio; and leading the expansion of strategic EU-based Research collaborative relationships to help deliver on Therapeutic Area (TA) and R&D strategies. Main Responsibilities and Accountabilities: Lead the development and evolution of CSL's Research External Innovation strategy in Europe. Lead the proactive identification of EU discovery and pre-clinical innovation opportunities to support CSL's Therapeutic Area strategy and Global Research External Innovation strategy in Europe. Lead the management, growth and establishment of key, strategic collaboration and partnership opportunities with academic institutions, biotech companies and VCs in Europe to drive Research innovation and help deliver on the Global Research External Innovation strategy. Lead the expansion of CSL's early research funding and collaboration initiatives in Europe. Manage the Research External Innovation Europe budget. Lead Research Due Diligence assessments of new technology, partnership and licensing opportunities. Work closely with CSL's Strategy and Business Development and Global Licensing teams to facilitate agreement execution for innovation opportunities that pass Research Due Diligence. Qualifications & Experience: PhD in relevant life sciences discipline with minimum 10 years employment experience in life sciences sector. Proven track record of driving new science and technology platforms into pipeline projects. Postdoctoral experience in the field of Immunology is desirable; experience in Hematology, Thrombosis, Respiratory, Cardiovascular & Metabolic Disease, Neurology, or Transplant will also be highly regarded. Demonstrated proficiency at leading complex multi-faceted projects and managing cross-functional and cross-cultural teams. Must have excellent and proven people/stakeholder management, communication and presentation skills. Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to lead change. Have resource planning, scheduling and budgeting skills. Fluency in English and French skills would be a nice to have. Strong existing networks in European academic, start-up, VC and biotech sector as well as Business development/tech transfer experience in the life sciences will be highly regarded. We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV. CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all. Capabilities Worker Type: Employee Worker Sub Type: Regular

Senior Biostatistician/Head of Statistics and Methodology 50 - 100 % The Institute of Primary Health Care of the University of Bern (BIHAM) is dedicated to train and foster the next generation of primary care physicians and to carry out research in primary health care, pharmacy, epidemiology, and public health. The BIHAM offers a lively, interdisciplinary environment with excellent methodological support and access to a large network of practicing primary care physicians Duties and responsibilities Develop own research lines and obtain peer-review grants Design and conduct statistical analyses from large dataset using complex statistical methods Supervise young and senior health researchers for statistical analyses Write or help writing research protocols and manuscripts for peer-reviewed journals Coordination of team workflow and participation to the recruitment of new team members Possibility of teaching Qualifications and skills Highly motivated with a strong expertise in biostatistics, including in the conduction of multivariate analyses and meta-analyses, using statistical software (Stata, R, ...) University degree in (bio)statistics (PhD or MSc) or any training considered as equivalent (e.g. PhD in epidemiology with a strong training in statistics) Good knowledge of epidemiology concepts Publications in peer-reviewed journals; peer-review grants as an advantage Strong interpersonal and written communication skills and excellent organizational skills. High level of English proficiency Fluency in German and French is an advantage Part of the activity (up to 20%) will be done at the Population Health Laboratory (#PopHealthLab) of the University of Fribourg under the guidance of Prof Arnaud Chiolero, with access to the Swiss School of Public Health (SSPH+) network and activities. Starting date is negotiable. The salary is based on training and experience, according to the university regulations. The BIHAM at the University of Bern offers an international and interdisciplinary environment, closely related to the Institute of Social and Preventive Medicine (www.ispm.unibe.ch) and Clinical Trial Unit (www.ctu.unibe.ch). It encourages independence and flexible working models. It is an equal opportunities employer. For further information on the position, please contact Prof Nicolas Rodondi: Nicolas.Rodondi@insel.ch Please send your application including a letter of motivation and curriculum vitae to Human Resources administration: hr@biham.unibe.ch. Applications are considered until 7th of October, 2021. www.unibe.ch

Join us as a fixed income fund analyst for mutual funds and ETFs and senior ESG expert within our business area Investment Products & Selection in the Sustainability, Research & Investment Solutions division, located in Zurich. This role involves 3 core credentials 1. a deep understanding of the importance of fund manager selection 2. an awareness of the growth opportunity ESG investing presents and 3. strong fixed income acumen. You will be an active member of the fund selection team, providing best in class fixed income fund solutions to our stakeholders across Credit Suisse Private Banking globally. You will perform a variety of tasks in the areas of fund due diligence and research as well as act as key point of contact for questions related to ESG and the product landscape. In addition to your fund manager research skill set, you will be a strong presenter. Communication of the added value of your selection to relationship managers and investment consultants across Credit Suisse Private Banking will be a cornerstone of your role. Finally, evidence of the ability to help fund selection leaders strengthen and further build a first-class sustainable research process will be highly valued. Your future colleagues Join a highly motivated global team of fund analysts based in Zurich, Hong Kong and Singapore. This is an excellent platform for personal and professional development within a highly committed and collaborative team in an international and fast-paced environment. The team is highly motivated to contribute and further develop the sustainability standards for fund selection and classification and foster know-how on various topics related to sustainable and impact investments. If you consistently strive to learn, improve existing processes and achieve efficiencies, we are the match for your ambition. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Qualifications You’ll be a good match, if you have: University degree or equivalent education At least 4-5 years of experience and deep-know how in fixed income fund selection and analysis. Your experience should show evidence of evaluating sustainable investments. The quality of your work meets high standards, capable of working independently and taking ownership on specific projects. Motivated and flexible can-do attitude, ready to cooperate in a highly collaborative environment contributing to our team’s success Focused and committed person who loves working with a strong attention to detail Strong Power-Point and Excel skills as well as a flair for presentations and advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Morningstar and MSCI ESG would be required. Fluent in English. German and/or French or other languages are a plus. Understands the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work *LI-CSJOB* Ms. V. Hüninger would be delighted to receive your application. Please apply via our career portal. Credit Suisse

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.   The Azure Apps and Infrastructure Specialist Manager is a senior leader within our enterprise sales organization. The Azure Apps and Infrastructure Specialist Manager leads, develops and manages a team of high performing Azure Infrastructure,  Azure App Dev, Azure SAP and Azure Customer Acquisition Specialists to drive solution opportunity revenue and market share by executing the Migrate, Innovate, and enable sales priorities to migrate infrastructure workloads to Azure including SAP, modernize existing applications leveraging the Azure platform and services, and develop Cloud Native applications and solutions built using Microsoft Azure, and related technologies.

Lonza ist heute ein weltweit fhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft ttig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafr, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lsung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbststndig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben mchten. Ibex Solutions ( www.ibex.lonza.com ), ist ein modularer Komplex fr die Entwicklung und Herstellung von biologischen Produkten. Unternehmen knnen damit auf eine Komplettlsung zugreifen, dabei an Schnelligkeit gewinnen und eine vereinfachte Wertschpfungskette erreichen. Der Ibex Komplex ist unser Beitrag fr die Medizin von morgen und mglicherweise der nchste Schritt in deiner Karriere? Starte noch heute deine Karriere bei Lonza. Bewerbe dich als Praktikant im Bereich HR Business Partner in Ibex. Whrend mindestens sechs Monaten untersttzt du die HR Business Partner bei operativen und strategischen Aufgaben. Du erhltst einen Einblick in den Aufgabenbereich eines HR Business Partner sowie die Personalarbeit bei einem global ttigen Unternehmen. Du kriegst die einmalige Mglichkeit im Bereich HR beim Aufbau des modernen Bioparks Ibex Solutions in Visp mitzuarbeiten. Deine Aufgaben: Operative Untersttzung im Tagesgeschft Untersttzung der Manager im Umgang mit dem HR-System Workday Mitwirkung bei der Organisation und Durchfhrung von internen Schulungen und Workshops Selbstndige Erstellung von HR-Reportings Prfen von Dokumenten (Zeugnisse, Vertrge) und Daten im HR-System (organisatorische Anpassungen) Mitwirkung bei internen HR-Projekten und Events Ausarbeitung und Umsetzung von Konzepten Optimierung der Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern Generierung und graphische Aufbereitung von Umfragen Unsere Anforderungen: BSc/MSc in Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Psychologie, Rechtswissenschaften oder hnlichen Studiengngen (keine Berufserfahrung in HR erforderlich) Proaktive, selbstndige und kundenorientierte Arbeitsweise Kommunikations- und Integrationsfhigkeit Affinitt in Planung und Organisation, Priorittensetzung Hohe Affinitt im Umgang mit IT-Tools (SAP, Workday, Excel) Diskretion im Umgang mit vertraulichen Daten Gute Deutsch und Englisch Kenntnisse in Schrift und Sprache Agilitt in einem sehr dynamischen Umfeld Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Anstze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lsen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

Global Controller Sales/R&D/Admin (m/f/d) Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. Our Global Controller Sales/R&D/Admin (m/f/d) plays a key Business Partner role though the analysis and monitoring of divisional and functional costs. As an interface with the relevant functions the role consists of supporting and advising the business on financial matters such as budgeting, work force planning, system innovations, etc. This is a global role relevant for the whole company across all Divisions, BU’s, functions and sites. Key responsibilities: Be a key Business Partner of Function and Division Heads & Budget Owners and steer decisions on Function related topics Driving communications and decisions to the non-finance members Propose and lead improvement initiatives such as workforce planning, system interfaces, predictive analysis, reporting, etc. Build partnerships and strong relationships with all senior managers and their teams Making and supporting business decisions based on financial opportunities and risk analysis Lead review during Outlook and target planning cycles Manage up to 3 Controllers Supervise month end close activities for the functions and planning cycles Support M&A and divestment projects Key requirements: Degree in a Finance related field Minimum 7 years’ experience in finance related functions. At least 2 years of experience in international roles exposed to senior management Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail Interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships and communicate effectively in order to explain financial concepts to non-finance people Ability to influence key decision makers Solid organizational, planning, critical thinking, and problem solving skills Excellent Microsoft Excel skills, and general computer skills particularly with accounting systems (SAP preferred) and reporting (BW) Fluent in English (oral and written) language required Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference. eQuest

Die Entstehung von Tamedia geht auf den 1893 gegrndeten Tages-Anzeiger zurck. Heute umfasst das Medienunternehmen eine grosse Vielfalt fhrender Tages- und Wochenzeitungen, Zeitschriften und Newsplattformen und betreibt die drei grssten Zeitungsdruckereien der Schweiz. Mit ber 1'800 Mitarbeitenden und dem strksten Redaktionsnetzwerk des Landes gestaltet wir die Themen und Debatten aktiv mit, sorgen fr Transparenz und bieten Unterhaltung sowie Orientierung. Die Digitalisierung sehen wir als Chance, unseren Qualittsjournalismus mit Technologie und Innovation erfolgreich in die Zukunft zu fhren. Dafr brauchen wir herausragende Mitarbeitende - von der Entwicklerin bis zum Redaktor. Deshalb vertreten wir einen hohen Anspruch, gewinnen Talente und halten sie. Bei uns finden sie Raum fr gute Arbeit und Mglichkeiten zur individuellen Entwicklung. Customer Care Service Manager*in Pensum verhandelbar, mindestens 80% Deine neue Rolle Im Bereich Services erbringen wir Leistungen im Bereich Services und Sales fr alle Bezahlmedien von Tamedia. Damit stiften wir einen relevanten und wertvollen Beitrag zur Zufriedenheit unserer Leserschaft. Unsere Kernprozesse sind Kundengewinnung und Kundenbindung. Deine Aufgabe ist, unsere Prozesse kontinuierlich zu verbessern. Du nimmst unsere laufenden Prozesse und Arbeitsablufe kritisch unter die Lupe. Dabei erkennst du Verbesserungspotenzial hinsichtlich Effizienz und Effektivitt. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern erarbeitest du Lsungen, die zu uns passen und dafr sorgen, dass wir produktiver werden. Dieser Job ist fr dich, wenn dein Mindset geprgt ist von kontinuierlicher Verbesserung von Prozessen und du es liebst, mit Kennzahlen zu jonglieren. du unser Team mit deiner Erfahrung oder deinem vertieften Theoriewissen in den von uns beschriebenen Themen engagiert untersttzen mchtest. du Freude hast an komplexen Sachverhalten und gerne pragmatische Lsungen gemeinsam mit anderen umsetzt. du deine Kolleginnen und Kollegen auf Deutsch und Franzsisch, mndlich und schriftlich, fr deine Lsungsanstze begeistern kannst. Firmenbeschreibung Die Entstehung von Tamedia geht auf den 1893 gegrndeten Tages-Anzeiger zurck. Heute umfasst das Medienunternehmen eine grosse Vielfalt an Tages- und Wochenzeitungen, Zeitschriften und Newsplattformen sowie Zeitungsdruckereien in der Schweiz. Tamedia gehrt zur TX Group. Mit ber 1800 Mitarbeitenden und einem engagierten Redaktionsnetzwerk gestalten wir Themen und Debatten aktiv mit, sorgen fr Transparenz und bieten Unterhaltung sowie Orientierung. Die Digitalisierung sehen wir als Chance. Gemeinsam wollen wir unseren Qualittsjournalismus mit Technologie und Innovation erfolgreich in die Zukunft fhren. Firmenkultur Uns ist es wichtig, in Bewegung zu sein und die Initiative zu ergreifen. Wir handeln weitsichtig und sind offen fr Neues. Das bieten wir In unserem Arbeitsumfeld kannst du nicht nur dein Aufgabenfeld mitgestalten, sondern auch dich selber weiterentwickeln: Dir steht ein kompetentes Team zur Seite, du kannst dich ber unsere hauseigene TX Academy weiterbilden, und du hast freien Zugang zu all unseren Medien. Nebst guten Anstellungsbedingungen und Sozialleistungen profitierst du auch von diversen Vergnstigungen und fhrst in der ganzen Schweiz kostenlos mit dem Publibike. Standort Zrich

Description Debiopharm Group is a Swiss-headquartered global biopharmaceutical group active in the life science areas of drug development, GMP manufacturing of proprietary drugs, diagnostic tools and investment management. Debiopharm International SA is focused on the development of prescription drugs that target unmet medical needs. The company in-licenses and develops promising drug candidates. The products are commercialized by pharmaceutical out-licensing partners to give access to the largest number of patients worldwide. For our Biostatistics and Data Management Department, we are looking for a: Senior Clinical Data Manager The Senior Clinical Data Manager is accountable for the quality and timelines of all Data Management deliverables for assigned clinical trials, including trials for which data management activities are outsourced to external providers. He/she ensures timely availability of complete, accurate and consistent clinical data to support internal decision making process. He/she is a key member of the clinical study team, and responsible for performing and/or overseeing the set-up, maintenance, control, cleaning and validation of clinical study databases, in compliance with SOPs and regulatory guidelines. He/she works closely with clinical trial managers, Medical directors and Biostatisticians and provides efficient data management support to the study team. Your main responsibilities: Define and manage Clinical Data Management timelines on multiple studies or programs Coordinate/perform CDM activities for assigned studies/programs, including eCRF design, EDC system set up, user acceptance testing, users training, database release, data review and query generation and data coding. Prepare data management plans, data validation plans and other study specific procedures and guidelines in compliance with standard processes and SOPs. Ensure appropriate study specific training is provided to assigned study teams and documented. Ensure ongoing and timely data capture and data cleaning, including external data sources. Provide/coordinate data management support to study teams to support timely and ongoing data review and monitoring. Ensure study timelines are met and data quality is according to high industry standards Lock, transfer and archive databases. Ensure adherence to GCP, regulatory guidelines, standard processes and SOPs. Your profile: Scientific or technical education background, ideally university level Experience of 5 years minimum in clinical data management, with strong experience using major EDC systems and related tools and technologies. Experience of overseeing the set-up, maintenance, control, cleaning and validation of clinical study databases. Experience leading data management studies and teams to timely deliver quality databases that meet regulatory requirements. Oncology experience is strongly desirable. Good planning, organizational and communications skills Ability to effectively work and collaborate in a complex matrix organisation. Fluent in English, good knowledge of French an asset. Debiopharm can offer you: An international and highly dynamic environment. The opportunity to join a successful company, at the forefront of the most advanced scientific developments in the industry. The possibility to be in a company in which innovation, people and entrepreneurship are the fundamentals of its success.

Posted: Sep 2, 2020 Role Number: 200188709 Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Combining groundbreaking machine learning techniques with next-generation hardware, our teams take user experiences to the next level. Key Qualifications Proficiency in an object-oriented programming language, such as Python, Objective-C, C++, and/or Swift. Candidates should have experience completing a moderate-sized software project. Strong problem solving and communication skills. Ideal candidates will also have experience in one of the following: HCI/design, linguistics, neuroscience, medicine, public health, biology, information retrieval, computer graphics, robotics, autonomous systems, applied math/statistics, physics, systems engineering, electrical engineering, sensors/signal processing, databases, distributed systems, data mining, econometrics, cognitive science, and psychology. Thesis, capstone project, internship, co-op, and/or industry experience in these fields will qualify. Description Apples AI/ML residency is a year long program inviting experts in various fields to apply their own domain expertise to build revolutionary machine learning and AI empowered products and experiences. The residency will begin with several weeks of coursework focused on machine learning and deep learning, followed by a project with one of our global machine learning teams. Apple AI/ML residents will be matched with a machine learning research/engineering mentor, and will contribute to their teams research, product design, and development. Some residents may also have the opportunity to publish and present their work at premiere academic conferences. Education & Experience Graduate degree in a STEM field or equivalent industry experience in software engineering.

As one of the world's leaders in industrial chemistry, Clariant creates value with innovative and sustainable chemical products and solutions for customers from different industries. The business unit Industrial & Consumer Specialties is one of the largest providers of specialty chemicals and application solutions for consumer care and industrial markets. Combining chemical industry knowledge with high-performance ingredients and formulation expertise, ICS delivers solutions with the best cost-performance ratios. As Head of Global Supply Chain Management (M/F/D) you will be responsilbe for the design and implemention of solutions for a efficient and state of the art end-to-end supply chain of the business unit. You will act as a change agent to promote and drive supply chain excellence. Your goal is to translate business strategy into differentiated Supply Chain and Cash strategies, whilst taking responsiblity for developing a high performing supply chain organization, effective inventory management, and operational performance management as driver for all strategic business decisions. The best-suited candidate to this position is a result-driven, solution-oriented team player with ability to lead end-to-end projects. He/she has the capability to guide others in cross-functional teamwork by using advance tools & techniques. Intercultural experience, excellent communication, facilitation and conflict resolution skills in a complex and rapidly changing global environment complete the profile. Responsibilities Supply Chain Strategy and Maturity Building Drive sustainable supply chain improvements in the areas of: process-, people-, and systems maturity development, cost optimization, service level improvement and NWC optimization across the entire company Increase capability and maturity of the supply chain organization within end-to-end planning landscape, acting as subject matter expert and coach for Integrated Planning including S&OP best practices implementation Translating market needs per segment into supply chain management requirements, especially in the planning systems and processes landscape in collaboration with Marketing and Clariant Excellence department Develop and implement best practice supply chain solutions into the BUs operating model direct the design and execution of differentiated SC strategies per segment (e.g. agile, efficient, project, collaborative etc.), aligned with BU strategy Oversee the translation of business requirements into a digital supply chain roadmap and operating model, as well as the implementation thereof Drive change and act as a mentor and coach to manage mindset shift within the organization Performance management and continuous improvement Develop and use analytical methodologies to determine key improvement opportunities and create implementation roadmaps in partnership with key stakeholders Define decision framework for regions to define inventory policies, set targets in line with strategy and financial objectives, cascaded per region You will be accountable for the development and improvement of required KPI dashboards to analyse and improve performance vs. targets You will be accountable for Supply Chain related masterdata governance, setting guidelines for performance manager You will need to lead by example to foster unbiased decision-making for overall cross-functional business benefit, embeding a culture of team reflection of successes/failures. You should leverage key internal and external resources to build own content knowledge of industry and business trends Network Optimization & Integrated Processes Execute projects and take active ownership of agreed deliverables, ensure the impact is quantified, communicated, tracked and realized You will oversees the strategic S&OP process to ensure profitable, cross-functional trade-offs. Chairs the Strategic S&OP, and prepares fact-based decision-making proposals to BU MC (e.g. product allocation principles, network optimization etc.) The integration of cross-functional business processes will be directed by you Requirements Higher university degree in relevant field, preferably Masters or higher in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, or similar fields 10+ years of experience in supply chain management, including experience in more than one supply chain function High energy to drive change with strong team work and mindset, ability to coach, train and influence people by balanced application of tools/ techniques, management systems and behaviors Strong consultative and interpersonal skills including: indirect influencing, facilitating, driving for clarity, and securing results when faced with significant ambiguity and/or resistance Proven track record in developing and implementing change management initiatives; capabilities to challenge status quo and develop innovative processes and solutions in an international environment Ability to communicate complex concepts effectively using excellent presentation, verbal and written communication skills in English (additional languages desirable) Solid understanding and demonstrated ability to influence supply chain performance drivers Experienced in using SAP or similar ERP-based systems and can demonstrate a solid understanding of relevant processes Language skills: English mandatory. Other languages such as German, Spanish or Chinese would be advantageous Experienced user in PowerBI, SAP APO Supply Chain Certification (e.g. APICS CSCMP, CPIM) would be advantageous Our Offer A corporate culture based on the spirit of innovation A highly interesting, versatile and challenging work environment The opportunity to shape our future organisation and influence the continued growth and financial success of the business An attractive and performance-based remuneration and the benefits of a modern international company Clariant is a focused and innovative specialty chemical company based near Basel, in Switzerland. Last year the company recorded CHF 4.399 billion in sales harnessing the talents of its 17 000 employees across 50+ countries. Clariant’s portfolio is optimized for future growth, with a focus in three business areas: Care Chemicals, Catalysis and Natural Resources. We believe that our growth is all about our customers and their success. Investment in innovation capabilities and developing inspiring environments for courageous and determined minds are therefore key to reaching our goal. Join us and help create sustainable value through chemistry for customers all over the globe. [Not translated in selected language] Learn more about Clariant Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn Our commitment to people - download our Employment Standards Brochure

Your field of responsibility Join us as an Assistant within our DAC Product Management Team in Global Trading Solutions located in Zurich on the trading floor. You support our DAC Product Management Team in our daily business activities and ensure a high-quality on- and offboarding of our trading-oriented Direct Access Clients. In this role, you ensure that the compliance- and legal standards for the DAC business (cross boarder-rules, suitability & appropriateness, DAC agreement) are always met. You work closely with our DAC Sales Specialists and Relationship Managers in order to deliver best-in class solutions to our clients. Your future colleagues Join our dynamic Global Trading Solutions Team and be part of the exciting trading environment of the bank. You support our DAC Product Management team in onboarding of our sophisticated Clients. This is an excellent platform for personal and professional development within a highly committed and collaborative team in an international and fast-paced environment. We are a department, which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. Your skills and experience You’ll be a good match, if you have: Apprenticeship in Banking Affinity for the trading environment and interested in financial products Understanding of current banking regulations Ability to cope with pressure and a high level of flexibility, responsibility and attention to detail Diligent work approach with respect for our risk and control obligations Fluency in German and English is required, any additional language is an asset Understanding of the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience. Experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary software development projects. Experience with the tools and elements of project management. Experience with owning end-to-end project lifecycle. Preferred qualifications: Experience leading security risk mitigation, technical risk assessment, and integration projects, building key privacy and security engineering principles into non-standard infrastructure. Experience with Data Loss Prevention, Data Protection, Threat Modeling and/or experience with incident or emergency response. Security experience, particularly in either threat modelling, application security, system management, OS hardening, or network security concepts (segmentation, protocols used for layering security capabilities). Understanding of attacker trends/pen testing/breach investigation experience. Strong communication skills and a data-driven analytical approach towards solving complex challenges. About the job A problem isnt truly solved until its solved for all. Thats why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, youll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. Youll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers. Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company. You will help drive increased security across Google's infrastructure, products, services, and partners. You will also lead offensive security exercises to identify vulnerabilities, implement mitigations, roll-out remediation actions, and elevate the security posture of multiple products, services, technologies, and organizations across Alphabet. Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Responsibilities Plan and manage offensive security exercises with internal (and potentially external partners). Guide engagements through the entire project lifecycle. Identify targets, manage project schedules, assess risks, and clearly communicate them to project stakeholders. Communicate analyses and recommendations to senior stakeholders and discuss the technical trade-offs related to securing or mitigating risks. Manage projects of various size and scope, identify future opportunities in process improvements, close out identified risks, and drive the technical direction of your projects. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Responsibilities In this position your main responsibility will be to perform tests according to the specifications and guidelines either on functional engine testbeds, performance & emission testbeds or endurance testbeds Your scope of activities includes tasks such as the installation and deinstallation of the engine in the testbed, the connection, setup and configuration of measurement devices, the engine operation, use of testbed automation tools as well as the validation of test conformity. Additiopnally, you will maintain the daily documentation related to the engine and the installations You perform engine maintenance activities according to the service plan and update components according to the evolution of the product, carry out first level diagnosis in case of an engine failure and light engine repairs on the testbed You are the first point of contact for the test bench/ infrastructure team You ensure the creation of failure reports and inform the responsible persons if damage occurs to a component or an engine Besides, proposals can be made to enhance the test bed efficiency and operation, as well as the engine maintenance, functionality and reliability or engine performance Requirements You have successfully completed your education as light or heavy-duty mechatronics technician or internal combustion engine technician or a similar education You can ideally present several years of professional experience in the field of diesel and gas engines Additionally, you have acquired in-depth knowledge in measuring technologies and tests You possess fluent proficiency in French and good knowledge of English, German would be an advantage You have very good knowledge in MS-Office, besides good knowledge of an ERP system is desired You are interested in new technologies, you are open-minded and you proactively contribute to continuous improvement initiatives Your personality is characterised by a high team spirit, a sense of responsibility, commitment and flexibility Our offer Can we inspire you to take on a responsible position in a dynamic and independent family business? We offer you room for ideas, a secure job, modern employment conditions such as a company restaurant, training opportunities as well as many benefits. The workplace is located in Bulle, surrounded by the wonderful nature of the Gruyère region. Start planning your personal and professional development with us. In order to ensure a fair application process, we cannot accept applications by post or email. Please note that your application can only be processed after the end of the company holidays from 16.08.2021 Many thanks for your understanding. Have we awoken your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any questions, please contact Philipp TSCHUDI at: 0269133111. Liebherr - One Passion. Many Opportunities. The company ​Liebherr Machines Bulle SA is the centre of excellence for combustion engines (diesel and gas engines) and hydraulic components. The company develops and produces various products which are used in the fields of building construction and civil engineering, mining, agriculture, decentralised energy, machine and plant engineering, as well as aerospace. Location Liebherr Machines Bulle SA 7, Rue Hans-Liebherr 1630Bulle Switzerland (CH) Contact Philipp TSCHUDI 0269133111

We're looking for a model developer who will: design, build and test AI models and solutions for business stakeholders and users primarily relying on Python based libraries and frameworks ensure adherence to standards related to our AI development pipeline, model validation, front / back-end interfaces and workflow procedures design and implement reusable Python assets, code templates and ongoing AI development framework enhancements stakeholder management across various levels within the business unit and interact with all relevant GCRG (Group Compliance, Regulatory and Governance) stakeholders collaborate with data architects and IT specialists to support as well the development of a data strategy and bespoke technical infrastructure Your team Methodologies and Models within Group Compliance, Regulatory and Governance is a newly established unit which uses state of the art AI/Machine Learning based solutions, covering the entire non-financial risk control and compliance space. Our mandate is to design and build the next-generation methodology set and AI development pipeline & tooling in an end-to-end responsibility. We are an ambitious team, with a startup setup and entrepreneurial spirit, embedded within a global financial institution. Your expertise university degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Physics, Statistics or Mathematics 2+ years of analytics / statistical model development experience, using advanced quantitative & machine learning methods, applied preferably in financial services, risk & compliance domain fluent in Python or R, strong expertise in Scikit, Pandas, Numpy, Tensorflow, Keras, Spacy, model transparency and interpretability techniques front-end prototyping experience in R Shiny or JS React advantageous understanding of model risk management processes basic understanding of IT and software engineering principles good communication, writing & presentation skills fluency in English required, other languages (e.g. German) advantageous About us Expert advice. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world. We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. Lonza ist heute ein weltweit fhrendes Unternehmen im Bereich Life Sciences mit mehr als 100 Produktionsstandorten und Niederlassungen sowie rund 15000 Vollzeitmitarbeitenden weltweit. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft ttig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafr, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lsung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbststndig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben mchten. Fr unserer Standort Visp suchen wir einen Senior Laborant QC (m/w/d). Aufgaben: Durchfhrung analytischer Methoden (u.a. HPLC, ELISA, Cell based Assays etc.) im GMP-Umfeld Kontrolle und Freigabe von Resultaten, sowie Transfer und Validierung neuer Methoden Betreuung und Qualifizierung von Laborequipment Untersuchen von Abweichungen und unerwarteten Resultaten, Troubleshooting Verfassen und Bearbeiten von qualittsrelevanten Dokumenten (Protokolle, Berichte, Datenextraktion etc.) Evaluation und Implementierung neuer Techniken im Labor, Optimierungsprojekte Betreuung von Lehrlingen, Schulung von Junior-Laboranten Bereitschaftsdienst mit vorab vereinbarten Einstzen im Rahmen des Pikettdiensts Anforderungsprofil: Sie verfgen ber eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Laborant (m/w/d), Fachrichtung Chemie oder Biologie (oder eine hnliche Qualifikation) und haben bereits umfangreiche Berufserfahrung Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Protein-Analytik (Chromatographie / Biochemie/ Bioassay) Erfahrung im GMP-Umfeld Sie sind selbstndig, gewissenhaft und verantwortungsbewusst und besitzen eine gute Kommunikations- und Teamfhigkeit sowie Freude an interdisziplinrer Zusammenarbeit Sie haben Erfahrung mit IT-Systemen der Qualittskontrolle (z.B. LIMS) Flieende Sprachkenntnisse (Wort und Schrift) in Deutsch sowie Grundkenntnisse in English runden ihr Profil ab Es bereitet ihnen Freude, sich auf wechselnden Herausforderungen im Projektumfeld einzulassen und Teil einer diversen Firmenkultur zu werden? Offenheit, Teamfhigkeit und Flexibilitt zeichnen sie aus und ihr Profil wird durch einen effizienten und kooperativen Kommunikationsstil abgerundet? Wir bieten ihnen ein internationales und schnellebiges Umfeld, in dem sie ihr Fhigkeiten entfalten und weiterentwickeln knnen. Wenn sie mehr ber Lonza und diese Position erfahren mchten, freuen wir uns bereits auf den Eingang ihrer Bewerbung. Lonzas Produkte und Services wirken sich tglich positiv auf Millionen von Menschen aus. Fr uns stellt dies nicht nur eine grosse Ehre, sondern auch eine grosse Verantwortung, dar. Wie wir unsere Geschftsergebnisse erreichen ist fr uns genauso wichtig wie unsere Erfolge selbst. Bei Lonza wird Respekt grossgeschrieben und wir schtzen sowohl unsere Mitarbeiter als auch unsere Umwelt. Erfolg fr uns bedeutet moralisch vertretbarer Fortschritt. Menschen werden Teil der Lonza, um herausfordernde und komplexe Problemstellungen durch kreative und innovative Anstze im Bereich Life Sciences zu lsen. Im Gegenzug bieten wir die Zufriedenheit, die mit der Verbesserung des Lebens auf der ganzen Welt einhergeht. Die Zufriedenheit, die damit einhergeht, einen sinnvollen Unterschied zu machen.

Ce que tu fais avancer De la conception de la plate-forme à l'automatisation, en passant par l'implémentation et le suivi, tu participes à l'ensemble du processus des services Internet IP-Plus Business. Tu es également responsable de l'installation, de la configuration et du support des composants du réseau. La surveillance de l'état de nos plates-formes fait également partie de ta mission. Dans un processus d'amélioration continue, tu définis et mets en œuvre des changements pour une satisfaction maximale du client. Tu identifies les causes de dysfonctionnements complexes et y remédies rapidement. Parallèlement, tu crées des instructions pour Upgrades, Security Patches et MACs que tu testes. Le suivi des documentations systèmes existantes est aussi l'une de tes tâches. Grâce à ton expérience, tu définis des architectures pour les projets de plate-forme qui sont techniquement et économiquement réalisables et tu endosses la responsabilité de systèmes et de données à haute sécurité. Pourquoi tu y parviens Diplôme (Uni/HES/ES) en informatique ou expérience professionnelle équivalente Compétences dans la distribution, l'automatisation et la gestion de configuration d'environnements de grande envergure Expérience de plusieurs années dans les procès-verbaux IP Routing, BGP, OSPF et MPLS, ainsi que dans les architectures Internet Routing (IPv4/IPv6) Savoir-faire en programmation Junos et IOS-XR/XE ainsi que dans la prévention et le traitement des attaques DDoS Bonnes connaissances de la programmation script (p. ex. Bash, Perl, Python) ainsi que connaissances de base en microservices et dans la programmation logicielle générale (p. ex. Docker, Kubernetes, C#, C++) Prise en charge régulière des services de piquet pour le 3rd Level Support Bonnes capacités de communication avec les clients et aptitudes en matière de conseil, personnalité flexible, consciente de ses responsabilités et engagée Bon niveau de français et d'allemand à l'écrit et à l'oral, anglais un atout
