About iptiQ iptiQ is a risk tech start-up within Swiss Re Group. Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. iptiQ provides digital, bespoke and transparent L&H and P&C protection products in a B2B2C manner. Founded in 2014, we're transforming the way consumers buy insurance with a unique digital insurance engine which incorporates the latest technology with world-class underwriting capabilities. We build strong partnerships to sell insurance via trusted brands. iptiQ offers a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us? About the team Glad youre interested! Were looking for a tech-savvy person to help shape our digital solutions and change the way insurance is bought online. No more insurance talk that only a lawyer understands, were here to make a difference. If youre passionate about thinking ahead, anticipating bottlenecks and contributing with pragmatism into delivering cross-functional projects within an agile environment, then read on. About the role You will impact and interface between operations, insurance and technology team You will be responsible for implementing insurance system You will make sure that all the potential finance accounting impacts are raised While being subject matter expert in this role you will be acting as mix of project manager and business analyst You will focus efforts on project schedule, cost, and resource management as well as spotlight time and energy on ensuring accurate requirements management About you You have university degree or equivalent qualifications in one of the domains such as Computer Science, Information and Business Management, or other Engineering fields. Master's degree a plus. You have at least six years of combined experience in financial project related to insurance and/or respective consulting with consistent track record You come from P&C Insurance background (with know-how across the value chain especially the financial and accounting aspect and an understanding of the key levers in primary insurance) You have knowledge of one of the insurance systems (Guidewire, INSIS, TIA, Socotra, Majesco and etc.) and experience in their implementation You know how to translate high-level needs from the finance team in detailed requirements for the technology team You are familiar with agile methodology and frameworks such as Scrum and Kanban You worked with MS Excel, Power BI (JIRA, Confluence or other agile project management tool is a plus) You have high-level knowledge of US Gaap, Lux Gaap, IFRS17 You are fluent in English. German or any other Western European language is advantage High levels of organization, detail orientation and results drive, with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to influence others to deliver toward a common goal You are an open-minded team player with clear and effective communication skills What we offer We're a start-up embedded within an organization known for its high-caliber talent and excellent benefits. So, you get the best of both worlds - a fast paced, challenging environment with a genuine work-life balance and more. Do you love thinking ahead and identifying new opportunities or anticipate future challenges? Do you like driving complex, cross-functional projects following agile principles and pragmatism? WHO YOU ARE To secure INGKA Group long term profitable growth and to enable business transformation, the job contributes to the Group Finance Function to lead, steer and support overall Ingka financial reporting by providing Accounting & Reporting services, supporting a strong compliance framework and effective governance. You have a Bachelor or master’s degree in Finance / Accounting, or you are an expert in Financial and Managerial Accounting and Reporting. You have several years of experience in accounting and/or audit in a similar or larger international organization. Knowledge of the multi-site retail industry is a plus. You are an experienced Leader who inspires individuals and teams to accomplish organizational goals. You love working with people and leading teams you always motivate people to perform and grow by providing feedback, coaching and mentoring. You are a tactical and operational business partner, with strong analytical skills, translate business needs into financial consequences and solutions. You are a strong communicator with capacity to influence decisions and create energy and commitment within the organization. You can handle a constantly changing environment with many different stake holders and demands. You are fluent in German as well as in English with strong MS Office Skills. A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US Lead the development of the team based on the INGKA People strategy to secure the right competences, performance and talent succession. Responsible for all financial reporting in compliance with INGKA Group frameworks and local GAAP. Lead the team to achieve global standard frameworks and processes and efficiently deliver the right level of quality of accounting and reporting for business and compliance needs. Responsible for building and maintaining strong business relationships with relevant external stakeholders and act as a trustful and professional business partner with internal stakeholders at all levels of the organization to support reaching overall goals and objectives. Lead cooperation with Group Financial Controlling and Country organization to minimize deviations from standard global frameworks for local business needs and compliance reasons and secures effective ways of working. Participation in global and local projects and support their execution to simplify, harmonize and automate financial operations and reporting. Contribute ideas and insight to the business planning process from country, company, department, matrix perspective and use as a basis for the team action plan. Secure close cooperation with Legal and Tax teams to ensure compliance with legal and tax requirements and enable an efficient and effective external audit process. Secure cross-organizational readiness and continued business growth in terms of competence, performance and succession through enabling an end-to-end approach. ABOUT THIS WORK AREA We see ourselves as influencers – we steer the IKEA business by finding the truth behind the figures. Together we secure compliance with local and international laws and reporting standards; we assure that accounting processes are efficient and that tax compliance meets business needs. We’re a diverse group of people driven by providing reliable financial data to a wide variety of stakeholders. At the end of the day, that’s one of the foundations to make IKEA even better! APPLY NOW! Please submit your application online and make sure to include your CV, motivation letter and any other relevant documents. Unfortunately, paper applications cannot be taken into consideration. Following a first selection, successful candidates will be invited to a video interview.

Position summary About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Deloitte Consulting is one of the fastest growing business consultancies in Switzerland. Our experts develop strategies and solutions that help our clients manage even the most complex of problems. Are you looking for further career development in management consultancy? If so Deloitte is the firm for you. Work youll do: We help CFOs do familiar things differently, make what was exceptional routine and grasp their opportunity to take a strategic leadership role for their organisations in the adoption of digital technologies. In this entry-level position, you will be integrated into a project team right from the start. You will work in a team with experienced colleagues on challenging problems and solutions. You will conduct analyses, take part in workshops, and prepare documents and presentations. We offer you an international, dynamic and young working culture. For you to grow both professionally and personally in the field of Finance Transformation we offer a comprehensive internal and external training programme. You will join a multicultural, team-oriented environment with flat hierarchies. Join our young and motivated team at our branch in Zurich. Team: Our Finance & Performance team specialises in the role of the CFO and how we can help CFOs to strategise about their organisations future performance, catalyse current performance, optimize the operational efficiency of Finance, and provide effective stewardship to protect against loss. We advise, implement and deliver as-a-service solutions, helping our clients develop strategies and capabilities to support enterprise-wide decision-making, improve finance operations, and create impact within their organization. Qualifications To be considered for this role, there are certain qualifications youll have to have. And others that would be really, really nice. Required: You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal-oriented. You have excellent social skills and enjoy working in a diverse environment. You are reliable, willing to take on responsibility and happy to work independently. You communicate confidently in German and English. French would be an advantage. Education and experience: A very good university degree (Master's) Some initial practical experience in Finance topics How youll grow Deloitte is in business to deliver innovation, smart business solutions, and support the success of our clients. To achieve these goals, skilled people and inspired leaders are a requirement. That is why, whether you join Deloitte after university or following years of work experience, a wealth of learning and development opportunities will help you take the steps you need to excel. Learn more about Training Programmes & Assignments. Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. Deloittes culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. Any questions? Please also make sure you mention your starting date availability and your salary expectation in the cover letter. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position. If you have any questions, please contact Bradely Segal at talent@deloitte.ch Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. with research, user research, art, partnership and legal to both define and execute technology development with key partners & suppliers Developing and communicating technology development strategies and status Facilitating and working with teams to proactively alleviate project bottlenecks BS degree in Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or equivalent Experience of people management experience in multi-disciplinary global teams at the intersection of tech and product, including building performing teams and organization Experience supporting an engineering and research organization through technical leadership Demonstrated experience in recruiting and managing technical teams, including performance management Experience in managing teams productizing Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning technologies from conception to end Leadership and interpersonal communication experience in working across many disciplines, drive best practices, and mentor team members Experience managing joint hardware-software development and associated rapid prototyping projects Technical experience in leading teams/projects in one or more of the technical domains of machine perception (i.e., machine vision, deep learning, sensors and robotics) PhD in a related field of Computer Vision, Computer Graphics or AI/Machine Learning Experience in leading teams interfacing with HW (sensors, silicon) teams in setting requirements and product tradeoffs Flexibility and resilience in a dynamic environment Experience in leading teams developing AR Commerce technologies

CH - Basel Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. The Finance Trainee will have the opportunity to support a variety of roles across the finance division and functions over a 24 month rotation starting in September 2022. The position will give insight into financial planning, reporting, controlling and evaluation of investment decisions. This will be a bespoke rotation enabling a dedicated mentorship program to allow a valuable learning experience and a personal development plan. Key responsibilities: The Finance Trainee rotation will be designed based on individual experience and development requirements. The responsibilities during the 24 month rotation may include: Support analysis and delivery of financial reports and financial information for errors and trends Contribute to presenting financial performance, full year forecasts and budget variances including opportunity and risk Involvement in a number of projects, for example, cost center controlling, M&A, divestment, FP&A and continuous improvement Develop understanding of cost drivers and provide insight to non-finance members Assist with internal and year end audits Key requirements: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or similar subject Excellent communication skills in English (German would also be advantageous) Demonstrates Lonza key values of agility, collaboration and driving results Understands how to manage individual and Lonza’s objective and takes accountability to drive personal development Lonza is working with Atrain to recruit the Finance Trainee position, to apply please send you CV, motivation letter, transcriptions and recommendation letter to lonza.finance.trainee@atrain.com Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients lives and we believe that good business means a better world. Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) Ophthalmology is in constant evolution. Our current focus are retinal diseases, but we are constantly looking into novel opportunities such as Dry Eye Disease or Glaucoma. We are now offering a Roche Clinical Fellowship program. In the Ophthalmology group, we are developing cutting edge therapies to prevent blindness. You will be working with a group of Ophthalmologists, scientists, PhD students and Postdocs in the Ophthalmology Department within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) in Basel, Switzerland. You will gain valuable knowledge, contacts and opportunities to further your career.Roche was voted Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work for 2019 The Roche pRED Ophthalmology Clinical Fellowship is a new flagship program designed to diversify and broaden clinical training through exposure to clinical research methodology from the pharmaceutical medicine perspective. The fellowship will be 1 year in duration, primarily based within the Ophthalmology Translational Medicine Group at the Roche Headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. The Ophthalmology team in pRED is responsible for the strategy, design and execution of early phase clinical trials. As a member of Ophthalmology team, you will be part of a truly international group that includes scientists and clinicians that are developing ophthalmic medicines for the future. The position As a Clinical Fellow in the Ophthalmology Department (I2O), you will focus on a clinical research project evaluating fibrosis in neovascular age-related macular degeneration and other retinal diseases. Over many years Roche has generated a wealth of clinical databases from clinical trials and patient registries. The Clinical Fellow on this project will benefit from access to these resources around which the project will be designed and carried out with the support of skilled biostatisticians. Your supervisor will be an experienced member of the Clinical Development team working in Basel. As a Fellow in the Ophthalmology Translational Medicine Group you may: Be involved in the, analysis and interpretation of data from clinical studies in neovascular AMD for molecules early in development as well as marketed compounds. Interact with globally recognized academic experts and clinical investigators Present your findings internally on a regular basis, at scientific meetings, and aim for work to be publishable in high impact journals Generate and present abstracts and oral presentations for external conferences (e.g.,ARVO, AAO, EURETINA etc) and other specialty meetings. Be involved in discussions and initiatives around Ophthalmic Precision Medicine (OPM) and patient selection for therapeutic interventions Eligibility You are an MD (essential) You are a Ophthalmology Senior Resident or Retinal Fellow You have knowledge and clinical experience in the management of retinal diseases You have experience in interpreting multimodal retinal images. You have a can-do, positive mindset with creative ways to resolve topics. You have good English language competency. Duration 1 year temporary contract Location: Roche main campus, Basel Collaborations between pharmaceutical companies, the health service and academia are key to improving patient outcomes and care Understanding drug development, regulation and the reimbursement process is critical for physicians wishing to influence the delivery of healthcare Our fellowships offer a unique insight training for those wishing to participate or conduct clinical trials in their future careers Abundant scope for research opportunities using large impactful datasets and the chance to work with key opinion leaders Are you ready to apply? Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Research & Development, Research & Development > Research

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, theres no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of. The site in Visp is growing and for Ibex Solutions , our recently launched unique biological manufacturing and development concept in Visp, Switzerland , we are currently looking for an Operational Excellence Manager. Become part of this exciting opportunity and apply now! Key responsibilities: Coach and support the organization in innovation projects and train white-, yellow-, and green-belts Drive implementation of Lonza PharmaBiotech & Nutrition operational excellence roadmap, assessing progress and defining actions Work with functional leaders to establish continuous improvement goals Review, report & improve metrics at appropriate levels of the business Align and prioritize innovation initiatives, and projects, ensuring synergies of local improvements with wider transformational objectives Key requirements: Master degree (preferred) or PhD in a Science / Engineering related field such as Pharmaceutical Technology, Chemistry, Process Engineering or equivalent Significant manufacturing experience, ideally in a Biopharmaceutical environment Lean Practitioner and certified Green Belt, ideally Black Belt Certification Strong Project Management skills combined with a structured and solution-oriented work approach Excellent communication skills and interaction with all kinds of internal and external interfaces Fluency in English and German Every day, Lonzas products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference. #LI-SS4

Consulting Marketer About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312’000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. We are looking for an experienced, organized, agile, and team-oriented marketer to temporarily lead our Consulting marketing strategy and execution. The individual will be accountable for creating and executing ROI driven marketing activities using the full marketing suite and will engage with stakeholders across the business unit in order to deliver impactful experiences for our clients. The role involves providing strategic and tactical marketing advice, as well as designing and driving the delivery of campaigns. This is a fixed term opportunity for a minimum of 6 months, starting as soon as possible, with a potential extension. The position will report to the Head of Marketing and is based in our Zurich headquarters. About the role In conjunction with the consulting leadership, define & execute a marketing plan which aligns with the business unit’s growth objectives Lead high-profile marketing initiatives such as thought leadership, events, digital and social media campaigns that present compelling and innovative experiences for our clients whilst ensuring ongoing buy-in and engagement from the business Collaborate with the wider C&I team for example PR, Research, Design Studio and Digital team, in order to deliver distinctiveness in all consulting marketing campaigns Drive the go-to-market agenda within Consulting. This will involve agreeing treatment for priority areas within Consulting, apportioning budget and resource, driving activities and reporting back on ROI. Liaise with global and European marketing counterparts to share knowledge, best practices and to leverage (marketing) assets. Lead a team of 2 Your qualifications & profile Bachelor or Master’s degree in marketing, communications, business administration or economics, with a focus on marketing. 5-8 years of marketing experience (professional services preferred). Influencing skills - the role holder will need to be able to put the marketing function’s views across clearly, articulating the benefits of marketing activity in business terms, and have the confidence to engage with senior audiences. Ability to develop a high-level understanding of complex, technical subject matters and entrepreneurial topics. Experience in executing activities across the full marketing mix and targeting a senior business audience. Excellent organisation skills, ability to run multiple tasks and deliver results. Capable of delivering to short deadlines to keep up with a dynamic market environment. Experience with leading people. Working experience with Salesforce and Marketo an asset. Fluency in English. German or French is a plus. Any questions? Get in touch! We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. Please also make sure you mention your starting date availability and your salary expectation in the cover letter. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position. If you have any questions, please contact Ms. Irina Rusu on talent@deloitte.ch Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 181455

At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are courageous in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. The Oncology Discovery Pharmacology group is offering an internship position in the In Vivo Operations team. As part of the Roche Innovation Center Zurich, we provide the platform for the in vivo preclinical evaluation of innovative cancer therapeutics. With our state of the art animal facility and in vivo tumor models, we bring extensive scientific guidance and support for the development of cancer immuno-therapeutics. During your internship your responsibilities will include: Curation of in-house generated legacy data coming from pre-clinical studies as well as subsequent data management Ensure the quality of study annotation Present updates on work-package in Sprint meetings Cross-comparison of study results Gain cross-functional insight into a global research organization Build collaborative value networks. Get involved in an IT sprint team Get insights in Database development and designing User Interfaces with Oracle and Oracle APEX Who you are We are looking for a highly motivated, flexible and energetic person who is still enrolled in an IT-related Bachelor or Master Program and has strong verbal and written communication skills as well as the ability to work independently and innovatively in a fast-paced environment. You are proactive, creative and detail-oriented and you have top collaboration competency. Moreover, you have: Interest in data management as well as good basic IT skills, including knowledge of MS Excel or similar tools Interest in working in a multidisciplinary and multinational environment Good communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills Good knowledge of English Coding experience in any of the following technologies: HTML, CSS, SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle Application Express (APEX) would be a plus The preferred start date is September/October 2021 for 6-12 months. Please clearly indicate your preferred starting date and duration of the internship in your motivation letter. Applications lacking a motivation letter will not be considered (please provide your motivation letter and CV as one document). Due to regulations non-EU/EFTA citizens must provide a certificate from the university stating that an internship is mandatory as part of the application documents. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Position summary Manager/ Senior Manager Deloitte Forensic, Financial Advisory, Zurich (80-100%) Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Our Forensic team is looking for you! Deloitte Forensic is one of the largest forensic advisory practices in Switzerland. Deloitte Forensic assists clients across a broad spectrum of industries by providing specialist advice relating to fraud, anti-bribery and corruption, anti-money laundering and regulatory investigations. Our work frequently involves highly sensitive engagements, which gain regulatory scrutiny and media attention. We are currently expanding our forensic practice and are seeking talented, highly motivated and innovative practitioners with strong managerial experience in the area of investigations, regulatory enquiries and disputes. Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a broad internal and external training program. What you can expect from us You will be an integral member of a highly successful, collaborative and multi-disciplinary team comprising accounting, fraud and financial crime experts, IT engineers and legal advisors, with whom you will work closely; You will manage and or lead significant worksteams of high profile engagements in order to support our clients in responding to internal and external investigations, regulatory enquiries and disputes; You will have access to leading edge technology and innovative solutions in order to deliver client excellence; You will work with leadership to assist the going to market activities and in the elaboration and the development of new business; and In return for your continued success, enthusiasm and commitment we will provide you with a variety of challenges, a comprehensive training program, innovative performance management process and a structured career path. Your qualifications You have completed a relevant University Degree, with excellent academic credentials and business focus; CPA, CFA, CFE, MBA or other equivalent designation (completed or in progress) is a plus; 5+ years of professional experience in investigations, forensic accounting, asset tracing, ethics/compliance, AML, or litigation services in a professional service firm or in industry; Demonstrate a proven technical excellence in order to manage and execute complex forensic projects such as accounting and fraud investigations, regulatory enquiries and complex business litigation matters: Strong commitment to professional and client service excellence; Understanding of a typical project life cycle: Planning, scope, data collection, data analytics, data review, investigation and reporting; Understanding of forensic tools and technologies, their purpose and functionality, and hands on experience in order to analyse, review, investigate and report; Understanding of forensic approaches and methodologies in order to devise and execute solutions; Ability to translate business requests into technical requirements; Ability to effectively communicate findings to key stakeholders in a factual, clear and concise manner, using a variety of methods memorandum, report, oral; and Ability to succinctly summarise complex concepts and issues for multiple stakeholders. Proven ability to deliver the full cycle of project management, balance multiple client projects and other responsibilities through effective planning, time management, delegation and supervision control Proven ability to build an internal and external client base (cross-functional). Prior knowledge and existing relationships in the Swiss market are a big plus; Coach, mentor, counsel, and provide job training for staff; and an international focus of our work also means that you should be willing to travel sometimes and when required. Have a very good command of German and English. Any other additional language would be an advantage. Our approach combines insights and innovation from multiple disciplines with global business and industry expertise to help our clients excel anywhere in the world. As trusted advisors to some of Switzerlands largest organizations, we delivery outstanding impact on the reputation and success of clients in Switzerland and globally. In pursuing this we contribute to a sustainable and prosperous society, and are firm believers in the positive impact business can and should have on the world it operates in. We also foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work in an agile and dynamic environment. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture. We are open to discussing with candidates the different ways in which we are able to support agile ways of working. We recognise that our people are juggling demanding careers with commitments and interests outside of work. Any questions? Get in touch. We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any questions, please contact our talent team at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Requisition code: 180424

Switzerland - Zürich Information Technology (IT), Process, project and program management, Product Management and Development, Quantitative Analysis Group Functions Job Reference # 217136BR City Zürich Job Type Temporary / Contract Your role Are you passionate about delivering robust and scalable robotic process automation solutions? Do you have a knack for understanding business processes and how we can optimize and improve through a combination of process re-engineering and technological changes? Do you have a curious nature, always interested in finding ways to innovate? We’re looking for someone like that to help us: – partner and collaborate with Operations experts and IT teams across the organization to deliver robotic process automation solutions in a dynamic environment – analyze business requirements, design implementable technical solutions that leverage process automation technologies and development best practices – perform integration testing of robot process automation solutions into larger subsystems and the extended automation system – Increase efficiencies by utilizing technology – Drive and extent your skills towards cognitive solutions as well (e.g. machine learning, natural language processing/generation etc.) You'd be engaged as a Contractor, employed by our external Payroll Partner for the duration of the contract Your team You’ll be working in the central Group Operations Robotics Development team in Zurich – the team is part of the regional Service Delivery Transformation team for Group Operations CH/EU Domestic. The team is responsible for identifying and implementing Robotics Process Automation solutions to support CH/EU Domestic service delivery teams in executing their day to day business more efficiently. Your expertise You have: – an engineering or programming background, with experience in Robot Process Automation Tools (preferably Automation Anywhere Enterprise) – More than 2 years of coding experience – strong software troubleshooting skills, and an understanding of programming constructs (C++, C#, VisualBasic, VBA.net, Python, R) in a MS Windows based enterprise software environment – strong analytical, problem-solving and synthesizing skills (you know how to figure stuff out) – rapid comprehension for information technology and a natural ability to solve complex issues – professional experience within Banking Operation would be a helpful asset – fluency in English (German or other language skills are a plus) You are: – curious and collaborative, comfortable working independently as well as in a team – able to multi-task and manage competing priorities in a demanding environment – able to assess new ideas and provide implementable solutions – a confident communicator that can explain technology to non-technical audiences About us Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world. We are present in all major financial centers, and more than 50 countries. Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS promotes equal opportunities. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

ROLE SUMMARY A Biotherapeutics Pharm Sci Team Leader (PSTL) leads multiple interdisciplinary Pharmaceutical Sciences Project Teams (PSPTs). The PSTL also acts as the single point of accountability for Biotherapeutics Pharmaceutical Sciences (BTx PS) on the Global Medicine or Program teams for the assigned projects. The Biotherapeutics PSTL may be assigned to lead projects at any development stage from discovery stage to Proof of Concept (PoC), depending on the needs of the portfolio. ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES The individual will be responsible to engage other subject matter experts as needed. 1) Leading BTx PS Project Teams, which are comprised of scientists from the key disciplines in BTx PS and are responsible for Pharmaceutical Sciences (PS) strategy development and plan execution for the assigned projects, ensuring deliverables are met on time and of high quality. 2) Represents BTx PS as a member of the Global Medicine Team; responsible to drive overall developmental strategy for the projects, which include both internal and in-licensed projects. 3) Working with key stakeholders across commercial, clinical and Pfizer Global Supplies (PGS) to define the product concept and lead the operational planning for assigned projects. 4) Interfacing with Drug Safety, Dev Ops, Global Supply Chain, and Clinical to develop a clinical supply and administration strategy. 5) Acting as a technical leader and ambassador for BTx PS to asset/Global Medicine team, governance bodies and other key stakeholders; representing the BTx PS viewpoint to greater Pfizer and educating stakeholders on BTx PS technologies, opportunities, risks, and work processes. 6) Contributing effectively to the BTx Project Team, ensuring productive two-way communication and alignment of plans between PharmSci and other Lines. 7) Working with Procurement and BTx PS Outsourcing Specialists to manage interactions with third party manufacturers and other vendors necessary for the projects. 8) Ensuring that the PSPT maintains accurate and timely PS project plans, resource forecasts, annual budgets, and related deliverables for the assigned projects. 9) Contributing to continuous improvement efforts within BTx PS. 10) Understanding early portfolio and technologies being developed. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact. Master's level education in biology, biochemistry, biomedical engineering, Pharmacy, Chemical Engineering or an analytical chemistry-based discipline plus 12 years of experience in drug development; demonstrated success in leading scientific teams; excellent oral and written communication skills. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Doctorate level education plus 8 or more years experience in drug development. Other Job Details: Eligible for Relocation Package Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus Additional Location Information: Andover, MA Sunshine Act Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative. EEO & Employment Eligibility Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. Research and Development

Experience in working in an operational BI and Analytics environment Good level of expertise in BI and Analytics Technologies Prior experience and functional knowledge in the areas of Finance and Procurement preferred. Solid grasp of IT service management processes and experience in improving processes. Preferably, ITIL Intermediate certified. Good communication and partner engagement skills Experience in working and collaborating with global multi-functional teams and managing relationships with business customers Experienced in vendor management and working with 3rd parties onshore & offshore. Company Description Writing the future. Together. Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow. By joining Avaloq, youll become a key part of our effort to power the digital transformation of the financial services industry. Our ambition is big and bold to provide full end-to-end digital solutions by combining our leading efficiency with a flexible, responsible digital user experience. Headquartered in Zurich, Avaloq has over 2,000 employees globally. More information is available at www.avaloq.com Job Description Your team The Securities Operations and Trading team is looking for a committed and competent technical IT business analyst to carry out requirement analysis, solution design and parameterization activities. We work closely together both within the team and with other teams, therefore we are looking for a new colleague who in addition to being independent also enjoys collaborating with others! Your mission: Analyse business requirements and processes Evaluate possible scenarios and recommend best business and IT solutions Build and parameterize business solutions in Avaloq Participate in implementation workshops Actively manage client relationship by communicating regularly and providing business consulting services to Avaloq customers Prepare reports and project documents concerning new client requirements, ongoing activities and project status Qualifications What you need: University degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Mathematics or equivalent Excellent programming skills (deep knowledge in PL/SQL is considered as a plus) Strong analytical, problem solving and conceptual skills Strong command of the English language Excellent client-orientation and strong communication skills with a service-oriented attitude Passion for learning and always improving yourself You will get extra points for the following: Italian, German and French languages Experience with banking systems Experience with trading interfaces Additional Information Now lets talk about perks and compensation We offer competitive base salaries and if you prove to be a superstar, you might be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Avaloq aims to share its success with all its employees by paying out Success Share Units depending on its performance in a given year. Dont be shy apply! Avaloq Evolution AG Cornelius Rothhaus, Talent Acquisition Professional Allmendstrasse 140 - 8027 Zrich - Switzerland careers@avaloq.com Please only apply online. As Global Program Safety Lead, your responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Providing expert safety input to the clinical development program for assigned projects/products and being an active member of the Global Program Team (GPT), Global Clinical Team (GCT) and Clinical Trial Team (CTT) Responsibility for safety issue management from formation of Global Program Team (GPT) through Life Cycle Management Developing and responsibility for key internal Novartis safety documents: reviewing these documents regularly and updating as required Responsibility for overall signal detection, monitoring, evaluation, interpretation and appropriate management of safety information, based on information from all relevant line functions, post-marketing data, and other sources Responsibility for documentation/tracking/record keeping of the assigned compounds medical safety activities Initial development and ongoing maintenance of safety information in Core Data Sheet (core global labeling), including addressing safety issues effectively in all project/product labeling indications Responding to inquiries from regulatory authorities or health care professionals on safety issues Leading the preparation of the safety strategy for health authority responses and strategy, in collaboration with other project team members {#400,300#}#/video#] Minimum requirements What you'll bring to the role: Medical Degree or equivalent (preferred), PhD, PharmD or equivalent graduate level health care professional degree required. Specialty Board certification desirable. Useful additional degrees: Post graduate degree in Pharmaceutical Medicine; Master of Public Health in Epidemiology (or equivalent) 3 years clinical experience postdoctoral 5 years drug development experience in a major pharmaceutical company (of which 2 years should be in a global position); including 2 years in safety at an operational or medical position Experience in scientific analysis, clinical safety assessments and regulatory discussions on safety and risk management Prior experience of leading cross-functional, multi-cultural teams Experience in leading cross-functional, multi-cultural teams and of (safety or others) issue management Some restrictions on flexible working may apply and will be discussed at interview if applicable **Some restrictions to flexible working models may apply and will be discussed at interview if applicable Why consider Novartis? 769 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2020, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives. We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working. We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying! Imagine what you could do here at Novartis! We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential. Summer Internship - Corporate Banking Product Streams and Digitalization Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has expanded to be a global leader employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. With groundbreaking leadership, a new unusual strategy and a streamlined global organization, we improve and are set for growth. We partner across businesses, divisions and regions to offer to build innovative and solutions to meet the needs of our clients and to help our employees grow. It is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. Join us and let's shape the future of Credit Suisse together! Duration: 11 weeks Description: This internship will offer you a deep insight into the world of banking and give you exposure to the vast different areas available helping you to discover the ideal fit for your future career Start date: July 1, 2021 Academic Requirements: You are in advanced stages of your Master's studies or have recently graduated and plan to start your professional career within 12 months of completing Summer Internship Your Benefits: International working environment: Work in a Swiss corporation with an international outlook and cultural diversity Shadowing days: An outstanding opportunity to learn and get accustomed with other areas of the bank and expand your knowledge Summer Internship events: The chance to get to know each other at the introduction event where you will gain more information on the Summer Internship Program and you will meet your assigned Buddy. Other exclusive events will be organized for you to help build your network during your Internship Buddy System: You will be assigned a Buddy who will help you to integrate into life at CS and will be your go to contact for any questions you have during your time with us Career Prospects: An opportunity for a position in the Career Start program after successfully completing the summer internship and finishing your studies We offer • A summer internship role in a front business area and product streams and digital business environment • The opportunity to get familiar with Product Owner job profile and to support Product Owners with Product Streams and Digitalization related tasks • A position to support to perform business workshops and to translate the identified use cases into implementable business requirements • Fulfil Product Streams related supporting tasks such as collecting front user feedback and writing meeting minutes • You interact and cooperate with senior management as well as with partners and professionals across the bank • A certain level of independency and accountability • You learn how products/projects will be developed in a digital space based on a scaled agile framework (Scrum) • Opportunity to work in a successful Credit Suisse front business area You Offer You offer • Affinity in digital economy, products/projects, Corporate Banking and IT • Open minded, self-motivated, hands-on personality and team spirit with an innate preference and passion for supporting the development of new products/projects, enhance Corporate Banking product streams, digital business models and ideas • Analytical and conceptual thinking, combined with problem solving capabilities • Good communication skills • Fluency in German and English Ms. D. Fryzowicz would be delighted to receive your application (including cover letter) Please apply via our Career Portal. campusrecruitment.zurich@credit-suisse.com As an equal opportunity employer, welcoming diversity, inclusive state-of-the-art and openness allows us a high-reaching advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. We improve and are set for growth. Are you happy to join forward thinking company? Then we are looking forward to receiving your application today! Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Auf Ihre Kompetenz und Erfahrung bauen wir! Die Migros Bank AG zeichnet sich durch ein transparentes Management, flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege aus. Durch diese Organisationsstruktur schaffen wir die Voraussetzung für ein motivierendes und leistungsorientiertes Arbeitsklima. Für unseren Innovations-Bereich suchen wir Sie, als Software Solution Architect (w/m) Ihre Aufgaben Prüfung der Machbarkeit innovativer Softwarelösungen anhand der Anforderungen aus dem Requirements-Engineering Erstellung der Architektur und Konzeption der bankfachlichen Applikationen Auftragserteilung und Begleitung der Software-Entwickler in Zürich und den ausländischen Entwicklungszentren Unterstützung bei der Inbetriebnahme der gelieferten Software sowie der Analyse und Problembehebung Erstellung und Pflege der Standards und Guidelines Qualitätssicherung der ausgelieferten Softwarekomponenten Unsere Anforderungen Eine abgeschlossene höhere Aus- oder Weiterbildung in Informatik Betreuung der gesamten Entwicklungskette (Front- und Backend) sowie Kentnisse der eingesetzten Technologien HTML, CSS, JS, jQuery, Bootstrap, JSON, Spring, Java EE, PL/SQL Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse mündlich und schriftlich sind eine zwingende Voraussetzung (Arbeitssprachen Deutsch und Englisch; Spezifikationen Englisch) Ausgezeichnete Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten Idealerweise Kenntnisse der Produkte und Kernprozesse einer Bank Unser Angebot Sie arbeiten in einem modernen und agilen Bereich, welcher sich für die Konzeption und Pflege der bankfachlichen Eigenentwicklungen verantwortlich zeigt. Sie arbeiten eng mit unseren inländischen und internationalen Entwicklungspartnern zusammen, welche die von Ihnen definierten technischen Konzepte in den Applikationen umsetzen. Es erwarten Sie hochspannende Projekte in einem dynamischen und sehr gut funktionierenden Team. Wir bieten Ihnen ein interessantes und vielfältiges Aufgabengebiet. Eigeninitiative, Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Entscheidungsfreude: Bei uns sind dies nicht nur Schlagwörter. Sie können sie in Ihrer täglichen Arbeit einsetzen. Unsere Büros befinden sich in Wallisellen, ca. 8 Gehminuten vom Bahnhof, bzw. 1 Minute von der Tramhaltestelle entfernt. Haben wir Ihre Neugier geweckt? Bei der Migros Bank zu arbeiten lohnt sich, unter diesem finden Sie sämtliche Angebote und Vergünstigungen für Mitarbeitende. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständige Online-Bewerbung. Ihre Anfrage werden wir selbstverständlich vertraulich behandeln. Die Migros Bank ist Teil der Migros-Gruppe. Für weitere Stellenangebote besuchen Sie

Basic Info <br/> Location <br/> Z&uuml;rich, Generic, Global <br/> Job type <br/> Full-Time <br/> Contract <br/> Regular/Permanent <br/> Take the next step in your career at ABB, working in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. <br/><br/> In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementation of ABB&rsquo;s global trade compliance program, providing leadership, direction, and oversight for the Group-wide trade compliance organization as it works with government authorities, all levels of ABB management, and ABB&rsquo;s suppliers and customers. You will ensure that products are correctly classified with respect to global trade requirements and that Group companies comply with all applicable export control, sanctions, and customs laws and regulations. You will be reporting to Chief Integrity Officer. <br/><br/> Your responsibilities <br/> Establishing standards for, oversee, and, when appropriate, personally direct Group compliance regarding national and international export control, sanctions, customs, classifications and anti-dumping requirements. <br/> Interacting with and providing senior leaders with risk assessments regarding geopolitical influences on business import and export strategies <br/> Providing global guidance and support in the assessment and execution of anti-dumping measures. <br/> Ensuring the availability and quality of online and other applicable training materials for country, and Division managers, participation in government and other non-ABB training programs. <br/> Designing and implementing a Group-wide communications program for trade compliance while posting and maintaining compliance materials on the inside.abb Group trade compliance portal. <br/> Establishing guidelines regarding external communications on trade compliance issues (e.g., between ABB managers and national/international authorities, industry groups, other NGOs, and expert committees). <br/> Providing trade compliance support for global sourcing and Group-account initiatives and work with TCOs to ensure appropriate coordination with and support for other suppliers and customers worldwide. <br/> Advising ABB management regarding new developments in online or ERP tools that would facilitate implementation of uniform, traceable, and user-friendly compliance processes throughout the Group. <br/> Living ABB&rsquo;s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. <br/> Your background <br/> Master degree in Law or equivalent. <br/> Approx 10 years of trade compliance-related experience, including effective decision-making skills at a senior corporate level <br/> Demonstratable management, organizational, and communications abilities, and a clear understanding of underlying issues relating to international relations and global trade. <br/> In-depth knowledge of government regulatory processes, position-specific legal requirements (export control, sanctions, customs, etc.), and compliance best practices. <br/> Knowledge of the international marketplace, international politics, and global trade-compliance goals and programs <br/> Familiarity with commercial issues and product offerings for industries related to ABB&rsquo;s global trade. <br/> In-depth knowledge of regulatory policies regarding compliance-related product/technology classifications, proven ability for complex decision making. <br/> Leadership ability, credibility, networking skills, and responsiveness to requests for assistance. <br/> High-level communication skills relating to management processes and complex regulatory requirements. <br/> More about us <br/><br/> Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution &ndash; creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. <br/><br/> HQ Talent Acquisition Team <br/> ABB Asea Brown Boveri Ltd <br/><br/> Let&rsquo;s write the future. Together. <br/> We reserve the right to withdraw this posting at any time <br/><br/> Reference Number <br/> <strong>HQ74805422_E1</strong> <br/> Publication date <br/> <strong>2020-06-23</strong>

Switzerland - Zrich Information Technology (IT) Group Functions Job Reference # 216979BR City Zrich Job Type Full Time Your role Are you an enthusiastic technology professional? And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

job_description: Science Project Manager The Swiss based Bachem Group is a public, innovation-driven company specializing in the development and manufacturing of pepTides and oligonucleoTides. As a full service provider Bachem offers products for clinical development and commercial applications as well as a comprehensive catalog and exclusive custom synthesis. With 50 years of experience and subsidiaries in Switzerland, the United States, the United Kingdom and Japan, Bachem is the partner of choice for the biotech and pharma industry worldwide. Bachem. Leading Partner in Tides In order to continue our organic growth, we are constantly looking for talent. We are looking for an experienced Project Manager, who fits well to our highly motivated and dynamic PM team. We are seeking for someone who complements our team capabilities and provides additional input. Your Tasks Project management of interdisciplinary teams (leadership, team building, goal achievement) Structuring and coordinating project specific activities including risk and time management Direct interaction with our global customers Operational activities e.g. generating and monitoring project plans, project documentation Close collaboration with our Business Development group to align with customer needs Participation in internal projects such as portfolio management Your Profile Master degree in a scientific field Well experienced in managing complex projects, ideally with PM certificate Solid knowledge in pharmaceutical value creation processes in the areas of R&D, production and/or quality assurance Team leader skills with attitude to promote collaborative team work and sustainable decision-making Excellent language skills in English; German is a plus Sound knowledge of MS Office incl. MS Project We offer an exciting and challenging job in a dynamic and growing environment, which guarantees diversity and personal advancement. Interested Please submit your application with full supporting documents (motivation letter, CV, testimonials, diplomas) to Iris Hreinsdottir (Senior HR Business Partner), Tel.: +41 58 595 2931

job_description: St. Gallen | Teilzeit 50% | unbefristet | 01.09.2020 | Merchandiser/in Sporttextil und Kinderkonfektion (50%) Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams im Bereich Sport und Kinderkonfektion suchen wir per 01. September 2020 am Standort St. Gallen eine/n Merchandiser/in (50%). Die Arbeitseinsätze sind vorwiegend am Montag-, Mittwoch- und Freitagmorgen sowie teilweise am Samstag, der Arbeitsbeginn ist um 07:00 Uhr. Ihre Aufgaben Sie sorgen für eine optimale Zusammenarbeit mit dem Visual Merchandising im Hause Sie setzen die Warenpräsentationen um und sind verantworlich für die Gestaltung der Warenaufzüge Sie stellen die Warenbestände und Verfügbarkeiten mit dem Sales Support sicher Sie bearbeiten die Parameter und Module, analysieren die Kennzahlen und leiten gewinnbringende Massnahmen ein Sie pflegen einen regen Austausch mit den POS-Managern, Brand und Sales Manager am Hauptsitz sowie mit den Lieferanten Sie bringen mit Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Detailhandelsfachfrau/-mann im Bereich Fashion Sie konnten Berufserfahrung im Fashionbereich sowie im Merchandising und in der Warenbewirtschaftung sammeln Sie arbeiten lösungsorientiert und selbständig, sind zuverlässig und teamfähig Sie verfügen über eine hohe Leistungsbereitschaft, sind engagiert und motiviert Sie haben ein Flair für Zahlen und Prozessabläufe Sie haben eine genaue, strukturierte und effiziente Arbeitsweise Sie treten selbstsicher auf und haben ein modisches und gepflegtes Erscheinungsbild Sie können einen Arbeitsbeginn um 07:00 Uhr gewährleisten Unser Angebot Eine Vielfalt an Möglichkeiten, Aufgaben, Positionen und Herausforderungen – welche ist Ihre? Raum für Ambitionen und kreative Ideen. Die Chance aktiv mitzugestalten. Beruflich und persönlich täglich zu wachsen. Vorankommen. Weiterkommen. Ein attraktives Gesamtpaket aus Personalrabatten, Mitarbeiterkonditionen und Sozialleistungen. Als Teil des Manor Teams mit Stolz und Engagement gemeinsam Erfolge realisieren. PASSIONATE PEOPLE – Für alle, die bewegen wollen! Interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Online-Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestem Eintrittstermin. Papierbewerbungen werden nicht bearbeitet. Diese Stelle möchten wir ohne Headhunter-Profile besetzen. Ihr Kontakt Sylvina Rauber HR Recruiter Region Deutschschweiz JETZT BEWERBEN Die Manor AG mit Hauptsitz in Basel ist Schweizer Marktführerin im Sektor Warenhäuser mit einem Marktanteil von rund 60 Prozent. Insgesamt beschäftigt das Unternehmen 9'000 Mitarbeitende und bildet aktuell 345 Lernende aus. Die Manor AG betreibt 60 Warenhäuser, 31 Manor Food Märkte sowie 27 Manora Restaurants.

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has expanded to be a global force employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. With new leadership, a new strategy and a streamlined global organization, we are set for growth. We partner across businesses, divisions and regions to create innovative solutions to meet the needs of our clientsand to help our employees grow. It is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. Join us and let's shape the future of Credit Suisse together! We Offer An exciting role as Line Business Manager within the business area International Wealth Management. Are you ready to join a highly motivated and expert team within a diverse international environment and take over the following tasks? Data management Manage data including headcount and financials as part of overall budget management process. You will have the chance to drive and support to timely and accurate publish and explain periodic standard reports covering financials and organizational capacity as required. Stakeholder Management Take the opportunity to broaden your network while working closely with the delivery and business teams for budget management. Liaise with vendor management team to onboard and track new hire, time sheets and invoicing. You will benefit from a platform with stakeholder outside your business area such as HR and close collaboration with Chief of Staff on all departmental initiatives. Financial Management Control financials within the area of responsibility and proactively raise issues in case of variances. Produce reports and overviews to explain variances and drive the appropriate controls and remedial actions forward. Communication Management Assist in establishment of town halls, off sites etc as required and produce high quality communication and presentations to share organizational information. Risk and Controls Management Manage, track and take ownership of any deadlines around risk, controls and audit related topics. Project Management Initiate and manage projects that are helping the organization to become more efficient and effective. You Offer /-5 years of relevant Business Management, COO, or Chief of Staff experience within a service delivery organization Bachelors Degree in a relevant field of study Proven project / program management skills within a global team Polished interpersonal skills; strong meeting facilitation skills; and excellent communication skills in English (verbal and written) Advanced Excel and Powerpoint skills and being able to handle and analyze amounts of data A high degree of flexibility and the ability to cope with tight deadlines and a strong focus on quality LI-CSJOB* If you have intellectual curiosity, a passion for learning and the desire to improve processes through digital solutions and technology, you have found the right opportunity. Mr M. Lillywhite would be happy to receive your application. Please apply via our career-portal. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Embracing diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Help our clients successfully manage global challenges Our Deloitte SAP team can help transform your organization and take it to new levels of performance with a suite of solutions centred on the leading-edge SAP S/4 HANA platform. We work with you to plan and implement a full suite of solutions in areas such as enterprise transformation, finance, and supply chain, incorporating advanced technology applications such as artificial intelligence, blockchain, and IoT. How you can make an impact Deloitte Consulting is one of the fastest growing business consultancy firms in Switzerland. Our experts develop strategies and solutions that help our customers manage even the most complex of problems. Is business consultancy your kind of work? Then we're the right company for you. The SAP team delivers business focussed transformation programmes supported by process design, people solutions and technology. We focus on realizing operational improvements and efficiencies across business operations. We partner with the most renowned technology providers globally and combine their tools with our proven expertise to offer the best solutions to our clients.
